email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Wheat Shipment - Tangier to Guangzhou
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Porter,

Could you help us with a shipment of 2,200 MT of wheat from Tangier to Guangzhou? We'd like to know if there are any port congestions in either location, and what your current timeline is for clearing storage at your end.

Best Regards,
Larry

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Wheat Shipment - Tangier to Guangzhou
email_chain.body:
Mr. Porter,

Sorry for the delayed response; I was traveling. I hope the recent weather didn't impact you and your family too much.

We appreciate you accepting our order, and we hope our dealings go smoothly. Could you please provide the required shipping documents your company needs us to prepare? We are happy to comply with your company's standard terms.

Best Regards,
[Name removed]
CEO

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Wheat Shipment - Tangier to Guangzhou - Cargo Status Update
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Porter,

Thanks for the cargo status update. We really appreciate your speedy assistance. I just wanted to give you an update on our side:

We are expecting to receive the shipment by Saturday, March 19th (Assuming this is 2024, I will be more careful in the future).

We also have a special request for the unloading. We would like to unload your warehouse first, and then use a forklift to pick up the cargo. After that, you can close the warehouse for the spring. I believe the steamroller is operating right now. We will gladly pay for any extra costs associated with this process.

With great appreciation,
Mr. Zhang
VP Sales

email_chain.subject: Re: Bill of Lading Number for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Porter,

We are pleased to receive the update from the Shipping Department about the Bill of Lading number. We will forward the request to our procurement department, and they will get back to you as soon as possible.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Shipment of Tanks
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

I just finished my B2B conference call, and we are happy to discuss the possible shipment of tanks. The order would be for 3000 tanks, and we need them to be shipped by August 1st at the latest. The shipment has to be ocean freight, but we need the tanks shipped from the port of origination to the port of destination.

We would be happy to follow your company's terms and conditions for the order. I would be happy to ship a TOT, but if you need more information before then, we can send the relevant document to you.

Thank you very much for your time, and we hope to work with your company in the near future!

Sincerely,
Kobe

email_chain.subject: Update on Tangier Situation
email_chain.body:
Hey Ken,

I hope everything is well with you. We heard back from our contact in Tangier regarding the situation. We were told that there are no other problems, and that the equipment is available. The lead time would be about 7 days.

We were told to confirm the availability of the cargo with the supplier and then make payment.

Let me know if you want to receive the email contact information for the supplier.

Thank you,
Ram

email_chain.subject: Automatic reply: Received your message
email_chain.body:
Good evening,

We received your message. The owner is currently not at the office. We will get back to you once he has responded.

Thank you,

email_chain.subject: Draft Email - Feedback Needed
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

This is my first time drafting these types of emails. If I can get this right, next time should be easier. And that's when I'll need to get others involved in writing similar emails!

Please help me out with this one.

Thanks,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Follow Up: Draft Email - Feedback Needed
email_chain.body:
Hey Matthieu,

Just sent you the email. No rush! It's just for practice.
Remember to email out the month 1 write-ups too!

Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Draft Email - Feedback Needed
email_chain.body:
Hello Alice,

I just received the email. Here's my feedback.

I understand we're only in week 2, but the writing in the first email isn't as polished as it could be. It's a shame because we've already invested time in forming the group, the classroom, and planning.

Writing professionally is crucial for credibility. The current email doesn't quite convey that level of professionalism.

I understand you might have been in a hurry, but I want to give you some tips to improve the writing to save time in the future.

Keep up the effort!

email_chain.subject: Email Drafts 3 & 4 - Need Review
email_chain.body:
Hi Matthieu,

I'm a bit overwhelmed at the moment. I've tried to write as many emails as possible, mainly because you're helping me out. Thanks for this.

Could you check emails 3 and 4?

Thanks,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Email Drafts 3 & 4 - Need Review
email_chain.body:
Email 3 is much better. Here's my feedback on email 4. It's quite long, but I did my best to correct any mistakes.

I'm aware that we've already lost some time in the past few weeks. I'm really sorry about that. I didn't realize my writing would be so subpar. I'm not sure if you still want me to handle the writing, but I feel like I'm learning a lot from it. 

I think of writing as a reflex that can be acquired with practice. There's no point in just waiting for you to get it perfectly right on your own. I appreciate your emails and feedback. Would it be alright if I wrote the next email and copied and pasted content from my mentor's emails to save time? That's my current plan.

By the way, if there's anything else you want me to do, let me know.

email_chain.subject: Outlook Web Access - Editing Draft Emails and Missing Signatures
email_chain.body:
Hello,

I'm experiencing some issues with Outlook and Outlook Web Access (OWA) synchronization.

I started working on an email in Outlook 2016 and published it to my email account in OWA. When I returned to Outlook 2016, the email wasn't fully synchronized, and it seems I can't edit the incomplete version in OWA. Is there a way to edit the email draft directly in OWA?

Also, I've noticed that some of my emails are missing signature blocks.

I'm trying to track down an issue with some bitumen shipment inquiry emails. Let me explain further:

Email 3: Forwarded email
>Dear sir,
>
>Thank you for your recent inquiries on bitumen shipments. I will work on this inquiry and get back to you by next week.
>I am forwarding your inquiry to Jeroen. Should you require any additional information about our services, please feel free to contact me.
>Regards,
>______

However, I noticed email 3 is missing the attached email 4, and email 2 and 4 are missing signature blocks. Is there a way to recover those emails?

Thanks,
Zeca

email_chain.subject: Re: Outlook Web Access - Editing Draft Emails and Missing Signatures
email_chain.body:
Dear Zeca,

Thank you for contacting Microsoft Support. Sorry for the inconvenience you're experiencing.

You can edit email drafts in OWA by following these steps:

1.  Click the email you want to edit.
2.  Click 'More...' > 'Open the item'.
This also allows you to access your mail from any device with a web browser.

Regarding the missing 'Send' button, if you only see a 'Save' button for a new email in Outlook, it suggests the email is in draft mode. In this case, copy the content to a new email and send it from there.

Regarding the signature issue, it is possible the emails were deleted before they were sent.

We hope this helps!

Best regards,
Microsoft Support Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Outlook Web Access - Editing Draft Emails and Missing Signatures
email_chain.body:
Another thing.
When you create a new email, you should be able to see the Send button (in Outlook 2016/2013/2010/2007) or the Save button (in Outlook 2003), and have the other options greyed out. If this is not the case, we need to find out why. It looks like email 4 does not have a send button, only save. This means that you cannot send that email. The email should probably be copied over to a separate email in Outlook and sent from there.

email_chain.subject: RE: Bitumen Shipment Inquiry - Updated Information
email_chain.body:
Hi Sir/Jean,

Kindly see below for the updated information regarding the bitumen shipment inquiry.

Thanks,

Kind regards,
Jeroen

email_chain.subject: Re: Outlook Web Access - Editing Draft Emails and Missing Signatures
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the email.

However, with the provided information I was able to identify that one particular email has been deleted.

Email 5:
>Sir,
>
>Kindly see below for the updated information.
>
>Thanks,
>
>Regards,
>
>_________
Note the lack of a signature line below.

Unfortunately, in your case, email 3 is missing signature 4, and email 2 and 4 are missing signature 1. It's possible that the sender has deleted these emails before they were sent.
I can confirm that the emails are not being sent, they were deleted from my mailbox. This is a security measure taken when email 3 was created (not a complete email).
Since this is a security measure, there is no way to undo it. However, you can contact me to see if we can send out email 3 using another email address.
If we cannot get email 3, we can look into getting email 1.

Why is my Outlook item missing my signature?

How to attach a file to an email

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Vessel Needed for 1600MT FWA from Manzanillo to Cadiz
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Castillo,

Our 1,600 MT of FWA is currently en route to Manzanillo. We require a vessel to transport it to Cadiz.

Could you please advise on the earliest possible laycan in Manzanillo and the latest acceptable arrival time in Cadiz?

Thanks,

Roberto

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for 1600MT FWA from Manzanillo to Cadiz
email_chain.body:
Dear Roberto,

I've checked the schedules, and unfortunately, none of our direct services call at Cadiz. I also reviewed connections through London, but Cadiz isn't a viable option there either.

However, I've identified a potential solution via Vigo, Spain. Would you be open to a port call in Vigo? (Please note this introduces some additional risk due to the onward transport). I see the 'AIS' (assuming you mean a particular vessel or service named AIS) calls into Cadiz on the 21st of August, but that seems outside your timeframe based on your 'urgent' request. However, the 'AIS' only sails to Vigo on the 20th.

If Vigo is acceptable, we could ship to Vigo and arrange trucking for the final leg to Cadiz (assuming this is for the 1,600 MT of FWA). I can prepare the necessary paperwork and provide you with a complete cost breakdown.

Thank you,

Eileen

email_chain.subject: Re: Delay and Potential Damage to Bill of Lading [B/L Ref: XYZ123]
email_chain.body:
We are sorry to learn about the latest reported delay concerning Bill of Lading XYZ123. We anticipated potential issues from the beginning.

You will recall that the cargo was stored in our warehouse when the storm commenced. We had the warehouse and surrounding areas inspected for water damage and confirmed at the time that all goods were safe and no damage was recorded. The same personnel were present after the storm, ensuring the area was clean and free from debris.

We are unsure as to the reason behind your claims of damage, as no visible damage was observed during our inspections. We still feel that it is possible that the goods might have been damaged by pests since the warehouse was located a few meters away from the sea and the waves coming during the storm would have come and crashed on the sea wall and so there was a possibility of insects having entered the warehouse through the...

email_chain.subject: Potassium Nitrate Shipment - Antwerp to Yantian - April 10th
email_chain.body:

We have a 1,400 MT import of potassium nitrate from Antwerp to Yantian scheduled for April 10th. Do you have capacity for this shipment, and can we finalize a CP with a two-day laycan buffer?

Cheers,

John

email_chain.subject: RE: Potassium Nitrate Shipment - Antwerp to Yantian - April 10th
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

The relevant officers have already reviewed the shipment details, and it's been included in your client's allocation. I will send you the CP today. Please note that our standard CP includes a 5-day laycan buffer.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Tan

email_chain.subject: RE: Potassium Nitrate Shipment - Antwerp to Yantian - April 10th
email_chain.body:
Dear Tan,

I've checked my inbox, including spam and junk folders, but I haven't received the CP yet. Could you please confirm it was sent and to which email address? We're eager to review it to finalize arrangements for the proposed shipment.

Many thanks,

John

email_chain.subject: RE: Potassium Nitrate Shipment - Antwerp to Yantian - April 10th
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

The CP was sent as an attachment in an email yesterday evening. It should have reached you by now. Please note again that the CP includes a 5-day laycan buffer.

Regards,

Tan

email_chain.subject: RE: Potassium Nitrate Shipment - Antwerp to Yantian - April 10th
email_chain.body:
Dear Tan,

I'm still unable to locate the email containing the CP. Could you please resend it? We need to review it promptly to confirm the shipment details. We will hold off processing other urgent emails until we receive it.

Regards,

John

email_chain.subject: RE: Potassium Nitrate Shipment - Antwerp to Yantian - April 10th
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

My inbox is only showing three emails at the moment, including this one from you. I'll forward your request to our IT department to investigate potential delivery issues. Please also check with your IT team if emails from our domain are being blocked or filtered. As the CP was sent late yesterday, I will only be able to check in again tomorrow morning (24 April). Kindly do so yourself as well, and call me if you still do not receive the CP.

Regards,

Tan

email_chain.subject: RE: Potassium Nitrate Shipment - Antwerp to Yantian - April 10th
email_chain.body:
Dear Tan,

I did check the CP and it was sent to me. Thank you for your help.

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Booking Tonnage & Singapore to Qeshm Capacity
email_chain.body:
Hello Min,

I hope this email finds you well.

I have a couple of inquiries. First, could you please explain the procedure for booking tonnage with ACI? Second, we're looking for vessel capacity from Singapore to Qeshm. We've heard that space is very tight on that route right now, and ACI came highly recommended for securing cargo. 

Could you please let me know what your plans are for that route and if you can assist us with this shipment?

I look forward to hearing from you.

Regards,
Rebecca Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Booking Tonnage & Singapore to Qeshm Capacity
email_chain.body:
Dear Rebecca,

Thank you for your email. I'm happy to hear you're considering ACI for a new route. I'd be glad to support your container requirements in the future. We haven't experienced any significant route problems with our services. 

I'd like to call you to discuss your specific cargo needs and how we can best assist you. Please let me know your closest port of origin and whether you require TEU or FEU containers.

Sincerely yours,
Min Lee

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry: 5,000 MT Wheat - Brisbane to London
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Taylor,

We are looking to ship 5,000 MT of wheat from Brisbane to London. I am wondering if you have any available vessels that will call in London within the next week or two.

Thanks,

Bill

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Vessel Availability for Grain Shipment from Australia
email_chain.body:
Hey Bill,

My company is seeking to ship 5,000 MT of grain from a port in Australia. I seem to recall you handled my first transaction years back. Could you provide information on any vessels with ETAs in the next week or so? My shipper left Sydney yesterday with similar instructions, and I need some backup options.

Thanks,

Anthony

email_chain.subject: Urgent: 3,000 MT Australian Wheat to Brazil
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Taylor,

We are looking for a vessel to ship 3,000 metric tonnes of Australian wheat to Brazil. This is urgent, and we would appreciate a prompt response.

Regards,

Elena Rodriguez

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Grain Shipment from Brisbane to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hi Bill,

I am shipping grain from the port of Brisbane to Rotterdam.

email_chain.subject: Potential Client Inquiries - Wheat Shipments
email_chain.body:
Hello Bill,

This is John from our Shipping Department at Example Shipping. We are a well-established company with 15 years of experience in shipping and trading. The previous emails from Bill, Anthony, Elena, and John are inquiries from potential buyers. We trade in Wheat, Rice, Corn, Soybean, and Sugar.

These inquiries require your assistance. You can share details of our previous transactions with them. If you are interested in connecting with them directly, let me know, and I can provide their contact information.

We assure you of strict confidentiality and reserve all rights. We will keep this arrangement confidential and offer full compensation for your efforts. If you haven't received a reply from these contacts within 24 hours, we will disclose their identities to you.

Best Regards,

John Smith

email_chain.body:

My email address is emma.jones@example.com and my phone number is 555-123-4567.

Your assistance is greatly appreciated.

Regards,
Emma

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Estimate Request - Chicago to Oslo
email_chain.body:

We are unable to offer consolidated L/Cs. Our standard pricing does not require them. Please find below a cargo price estimate based on your request:

USD 18,234

Regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 16,200 MT Light Aviation Gasoline - Antwerp to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Hello Rachman,

We're looking to ship 16,200 MT of light aviation gasoline from Antwerp to Lisbon by early June. We've worked with you before and appreciate your expertise. Could you please confirm your rates for this shipment?

Best,
Faith

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 16,200 MT Light Aviation Gasoline - Antwerp to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Dear Faith,

Happy to confirm that we can ship the 16,200 MT of light aviation gasoline to Lisbon, Portugal by June 4th.

Please find two price offers below:

A. Brackman Shipping: $0.18 per liter in transit. Shipping charges: Antwerp to Lisbon - $60,478.00 (Includes $19,558.00 for Antwerp port charges and $40,920.00 for Lisbon port charges).

B. Teunissen Shipping: $0.12 per liter in transit. Shipping charges: Antwerp to Lisbon - $39,095.00 (Includes $12,368.00 for Antwerp port charges and $26,727.00 for Lisbon port charges).

Please confirm your preferred option and we can proceed with the booking details.

Best regards,
Rachman

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 16,200 MT Light Aviation Gasoline - Antwerp to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Rachman,

Thank you for the prompt quote. Before we proceed, can you please provide a breakdown of the "Shipping charges" from option B? Specifically, a further description of what the Antwerp charges include? Also, please confirm Vlissingen is *not* involved in Option B, as the email makes it seem. 

Thanks,
Faith

email_chain.subject: Rapeseed Shipment - Antwerp Discharge
email_chain.body:

This is to inform you that your 22,000 MT rapeseed shipment from Poland is scheduled to be discharged in Antwerp next Monday. Please let us know if you require any assistance with the discharge operations.

Thank you,

Hugo

email_chain.subject: Cargo Hold at Anchorage - Customs Clearance
email_chain.body:
Hi Yohana,

Your cargo currently at Anchorage is being held pending customs clearance. Customs requires the cargo to be unloaded for inspection. The customs office is only open on Tuesdays. Is it acceptable for us to arrange unloading for clearance then?

Kind regards,

Conrad
N.V. Velsheda Shipping

email_chain.subject: Special Offer - Antarctica Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hey Yohana,

We have a fantastic offer for you! If you accept the current shipping rate for your 20,000 MT Antarctica shipment and agree to an extended contract, we'll provide a $10,000 bonus. We can also hold the vessel at berth for 3 days to allow ample time for loading.

Let me know if this works for you.

Regards,

Justin

email_chain.subject: Wool Shipment Inquiry - Melbourne to Khoula
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cui,

I would like to ship 10,000 MT of wool from Melbourne to Khoula. I was wondering if your vessel could make port-to-port delivery by the end of May?

Thanks,

Leon

email_chain.subject: Re: Wool Shipment Inquiry - Melbourne to Khoula
email_chain.body:
Dear Leon,

Thank you for your email. 

Our latest arrival in Khoula from Australia was April 1st. The vessel we typically use is currently in New Zealand.

The next vessel scheduled from Melbourne to Khoula is the XH88, departing on May 29th, with an expected arrival in Khoula on June 20th.

Please contact our agent, Mr. Johnson (johnson@shippingcompany.com), to place an order.

Thank you again,

With best regards,

Jake

P.S: Please note the shipping route for this order should be Canningvale - Khoula. Khoula is the final destination for our customer, and Canningvale is our factory location.

email_chain.subject: Re: Wool Shipment Inquiry - Melbourne to Khoula
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cui,

Thank you for your prompt reply.

Regarding the order, could you please provide me with more details on the XH88? Specifically, the ETA in Khoula, port of loading, and departure date. Also, is it possible to charter a smaller vessel for the remaining quantity of 3,000 MT (from Canningvale to Khoula)?

Thank you,

Leon

email_chain.subject: Re: Wool Shipment Inquiry - Melbourne to Khoula
email_chain.body:
Hi Leon,

Thank you for your email.

The ETA of XH88 in Khoula is June 20th.
The port of loading is Melbourne.
The departure date is May 29th.

We will discuss the possibility of a smaller vessel for the remaining quantity and get back to you.

Regards,

Jake

P.S: Please remember to change the shipping route to Canningvale - Khoula, and contact our agent Mr. Johnson to place the order.

email_chain.subject: Re: Wool Shipment Inquiry - Melbourne to Khoula
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cui,

Please confirm the XH88 details with your office. Additionally, please provide information regarding the charter of a smaller vessel from Canningvale to Khoula, ideally with delivery by the end of this month.

Thanks,

Leon

email_chain.subject: Re: Wool Shipment Inquiry - Melbourne to Khoula
email_chain.body:
Dear Leon,

Thank you for your email.

The following is the confirmed information on the XH88:

Ship Name: XH88
Port of Loading: Melbourne
ETA in Khoula: June 20th
Captain: Captain Shaun Bailey

Unfortunately, given the fixed loading port and departure date of the XH88, it is not possible to charter a smaller vessel from Canningvale to Khoula for the remaining 3,000 MT. We can only accommodate shipments from Melbourne on that vessel.

Thank you again,

Regards,

Jake

email_chain.subject: Re: Wool Shipment Inquiry - Melbourne to Khoula
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cui,

Thank

Ron

Ron

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Used Machinery Transport - Antwerp to Kocaeli
email_chain.body:

Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Used Machinery Transport - Antwerp to Kocaeli
email_chain.body:
Max,

Thank you for your inquiry. 24/7 Cargo Service primarily specializes in the transport of live cargo and does not typically handle used machinery shipments.

Unfortunately, we cannot assist you with this particular request. However, we recommend visiting http://www.truckplanet.com for a list of companies specializing in this type of transport.

Please let us know if you require assistance with any other transportation needs. We offer cargo services at competitive rates and are available 24/7.

Kind Regards,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Fish Feed Order - 1500 MT Ready for Loading at Shah Deniz
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Potter,

Your order for 1,500 MT of fish feed has arrived and we are in the process of loading at Shah Deniz. To proceed with loading onto an ocean vessel destined for Tanjung Priok, we require a Proof of Intention (POI). Estimated loading time is projected for June 5th. 

Please send details of the POI and your proposed loading schedule to us by 2:00 PM today.

Thank you,

Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Fish Feed Order - 1500 MT Ready for Loading at Shah Deniz
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We were expecting to receive the vessel details and POI from your end by now. We are operating on a tight schedule for this delivery. Could you please provide the POI details and confirm the estimated loading time by 10:00 PM today? Otherwise, we will have to consider our backup option of sourcing the feed from South Changjiang.

Thank you,

Yan

email_chain.subject: Re: Fish Feed Order - 1500 MT Ready for Loading at Shah Deniz - Update Required
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We appreciate your patience while we worked to secure a suitable vessel. Unfortunately, after reviewing current ocean freight rates, we have determined that sending the fish feed via Less than Container Load (LCL) is more cost-effective. 

Please advise if our team can pick up the order for 1,500 MT of fish feed from your warehouse tomorrow. We require a Proof of Intention (POI) to be released to our driver by 2:00 PM tomorrow. If possible, please also advise of an estimated loading time for the LCL pickup. Otherwise, we will need to proceed with our backup option of sourcing from South Changjiang.

Thank you,

Yan

email_chain.subject: Bitumen Shipment Inquiry - Sohar to Dar es Salaam
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Gray,

We are looking to move approximately 7,500 MT of bitumen from Sohar, Oman to Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Could you please share your earliest loading window in Sohar and let us know if you offer any dispatch incentives for early completion of loading?

Regards,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment Inquiry - Sohar to Dar es Salaam
email_chain.body:
Dear Adam,

Thank you for your inquiry. The earliest available loading window in Sohar is Sunday, July 17th. 

Please let me know if you have any preference regarding the departure port within Sohar (e.g., specific terminal) or if you are interested in exploring any potential volume discounts.

Regards,
Jane Gray

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Shipment Inquiry - Sohar to Dar es Salaam
email_chain.body:
Good evening Jane,

Regarding the July 17th loading date, could you please advise how much flexibility you have surrounding that date? Also, what is your standard procedure for handling unforeseen circumstances that may arise in Dar es Salaam during the discharge operation?

Kind regards,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Vessel Availability - Jet Fuel Panama to Sao Paulo
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

Please confirm: is your vessel available to lift 5,000 MT of jet fuel from Panama to Sao Paulo in early July?

Yours sincerely,
Joanne

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel Availability - Jet Fuel Panama to Sao Paulo
email_chain.body:
Dear Joanne,

Thanks for your prompt response. I've finalized my charter agreement. Could you please provide the name, direct office number, and email address of the primary contact person to coordinate this shipment?

Also, please reconfirm the vessel's availability for the early July dates and if a hold can be placed. 

Thank you again for your assistance.

Yours sincerely,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel Availability - Jet Fuel Panama to Sao Paulo
email_chain.body:
Dear Joanne,

I'm still awaiting your response to my previous email. My charter is confirmed, and I need to secure the vessel booking and issue a USD$1,000,000 Letter of Credit promptly. 

Please advise when I can expect a reply and provide contact details for your office so I can call directly.

Yours sincerely,
Chris

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: Vessel Availability - Jet Fuel Panama to Sao Paulo
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

My apologies for the delayed response. I am Joanne, a vessel coordinator at Clever Cargo.

(Please disregard the prior request, it was sent in error.)

Regarding your request, we are looking into it and will get back to you with the requested contact and availability information as soon as possible.

Yours sincerely,
Joanne

email_chain.subject: Re: RE: Inquiry: Vessel Availability - Jet Fuel Panama to Sao Paulo
email_chain.body:
Dear Joanne,

Thank you for responding. I have sent the charterer's notice for the 5,000 MT of jet fuel.

Could you confirm if the lifting process is underway and whether the fuel will be delivered by your company to the bunkering terminal in Bahia?

Yours sincerely,
Chris

email_chain.subject: RE: RE: Inquiry: Vessel Availability - Jet Fuel Panama to Sao Paulo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chris,

Thank you for your email and the charterer's notice. The assigned vessel is the U5 Okaloosa; she is currently in Trinidad. However, she is being rerouted to Brazil as soon as possible.

Regarding the delivery of the jet fuel, I will confirm...

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 5000 MT Grapes from Trieste to Panama

We are looking to place an order for 5,000 MT of grapes to be shipped from Trieste to Panama. Could you please let me know if you can accommodate this?

Sincerely,

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 5000 MT Grapes from Trieste to Panama
email_chain.body:
John,

Apologies for the delay in replying. Your message was misplaced.

Regarding the grapes, is 3,000 MT the best quantity you can offer at this time? If so, please advise and indicate your preferred mode of payment. Let me know when we can discuss the details.

I look forward to your prompt response.

Sincerely,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 5000 MT Grapes from Trieste to Panama
email_chain.body:
John,

I am currently in New York and can deliver payment via bank transfer. If you can arrange for the delivery of the grapes within 10 days of receiving the funds, we can finalize the deal.

Do you want 3,000 MT or 5,000 MT?

email_chain.subject: Request for R/T Steamship Cargo Quote: Kuala Lumpur to Batumi
email_chain.body:
Hello Douglas,

Please provide a quote for round trip (R/T) steamship cargo from Kuala Lumpur to Batumi. I need the booking confirmed and signed by Friday to avoid potential demurrage charges.

Regards,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for R/T Steamship Cargo Quote: Kuala Lumpur to Batumi
email_chain.body:
Dear Matt,

Thank you for your inquiry. We would be delighted to assist with your shipment. To provide an accurate quote, please provide the following information:

1.  Commodity:
    a. Quantity:
2.  Dimensions and weight per unit:
    b. Container type and quantity (if applicable):
3.  Loading port: Kuala Lumpur
4.  Delivery port: Batumi
5.  Expected Time of Arrival (ETA) at Batumi:

We will prepare a detailed quote as soon as we receive this information. You can expect our response within 1-2 business days.

Regards,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for R/T Steamship Cargo Quote: Kuala Lumpur to Batumi
email_chain.body:
Dear Matt,

Thank you for your prompt response. We will provide this information to you shortly. I would like to remind you that we are targeting to have the booking confirmed and signed by Friday to avoid demurrage.

Regards,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for R/T Steamship Cargo Quote: Kuala Lumpur to Batumi
email_chain.body:
Dear Matt,

Thank you for providing the necessary information. We are currently verifying that your commodities are acceptable for transport by sea and compliant with all relevant regulations. 

Our cargo experts are reviewing your shipment details to ensure compliance with export/import restrictions. Please be aware that certain commodities, such as firearms or restricted animal products, may be subject to limitations. We will individually verify each item to ensure compliance. We will send you a proforma invoice for the booking if everything is in order.

Kind regards,
Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for R/T Steamship Cargo Quote: Kuala Lumpur to Batumi
email_chain.body:
Dear Matt,

We have completed the commodity verification and confirmed that your goods are acceptable for sea transport. Our team is currently finalizing the booking details, and we will send you a proforma invoice shortly.

Please note that this proforma invoice is not a final confirmation of your shipment and does not constitute a binding agreement until we receive your signed confirmation.

We look forward to your prompt confirmation.

Kind regards,
Your Account Manager,
Douglas

email_chain.subject: Fertilizer Shipment - Adana to Damascus - 2000 MT
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Day,

Thank you for your time today. I'm pleased to inform you that we've finalized the purchase of 2,000 MT of fertilizer for shipment from Adana to Damascus. We require delivery by May 20th. Please confirm your availability for this shipment at your earliest convenience, as I need to begin preparing the customs paperwork tomorrow.

My supervisor has mentioned your company's excellent reputation for on-time deliveries. If you could let me know if you have available space on this route, it would be greatly appreciated.

You can reach me at shipper@example.com or our booking office at 01-456-234.

Thanks again for your help,

[Signature]

email_chain.subject: Re: Fertilizer Shipment - Adana to Damascus - Port Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Day,

I'm a bit confused regarding the port options for the Damascus delivery. I understood that the agreed port was Homs. Diverting to Tarsus would significantly increase expenses, as it would necessitate engaging a subcontractor there to handle the onward transport. Apparently, they are already holding paperwork awaiting your authorization. 

I realize this might seem unconventional, but the subcontractor requires confirmation from your side before proceeding. Please advise ASAP.

Thanks!

[Signature]

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Fertilizer Purchase & Transport - Adana to Damascus - 50 MT
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Day,

I'm looking to purchase 50 MT of fertilizer and arrange shipment from Adana to Damascus. Could you please confirm if we can purchase the fertilizer through your office in Adana? I've heard rumors that all the FCA warehouses in the area have closed.

Thanks,

[Signature]

email_chain.subject: Order Status Confirmation - 5,000 MT Fertilizer Delivery to Adana
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Day,

I'm finalizing my daily order and need to confirm the status of our fertilizer delivery for the next 10 days. Could you please verify that we will receive 5,000 MT of fertilizer, delivered from the local warehouse to our designated warehouse in Adana? 

[Signature]

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Status of 10,000 MT Fertilizer Order via Adana
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Day,

Please let me know the status of the 10,000 MT fertilizer order we placed through Adana. We need an update on our daily order as soon as possible.

[Signature]

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Fertilizer Delivery - 5,000 MT - Adana
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Day,

We would like to verify that you received 5,000 MT of fertilizer in Adana from the local warehouse, and confirm that the delivery was completed correctly. Please let us know the status of this order.

[Signature]

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: Taiwan to Chennai
email_chain.body:
Hello John,

How are you doing? Can you please assist with a freight quote for a shipment from Taiwan to Chennai?

Kind regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Unacceptable Customer Service
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

I am really shocked by your lack of responsiveness and basic courtesy. Because of the time I wasted, it became apparent this 'customer' you had me helping doesn't even have an account, and has zero understanding of professional customer service!

What an experience for me, and a very frustrating situation to be in. I've spent the better part of a day trying to deal with what turned out to be a simple request, which you could have processed easily if you had been more responsive in the first place.

Just remember you are dealing with real people, not AI, who are significantly impacted by your responses. There are thousands of companies worldwide who would gladly fill your position, and many would offer far better service.

email_chain.subject: Rate Request - Anhydrous Ammonia - Galveston to Seville
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Moreau,

Please supply me with a rate estimate for the shipment of 3,700 MT of anhydrous ammonia from Galveston to Seville. The cargo needs to be delivered by the end of August. Can you also quote your standard demurrage charge?

Best regards,

Darren Walters

email_chain.subject: RE: Rate Request - Anhydrous Ammonia - Galveston to Seville
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Walters,

Thank you for your email. We can offer a service to Seville. Due to vessel availability, the earliest arrival date in Seville would be September 1st. Our standard demurrage charge for a shipment of 3,700 MT is $1,950.00 per day.

Is this acceptable, and is it within your budget for the transport of this cargo?

Best regards,

Joshua Sosa

email_chain.subject: RE: Rate Request - Anhydrous Ammonia - Galveston to Seville
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Sosa,

Thank you for the rate estimation. My budget is $2,200 (presumably per day for demurrage), and the $1,950 is within this. However, the September 1st arrival is too late for our needs so I will have to look for an earlier solution.

Regards,

David Walters

email_chain.subject: FOB suitability - Shenzhen to Yangon - Die Cast Tooling
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Taylor,

Could you give me your opinion as to whether an FOB basis is a suitable option for 3,000MT of die cast tooling from Shenzhen to Yangon?

Best,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB suitability - Shenzhen to Yangon - Die Cast Tooling
email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

Thank you for getting in touch. While I understand your team might have reservations about using FOB for this shipment given the potentially high shipping costs from Shenzhen, I'd be interested in hearing your specific concerns and discussing this in more detail. Perhaps we can schedule a brief call?

Best,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB suitability - Shenzhen to Yangon - Die Cast Tooling
email_chain.body:
Dear Laura,

I would like to get in touch with you to discuss the details of this project further. Do you have time for a conference call with me today?

Regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB suitability - Shenzhen to Yangon - Die Cast Tooling
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

I'm sorry, but my schedule is very full today. However, I have a team of experts who can assist you with your questions. If you could provide some general questions upfront, we can route them to the appropriate specialist and provide comprehensive answers.

Best,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB suitability - Shenzhen to Yangon - Die Cast Tooling
email_chain.body:
Dear Laura,

I'm specifically interested in your perspective on using FOB pricing for this project. Is there someone within your company who you think would be well-suited to address these specific incoterm concerns?

Regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB suitability - Shenzhen to Yangon - Die Cast Tooling
email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

My colleague Andrew and I are very busy this week and unfortunately are not able to take time for phone calls. I would be happy to connect you with someone in our accounting team who can assist with your enquiry related to FOB implications from a financial standpoint.

Best,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Invoice Inquiry - Die Cast Tooling Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Laura,

I have a specific question about the invoice I received for the die cast tooling shipment. I would like to confirm whether there is a possibility of extending the payment terms, and also request the bank details you need to process the payment.

Regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Invoice Inquiry - Die Cast Tooling Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

Thanks for your note. Laura forwarded your request to me. The payment terms on the invoice are standard for shipments between Shenzhen and Yangon. As a rule, we do not extend payment terms, as most clients remit payment upon delivery of the goods. 

Please find enclosed a copy of our bank details.

Best,
Andrew Jones

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 30,000 MT Iron Ore from Port Hedland to Qingdao

email_chain.subject: Storage Opportunity: 1000MT Stainless Steel - Wuhan

email_chain.subject: Re: Storage Opportunity: 1000MT Stainless Steel - Wuhan
email_chain.body:
Hi Lukas,

We may be able to accommodate your client's requirement. We have a location nearby. 

Could you please provide more cargo details? Is it indeed 1000MT of stainless steel? When is it expected to arrive at the Wuhan terminal?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Jonas,

This is Noah again. I have the opportunity to purchase 10,000 MT of crude oil in the next 10 days. Could you send me a quote to New York and a quote from the same port to Jiangyin in China? Please also include a sea freight rate quote for these two locations.

Thank you,
Noah

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Noah,

Please find our last offer and a revised one attached. We have quite good demand for the mentioned product. We are in need of a quantity of min. 10,000 MT and max. 15,000 MT for one shipment to China from October to November this year.

We offer CFR and CIF prices on FOB, but if you can provide us with a differential for the quoted prices, that would be better. For example: for the FOB price of $60.70, please provide me with a CIF price for that.

I am going to review this offer with the management and will be in touch with you on a suitable date. Thank you for your time and patience.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Following up on Crude Oil
email_chain.body:
Noah,

I would be grateful if you could consider my offer for your contract, since I have shown a great interest and hope to provide the best service.

John

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Noah,

I appreciate that your company offers the most competitive prices. Could you please advise if you can offer DDP, and what would be the cost for this service?

Thanks again for your time and patience.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: RE: Crude Oil Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Noah,

I hope this email finds you well.

I would like to place a buy contract for the crude product you are selling.

We are only interested in CFR and CIF prices. The following ports are available to us for sourcing:

Mainland China (Jiangyin), China (Dalian), China (Zhenjiang), Thailand (Laem Chabang), Philippines (Manila), Japan (Chiba), Taiwan (Kaohsiung), South Korea (Geoje), Indonesia

email_chain.body:
Dear Carolina,

I'm happy to assist you with your shipping needs to Brazil. We are currently handling a shipment of 6,000 MT of plastic granules from Gdansk to Pecem and have experience with this route. We have established relationships with carriers and customs brokers who can ensure smooth transport and clearance in the Pecem area.

email_chain.subject: Brazilian Brokerage Services - Information Sharing
email_chain.body:
Dear Paulo,

On 2017-08-10, I was researching specific brokerage services in Brazil. I connected with Ingo Geladenkamp of Andersen Cartago. He assured me that he could provide a competent team and that his company is ISO certified. He has a good track record of providing qualified brokers, particularly for seaborne and break bulk trades.

While I haven't used his services directly, he has strong local contacts who are readily available for cargo pickup in the ports of Rio, Sao Paulo, Parana, and Pecem. I shared the B/L # with Ingo on 2017-08-14. Hope this helps.

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body:
Hi Christine,

Let me know if you have any questions about transferring the funds. I'm here to help.

Thanks,
Pat

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body:
Hi Pat,

I'm happy to update you on my plan to move my house deposit to you. I'm trying to initiate the transfer now via online banking. It's telling me it could take up to 2 hours.

However, to complete the transfer securely, it's requesting the bank's International Code or SWIFT code. I know you previously said I wouldn't need to enter this, but the Bankwest website (through BNP Paribas) is still requiring it.

I'm not sure why it's asking for the code and can't figure out where to find it. I am able to use the mobile app, but it also needs the code to proceed. Can you please confirm if you have this and let me know what it is?

Thanks,
Christine

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body:
If you could please provide me with the code as soon as possible so that I can move the funds. I'm eager to see the funds arrive in the right place.

Many thanks,
Christine

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body:
Hi Christine,

Here is the code that you can use: BNPBP22F.

It seems there might be a small glitch with the BNP Paribas integration. You should be able to go to the Transfer Funds section of the app and initiate a payment with the code above.

The reason why it's probably asking for the code is that when you go to Transfer Funds and click on the Pay Others section, a pop-up box appears with a field for the code.

I hope that helps. Please let me know if you need anything else.

Best,
Pat

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body:
Thanks very much, Pat!

Sincerely,
Christine

email_chain.subject: Re: House Deposit Transfer
email_chain.body: Sorry to bother you again, Pat, but I'm still having issues with the transfer. It keeps giving me an error message even with the SWIFT code. Could there be another issue?

If possible, we would appreciate being placed on a priority list for vessel availability. If these vessels are currently chartered, could you provide an estimated timeframe for their next availability?

Furthermore, could you provide a list of vessels currently under charter, specifying whether they are deep-sea or shallow-draft vessels?

Peter

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: EXW Quote - 2000 MT Raw Material from Istanbul to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

I am writing to inquire about shipping options from Istanbul to Hamburg. I noticed on your website that you handle EXW shipments.

Could you please provide a quote for shipping 2,000 MT of raw material from Istanbul to Hamburg under EXW terms?

Thank you,

Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: EXW Quote - 2000 MT Raw Material from Istanbul to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Dear Sam,

Thank you for your inquiry. To provide you with an accurate quote, we need clarification on the origin point within Istanbul (e.g., specific warehouse or factory address) and the specific Incoterms being used.  

Also, could you confirm the product details? Are we correct in assuming it's 2000 MT of beans originating from Erzincan with sizes of 100/120/150T?

Alternatively, if you prefer FOB Istanbul terms, please provide the FOB value as specified in your Proforma Invoice. We can handle both EXW and FOB shipments and are happy to assist you.

Best regards,

Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: EXW Quote - 2000 MT Raw Material from Istanbul to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

Yes, your assumption is correct. The product is 2000 MT of beans originating from Erzincan with sizes of 100/120/150T.

The FOB Istanbul value is US$1,270.00 per ton. Please proceed with a quote based on FOB Istanbul.

Thank you,

Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: EXW Quote - 2000 MT Raw Material from Istanbul to Hamburg - FOB Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Sam,

Thank you for providing the FOB terms. We are pleased to offer you a formal quote for shipping 2,000 MT of beans (100/120/150T) from Istanbul to Hamburg at US$1,270.00 per ton FOB Istanbul.

Our payment terms require an advance payment of 50% before delivery, covering export, clearing, loading, trucking, insurance, and all necessary international documentation.

Please confirm the latest date you require the FOB Istanbul shipment by (e.g., March 24th, 2024).

Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Thanks,

Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: EXW Quote - 2000 MT Raw Material from Istanbul to Hamburg - FOB Quote
email_chain.body:
Mike,

Thank you for the quote. Please use US$1,270.00 per ton FOB Istanbul for the invoice. Please let me know when the first installment (50% advance) is due.

Best,

Sam

email_chain.subject: Viewing Your New Home!
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Young!

Please let me know when you're available to meet. I'd love to take you to see your new home!

email_chain.subject: Following Up: Viewing Your New Home
email_chain.body:
Harry,

This is the second time in the past three months I've called your apartment at 7:20 AM on a Sunday morning! Do you happen to have a napkin with a phone number written on it? I've called your cell 30 times, and your voicemail is on "do not accept calls" mode. I hope you'll be home next Sunday because I know you enjoy looking at your new home!

email_chain.subject: Following Up - Our Conversation
email_chain.body:
Mrs. Wilkinson,

It was so nice to finally meet you in person! I really enjoyed your story about vacationing in Puerto Rico. What a colorful time you must have had! I hope your trip back was uneventful. Take care and call me soon. I really enjoyed talking with you!

email_chain.subject: Catching Up
email_chain.body:
Harry,

Can you believe it's been two weeks since we last spoke? I really think I need to...

To provide you with the most accurate quote, could you please furnish the following details?

1.  Origin Port - Yangon
2.  Destination Port - Phnom Penh
3.  Earliest Arrival Date (ETA)
4.  FCL or LCL (Full Container Load or Less than Container Load)
5.  Gross/Metric Weight (already given as 3,200 MT, but confirm)
6.  Name of the Goods (Rice - specify type if possible)
7.  Net Volume Weight (NVW). If the cargo is a mix of different commodities, please provide a breakdown of each.
8.  Ocean container or flat rack required (if applicable)
9.  Any special requirements (carriage of containers on/off, regional lift etc.)
10. Anticipated Shipment Confirmation Date
11. Name, Address, and Telephone Number of the Shipper & Consignee
12. Any specific transit VISA or flight details relevant to the carriage.

Thank you for your cooperation. I look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,

Mr. Rogers

email_chain.subject: Ammonia Shipment Inquiry - 5,000 MT Port Newark to Veracruz
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

Please see below an initial offer for the service of shipment of 5,000 MT of ammonia from Port Newark, New Jersey to Veracruz, Mexico. To provide you with a more detailed and accurate offer, could you please confirm your specific discharge port within Veracruz and verify the required quantity?

Regards,
Bill Pineda

email_chain.subject: Follow Up: Ammonia Shipment Inquiry - Veracruz Discharge Port Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

Could you please confirm the specific port of discharge in Veracruz, Mexico?

Regards,
Bill Pineda

email_chain.subject: Ammonia Sample Test Results
email_chain.body:
Dear Bill,

Sorry for the delay in response. We've completed the sample test for your verification. Our lab tested an average sample of 10 kilograms, representing approximately 10% of the total cargo sample size.

The testing procedure involved:

*   Digesting 50 grams of the sample for 10 minutes.
*   Digesting 100 grams of the sample for 5 minutes.
*   Digesting 50 grams of the sample for 10 minutes.

The best test results from these three tests were used to determine the final result. The resulting pH reading for the test is [Insert pH Reading Here].

The results indicate that the ammonia content is within acceptable limits for acceptance.

Kindly acknowledge receipt of this email for your verification and records.

Thank you,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Acknowledgement of Ammonia Test Results and FOB Sale Offer
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

Your verification of the ammonia test results is hereby acknowledged for our records. We're pleased to see the ammonia content is within acceptable limits.

Regarding your ammonia shipment, we have now agreed to an FOB (Free On Board) sale. We've also sent a separate offer for a quantity of 5,000 MT of ammonia via shipping carrier Alstec.

If you accept our FOB sale offer, please reply to this email to confirm. To accept the shipping carrier offer from Alstec, please reply to the separate email containing the offer.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Bill Pineda

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of FOB Sale - Ammonia Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Bill,

We accept the FOB sale for the shipment of 5,000 MT of ammonia from Port Newark, New Jersey to Veracruz, Mexico. Our FOB sale details are recorded as follows:

*   Supplier: Robert Pitts
*   Purchase order number: 000133709-01
*   Quantity: 5000 MT
*   Item: Ammonia (NH3)
*   Port of Export: Port Newark, New Jersey
*   Port of Discharge: Veracruz, Mexico
*   Cargo Arrival Date: January 1, 2008
*   FOB price: US$ 300,000

Please confirm receipt of this email for your records.

Regards,
Robert Pitts

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Alstec Shipment - Ammonia
email_chain.body:

Regards,
Robert Pitts

Pauline

Cheers for your help.

Jake

email_chain.subject: Pico Interlink - Test Equipment Requirements
email_chain.body:

Could you please review the forwarded information regarding the required test equipment for the installation at Pico Interlink? Please also confirm if there are any changes to the requirements, and if so, update the engineer.

Thanks,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Pico Interlink - Test Equipment Requirements
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

I checked with VIRES, INC. regarding the SF-15 photo tester. The software license required to operate the SF-15 costs between $18,000 and $20,000 (USD). This license needs to be purchased when you intend to use the photo tester.

I suggest you also contact VIRES, INC. directly to discuss lease agreement options for the SF-15.

We'll need to wait for the final PICO Interlink requirements to be confirmed before proceeding. Please also let us know if you require any accessories to fully utilize the SF-15. We are happy to provide any equipment we have in stock. Alternatively, you are welcome to supply your own equipment, which would eliminate our involvement in billing and logistics.

As mentioned previously, we will review the details.

Best regards,
M. Romain

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Steel Coil Supply - China to Spain
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Smith,

I am Aaron, a Senior Purchaser with Superkoala Steel. We are seeking a supplier for steel coils, shipping from China to Spain in bulk quantities. 

Does your company have the capability to fulfill this requirement? If so, could you provide a preliminary quote?

Cheers,
Aaron

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Steel Coil Supply - China to Spain
email_chain.body:
Dear Aaron,

Thank you for your interest. We are confident that our company can meet your steel coil requirements. We have considerable experience exporting to European countries.

We are a well-established and registered Indian company, primarily involved in exporting steel re-rolls. Our state-of-the-art plant includes a 100-tonne capacity meltshop, a quality control laboratory, a high-efficiency submerged arc furnace with automatic control, hot rolling plant, and cold rolling/coil services. We are committed to supplying superior quality steel.

We can also supply iron ore and scrap. Our current production capacity for the international market is a maximum of 3,000 tonnes of Hot Rolled Coils per year. We guarantee 100% Made in India products. Presently, we have the capacity to produce 1,000 tonnes.

I look forward to discussing your specific requirements further.

Sincerely,
Mr. Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Steel Coil Supply - China to Spain
email_chain.body: I look forward to hearing back from you very soon.

email_chain.subject: Incident with New Intern Today
email_chain.body:
Lina,

This email concerns an incident that occurred at work today involving the new intern under your supervision. The intern was ultimately terminated.

To summarize: she arrived late this morning, voiced complaints about feeling isolated without assigned tasks, and generally expressed dissatisfaction. You rightly pointed out that you'd already allocated projects during a team meeting. She then claimed she could easily resolve all the issues due to her intelligence. You gave her the option to go home and consider her approach, but she continued to assert her superior capabilities. Eventually, she did leave to go home, which seemed the best course of action.

I wanted to bring this to your attention promptly.

Regards,
[Supervisor Name]

email_chain.subject: Regarding Today's Incident
email_chain.body:
Lina,

There's something you need to know about me regarding today's incident, although it’s unusual for me to use my first name... [This email appears to be incomplete in the original text].

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 1600 MT Urea to Lagos
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ghosh,

I need to ship 1,600 MT of 36% urea to Lagos. Could you please advise on the quickest route you can offer?

Ideally, I'd prefer to use one of your DP2 vessels, but I'm open to considering your DP1 vessels as well. Are there any CMA CGM ships scheduled to call at Lagos this weekend that you are aware of?

Thank you for your time and assistance. I look forward to your response.

Sincerely,
Narun Patel

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 1600 MT Urea to Lagos
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Patel,

Thank you for your email and inquiry. Serving a single destination like Lagos directly with a dedicated service can be challenging, as our services typically cover multiple ports across Africa with varying schedules.

To determine the most suitable vessel and route, I need to know the origin of your cargo in India. Depending on the specific port, different vessels may be calling. 

You can also check the arrival times for Lagos using CMA CGM's Port Schedule Search Tool:

https://cma-cgmschedules.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/

CMA CGM offers a variety of services that differ by region and port. For available services in Lagos, please use the Schedule Explorer:

https://www.schec-cma-cgm.com/schec/node/en/lagos

Let me know the loading port, and I can provide more specific options.

Best regards,
Amit Ghosh

Ms. Sanders,

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Road Salt Shipment from Narita to Buffalo
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Benson,

I'm planning to ship 20,000 MT of road salt from Narita Airport to Buffalo. I have a few questions regarding storage and insurance:

1. Do you charge a holding fee for storing the cargo at the destination before it's picked up?
2. What is the cost of your insurance policy, both per container and per mile?
3. What would be the insurance premium on 1,200 MT of salt?

Thanks,
Lloyd

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Road Salt Shipment from Narita to Buffalo
email_chain.body:
Lloyd,

I received your email around 6:00 PM and tried to call you back as soon as I got home. Unfortunately, your contact information wasn't automatically available to me. It's frustrating that our systems don't easily share phone numbers. 

It made contacting you back promptly difficult. Is there any way to ensure phone numbers are included in the email labels or body for future communications?

Sincerely,
Dr. Benson

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Road Salt Shipment from Narita to Buffalo
email_chain.body:
Dr. Benson,

Given that you received my email early yesterday morning, I expected to hear back from you about the salt order. I called your office around 11:00 AM yesterday and left a message when no one answered. I also called again around 3:30 PM and left another message. The reason for my concern is that I haven't received a direct response to my email regarding the key questions I asked. Can you please provide the information requested in my initial email?

Regards,
Lloyd

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Methyl Alcohol Shipment from Nanjing to New York
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Martinez,

We are planning a shipment of methyl alcohol from Nanjing to New York in the next two weeks. We're considering a quantity of 4,000 MT. Could you advise if this is a feasible quantity within that timeframe?

Also, could you please provide a freight quote for a potential shipment of 10,000 MT from Nanjing to New York, also within the next two weeks?

Thank you for your time and assistance.

Kindly,
Chris Green

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Methyl Alcohol Shipment from Nanjing to New York
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Green,

Please find attached the proforma invoice for the 4,000 MT methyl alcohol shipment you inquired about. Kindly review and let me know if you approve.

Regarding the 4,000 MT quantity, are you considering any adjustments – perhaps a slightly larger or smaller volume? Also, the freight quote for a 10,000 MT shipment is available upon request. Please confirm if you'd like me to proceed with obtaining that for you.

Regards,
Ana Martinez

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry: 20,000 MT Automotive Oils - Lianyungang to Ras al-Khaimah
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Carter,

I need to import 20,000 MT of automotive oils from Lianyungang to Ras al-Khaimah and am evaluating two potential shipping options:

Option A:
*   45-day sailing from Weihai to Jebel Ali via Singapore.
*   Equivalent to approximately 33 x 40' containers (assuming ~600 MT per container). Original request stated six containers of 400MT each, which is not equivalent to 20,000 MT. Changed this assumption for coherence. 

Option B:
*   45-day sailing from Qingdao to Fujairah via Algeciras, Cartagena, and Singapore.
*   Equivalent to approximately 40 x 40' containers (assuming ~500 MT per container). Original request stated one 45' container of five containers of 500MT each, which is not equivalent to 20,000 MT. Changed this assumption for coherence. 

Could you please provide available shipping options and associated costs for both scenarios, including total demurrage charges at the destination ports (Jebel Ali and Fujairah, respectively)?

Regards,
Amanda Lee

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry: Singapore & Amman to Ras Al Khaimah & Fujairah - Seeking Alternative Port
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Carter,

I am currently receiving supplies from Singapore and Amman, but my current receiving port is proving too distant from the client, resulting in delivery delays. I'm looking for alternative shipping solutions to reduce transit time.

My current shipments consist of:

*   2 x 40' containers (approximately 200 MT total) from Singapore to Ras Al Khaimah, currently routed via Jebel Ali and Doha.
*   1 x 40' container (approximately 200 MT total) from Amman to Fujairah, currently routed via Jebel Ali and Doha.

Could you please provide information on alternative shipping options for these routes, and advise on the total demurrage charges at Ras Al Khaimah and Fujairah?

Regards,
Patrick Smith

email_chain.subject: Qinhuangdao Trip Update
email_chain.body:
OK, so I need to round up 3 people for the Qinhuangdao trip tomorrow and I am waiting for the third one to confirm.

010-68102088
Patrick, 13832066888

email_chain.subject: Re: ...
email_chain.body:
Hi Patrick,

I'm doing fine, thanks.

Sorry for my late response. Thanks for the advice, I quit that thing 6 months ago because it was too expensive.

The dump will be finalized for $19 on Monday. But the requirement of 2 laptops is quite strict. It's very cold and windy there.

The couple mentioned earlier is from Tokyo, so please don't worry about them.

We will be back in Beijing around January 5th. Thanks very much for all your help!

I'll email you on my next trip if I need help again.

Please let me know if you need anything from me.

We're planning to book a taxi to Hangzhou and then a shuttle bus to Beijing from there. You're welcome to visit us if you're around.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 4200 MT Epoxy Shipment - Qingdao to Hong Kong
email_chain.body:

Thanks,
Gerald

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: 4200 MT Epoxy Shipment - Qingdao to Hong Kong
email_chain.body:
Mr. Qiu,

Regarding the freight bill from last week, thank you, we agree with your quoted China export CFR price to Hong Kong at $700 per metric ton in total.

However, there seems to be a discrepancy in the weight. Please deduct the weight for the two bags of garbage and four empty pallets. Could you please re-check the weight of the cargo, which should be closer to 4,180 tons?

Based on the adjusted weight, the final price should be $682/MT. Can you kindly confirm this final price?

Thank you.
Gerald

email_chain.body:

It's Marlene. I just wanted to give you a quick call to discuss whether you are still available for my brother's meeting with an employer on April 17th. I talked with Mary and she is also available if you are, so I hope it's good for both of you.

Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Brother's Meeting on April 17th
email_chain.body: Thank you for your message, unfortunately, we will not be able to make it this time. I am extremely busy at work, but please do let me know if anything changes and I will do my best to make it happen.

I hope you are doing well. I was wondering if I could get a quote for a shipment of 2,900 MT of furniture for VITRA from Qingdao to Hong Kong. They want the shipment by April 25th.

We are also getting 2,400 MT of lamps from Qingdao to be delivered at the same time. Could we get a combined quote, please?

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Importing Commodities from China
email_chain.body:
Good evening Mr. Galloway,

I understand you have experience working in China, and I would greatly appreciate your advice on importing commodities from there. Could you recommend resources for obtaining reliable data on prices, delivery dates, and duty implications?

With best wishes,

Michael Smith

email_chain.subject: Regarding Mr. Gupta and Potential Business
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Following up on my previous communications, I am writing to inquire about any goods you might wish to place with Mr. Gupta, whom I believe you met through Mr. Kalidas six months ago. We have been in contact for some time now, and I wanted to check if you have any current requirements he could assist with.

Your prompt response would be greatly appreciated.

Sincerely,

[Sender Name]

email_chain.subject: Difficulty Locating Mr. Gupta
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Further to our earlier correspondence, I am experiencing considerable difficulty in locating Mr. Gupta. I lack his office address, mobile number, and the complete address of his organization, information I require to deliver [redacted/document/package - information implied but not directly stated]. Could you please provide updated contact details for him?

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,

[Sender Name]

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Importing Commodities from China
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Michael,

It was a pleasure meeting you as well. I'm glad to hear you enjoyed your time in China and hope you are considering a return visit. I'd be happy to offer further assistance during any future trips. Immersing yourself in China’s complex trade environment and observing efficient business practices firsthand is invaluable.

I'm forwarding a list of clients we currently work with, which may provide some useful connections. Please don't hesitate to contact me with any further questions you may have about trading with China; I'm happy to share my experience.

Best regards,

Robert Galloway

email_chain.subject: Regarding Mr. Gupta of Gurmeet Gupta & Co.
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I am writing based on the recommendation of Mr. Gupta of Gurmeet Gupta & Co., who suggested I contact you regarding your import [requirements/activities - implied meaning].

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Sincerely,

[Sender Name]

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry - 20k CFR Houston
email_chain.body:
Hi Adi,

We received your inquiry regarding 20k CFR Houston. You mentioned 'Vessel Options' and provided details for two vessels. Could you please provide the complete rate sheet from your company regarding these options?

We appreciate your response at your earliest convenience.

Best Regards,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry - 20k CFR Houston
email_chain.body:
Hi Steve,

Thank you for replying and providing details regarding vessels from your company. We have reviewed the details and evaluated your offer. Your quote is currently higher than our expectations and not very competitive. Please provide a more competitive rate sheet, and we will revert back to you.

Please let us know if you require any further details from our side.

Best Regards,
Adi

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry - 20k CFR Houston
email_chain.body:
Hi Adi,

We received your email and note your feedback on the quote. We would like to add two more vessels to the potential charter options for which we require an estimated annual spot rate.

Vessel #1: Bulk Carrier
Vessel #2: Heavy Lift Vessel

Please send us an estimated rate sheet based on yearly runs for these two vessel types.

If you require any further details, please let us know.

Best Regards,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry - 20k CFR Houston - Additional Vessels
email_chain.body:
Hi Steve,

We received your reply regarding the two new vessels being added to the potential charters. For these new vessels (Bulk Carrier and Heavy Lift Vessel), please provide the rates on an annual basis.

We would appreciate it if you could respond with this information as soon as possible.

Best Regards,
Adi

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry - 20k CFR Houston - Additional Vessels
email_chain.body:
Hi Adi,

We received your confirmation regarding the annual rates for the two new vessels. Your response is appreciated. 

We will review and be in touch.

Best Regards,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Kerosene Shipment Arrival - 700 MT
email_chain.body:
Dear George,

The 700 MT of kerosene you are expecting is due to arrive in Las Palmas soon. Could you please provide an estimated time of arrival (ETA) or confirm when we can expect to discharge the cargo?

Sincerely,
Mark Johnson

email_chain.subject: Follow-up: 700 MT Kerosene Shipment to Las Palmas
email_chain.body:
Dear Mark,

This is a follow-up regarding our order of 700 MT of kerosene being shipped to Las Palmas. Could you please provide an update on its status? Please let me know if there are any unforeseen issues with the shipment, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions about the product specifications or documentation.

Regards,
Kyle Anderson

email_chain.subject: Email Communication Best Practices
email_chain.body:
Mark,

In my experience as a communications consultant, sending clear, well-structured emails is paramount for effective communication. Your recent message to George regarding the kerosene shipment was a good example of clear and concise messaging. 

While the structure and content were well-executed, consider using formal titles (e.g., Mr. Miller) in initial correspondence to maintain a professional tone. While informality can be appropriate later on, starting with a formal address is generally preferred. 

Regardless, the core message was conveyed effectively, and you facilitated a straightforward process.

Regards,
Eko Williams

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: Aqaba to Eilat - Iron Ore
email_chain.body:
Dear Hennessey,

We are seeking a vessel to transport approximately 30,000 MT of iron ore from Aqaba to Eilat. Are your ships capable of handling this cargo and are you familiar with this route?

If so, please provide us with a freight offer.

Regards,
Ramon

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Aqaba to Eilat - Iron Ore
email_chain.body:
Dear Hennessey,

Thank you for your prompt response.

We would appreciate receiving your updated price list for similar routes and a proposal for a potential three-month agreement for regular shipments, if possible.

Regards,
Ramon

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Aqaba to Eilat - Iron Ore
email_chain.body:
Dear Hennessey,

We will be sending you our company profile for your reference shortly.

Regards,
Ramon

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Soft Drum Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Lewis,

I was reviewing the latest rate tables on your website and noticed the soft drum rates have been removed. Could you share the rationale for this change?

Best,
Geoffrey

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry Regarding Soft Drum Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Geoffrey,

The soft (best match) rate is now -50% because, upon reviewing the data, I found that there were effectively no valid soft (best match) rates to report. Please refer to the explanation of soft (best match) rates in the Band Memberships section history for further details.

If you'd like to apply the current personal rate of -50%, please email me your personal ID number and I will apply it to your account. Alternatively, if you wish to use the New Rates (listed below), please consider adding your personal rate as a donation to support the organization.

email_chain.subject: Soybean Oil Quote Request - 10,000 MT Paranaguá to Abu Dhabi
email_chain.body:
Hello Max,

Could you please provide me with a quote for 10,000 MT of soybean oil from Paranaguá to Abu Dhabi?

Regards,
Grace Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Oil Quote Request - 10,000 MT Paranaguá to Abu Dhabi
email_chain.body:
Hi Grace,

Thank you for your inquiry. Soybean oil is currently in very high demand, and we are working hard to secure supplies for our clients. Unfortunately, due to the current market conditions and limited availability, we are unable to provide a firm quote at this time. We need to check with our suppliers first.

Please let me know if there is anything else we can do for you.

Sincerely,
Jack Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Oil Quote Request - 10,000 MT Paranaguá to Abu Dhabi
email_chain.body:
Hello Jack,

Thank you for your response. I understand that soybean oil is in high demand. We appreciate you checking with your suppliers and look forward to hearing from you when you have more information. 

Best Regards,
Grace Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Oil Quote Request - 10,000 MT Paranaguá to Abu Dhabi
email_chain.body:
Hello Grace,

Thank you for your patience. Unfortunately, we still haven't received any updates from our suppliers regarding the availability of soybean oil. We are pushing them for information and will keep you updated as soon as we receive any news.

Best Regards,
Jack Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Oil Quote Request - 10,000 MT Paranaguá to Abu Dhabi
email_chain.body:
Hello Grace,

We are still in discussions with our suppliers and are unfortunately not yet able to provide a quote for soybean oil. I understand this is frustrating, and I assure you we're doing everything we can to get you an answer. I will keep you updated as soon as we have any further information.

Best Regards,
Jack Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Oil Quote Request - 10,000 MT Paranaguá to Abu Dhabi - QUOTE AVAILABLE
email_chain.body:
Hello Grace,

Good news! We have received updates from our suppliers and can now provide a quote for soybean oil. The estimated delivery time is 60-90 days, and the price is $400 per ton (USD 400/MT).

I will send you the contract and payment details separately. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best Regards,
Jack Smith

email_chain.subject: Shipment of Rice from Yawata to Benin
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Santos,

We have a shipment of rice originating in Yawata, Japan, destined for Benin that requires your attention. Are you available to confirm a laycan in June? Could you also advise on the estimated cost, considering the short lead time?

Yours sincerely,
April Lee

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata to Benin
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your note of May 14.

We've confirmed a departure date of June 25th for Benin. The shipping company quoted us $____. This includes ocean freight from a U.S. port to a Japanese port, customs clearance in Benin, and trucking the rice to the Beninese port, as agreed. We have already made all necessary payments and will send you an invoice shortly.

Are you planning to import the rice on behalf of your client, or are you going to ship it from your own warehouse in Benin?

Regards,
April Lee

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata to Benin
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your message of May 19.

We'll be importing the rice on our own behalf, as we usually handle our food imports. We’ll be purchasing a few trucks for transportation to the port from local Beninese suppliers. We’ll also take care of customs clearance at the port and any potential legal issues, as per our standard practice.

Is this information sufficient for your needs?

Regards,
Santos

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata to Benin
email_chain.body:
Glad to hear that.

We've made an advance payment to your company for the rice shipment. Could you please check with the shipping company to confirm the precise routing of the shipment?

Sincerely,
T. Watkins

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment of Rice from Yawata to Benin
email_chain.body:
Dear Watkins,

Thanks for the message. The rice shipment has now departed from Yawata, Japan, en route to Manila. From Manila to Benin, the voyage is estimated to take 4-6 weeks. No delays are currently anticipated. I have already informed our supplier of this transit.

Yours,
Matsuo

email_chain.subject: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Ningbo to Zeebrugge
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

We require a vessel ASAP for a 5,000 MT soybean shipment from Ningbo to Zeebrugge. Do you accept Laytime Allowed in Days (LADs) based on barrels loaded? Also, could you let me know if you have any open laycan slots suitable for this cargo?
