Desmond Tan

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Ningbo to Zeebrugge
email_chain.body:
Dear Desmond,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the soybean shipment. We'd be delighted to provide you with a service quote.

We have space available on our 1999-built, 48,000 DWT clean diesel carrier. We can call at Ningbo around November 20th, sailing directly to Zeebrugge. It's the fastest sail from Ningbo to Zeebrugge – approximately 16 days!

Unfortunately, we only have capacity for 4,400 MT on this sailing. The rates are as follows (per foot and per MT): 

RORO transfer: $1.00/FT + $4.00/MT DISCHARGE CHARGE
Boarding & stow: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT
Gross Toll: $25.00/FT + $1.00/MT
NAVFAC Tolls: $30.00/FT + $

Please let me know if you'd like a complete and accurate quote based on actual vessel dimension for reference. 

Best Regards,

B. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybean Shipment Inquiry - Ningbo to Zeebrugge
email_chain.body:
Dear Desmond,

I have just received your inquiry through another broker. After investigating your request, I'm pleased to offer a charter quote for your soybeans. I have been able to tentatively book a barge on one of the Shiraichi shipping lines. 

The rates are as follows (per foot and per MT):

Boarding & stow: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT
CARGO TOLL: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT
NAVFAC Tolls: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT
CHARTER FEE: $8.00/FT + $0.00/MT
TRAMP CHARGES: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT
GROSS TOLL: $0.00/

Please let me know if you want to proceed. Full T&Cs available on request.

Best regards,

[Broker Name]

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry: Korea-Singapore-Indonesia
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

Hope you’re well and thanks for your message. I've reviewed your vessel itinerary and it seems suitable for our needs.

I'm requesting rate quotes for a Korea-Singapore-Indonesia route. Could you please provide pricing for 5,200 MT of cargo for shipments next month?

Also, please include any applicable surcharge amounts in your quote.

Thank you again.

Best,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry: Korea-Singapore-Indonesia
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

Thank you for your message and the quote you provided. Before I can confirm whether we'd like to proceed, I need some clarifications. Could you please confirm the following:

1. What is the service speed on this route?
2. What are the typical cruising conditions expected?
3. Are there any fees for the consumption of consumables? If so, what is the cost per unit? (e.g., Diesel USD 100 per MT, Fresh Water USD 10 per MT, etc.)
4. Are there any berthing charges? If so, what is the amount per port?
5. Does your price include all charges? Specifically:
    a. Are there any additional costs for port dues, anchorage fees, etc.?
    b. Are there any other additional costs not explicitly mentioned?

Thanks,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry: Singapore-Korea-Singapore - August/September
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

We understand you have availability in August and September for shipments of 5,200 MT from Singapore to South Korea and then back to Singapore. 

Could you please provide a rate quote for these two legs? We are looking for a firm commitment in August with a possible extension into September. Please let me know if this is feasible on your end.

Your quote should clearly include:

A) Consumption of bunker fuel, crew wages, and all related costs.
B) All port charges, mooring costs, fuel, and other expenses related to port operations.
C) Miscellaneous fees, including crew overtime and other incidentals.
D) Any other relevant details.

It's crucial that we understand all potential costs upfront. Please disclose any additional required fees or charges.

I hope this clarifies our needs.

Thanks,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry: 2-Year Charter - Singapore/Korea/Indonesia
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Kim,

I am following up on a charter inquiry for a 2-year period covering Singapore, Korea, and Indonesia. Details are below.

The vessel must have a carrying capacity of a maximum 5,000 DWT with 100% of the cargo stowed safely. There must also be a minimum of 35% of the cargo space available (unused) for storage/shifting if needed.

The ship also needs to be able to accommodate 70-75 crew members.

We would like to charter the ship for a minimum period of two years.

Additionally, the ship should have clean decks and holds, and be capable of carrying the maximum 5,000 DWT. Finally, please confirm if there is a fuel surcharge applicable.

We need to ensure that we are able to [continue to a full, grammatically correct sentence, even if hypothetical since the email is cut off in the original].

Thanks,
Kate

Additionally, my contact in Durban is very interested in procuring South African meat through your agents. Could you please provide information on customs clearance costs at the port, and any other associated expenses?

email_chain.body:
Hello Ryan,

How are you?

I am writing again because I have not received a response to my previous emails. The Shoutzu representative in Durban experienced some issues with our previous shipment of one container of frozen beef. This makes me hesitant to send the current container through your agents.

Could you shed some light on what happened with the previous shipment and offer suggestions on how we can proceed with the new one? Any advice or insights you can provide would be greatly appreciated.

Kind regards,
Gloria

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Previous Shipment Issues and Concerns Regarding New Durban Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Gloria,

Thank you for your email. 

Regarding the tender in Japan, I have received an offer and am currently awaiting a response from Mr. Nakano at Asahi Kasei. I will keep you updated on the progress.

Please find attached Invoice #461664 from Durban for your records. I've also included an estimate for customs clearance. I will provide a formal quote upon my return from overseas next week. In the meantime, payment towards the terminal charges is required as we experienced delays in getting your containers discharged. This issue has been resolved, and the documents are being processed.

Best regards,
Ryan

My assumption is that Nick Dombi is not a courier but a rental customer and this could be a [potentially problematic situation, the email cuts off abruptly].

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Oil Spill Cleanup and Dispersant Supply
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Ambrose,

I hope this email finds you well. I was in the Gulf of Mexico over the weekend and witnessed the ongoing cleanup efforts. I understand the scale of the oil spill this summer has been significant, and I wanted to inquire about how we might be able to assist with dispersant supply.

We understand that large quantities of chemical dispersants are required to aid in the oil removal process. For example, some estimates suggest needing at least 40,000 tons (see attached infographic for details on impact and scale of the spill).

Our understanding is that the next step involves containing the crude oil and allocating it to companies with existing orders, such as Chevron (estimated to handle around 40% of the recovered oil). 

Your organization's need for dispersants is clear. We are interested in exploring how we can support you in acquiring these. Additionally, we would need to confirm vessel availability for delivery. 

Thank you for your time and consideration. We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Sincerely,
John Doe
[Attachment: Oil Spill Impact Infographic]

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Oil Spill Cleanup and Dispersant Supply
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Doe,

Thank you for your email and your concern regarding the oil spill cleanup efforts. We appreciate your offer of assistance with dispersant supply.

Could you please provide more information on the types of dispersants you can offer? An infographic detailing the different chemical compositions and examples would be very helpful (e.g., Corexit, etc.)

Additionally, when using dispersants, how can we effectively control the path and concentration of the dispersed oil in the water column?

Thank you for your prompt response.

Sincerely,
Jane Ambrose

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Oil Spill Cleanup and Dispersant Supply
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Ambrose,

Thank you for your questions. We currently have a stockpile of dispersant chemicals ready for dispatch. 

The pathway of the dispersed oil is generally controlled by either chemical dispersants or in-situ burning. We've explored in-situ burning in limited, non-approved tests. The main challenge with chemical dispersants lies in controlling the depth and concentration within the water column. In-situ burning offers greater depth control during the burning process, but has its own logistical and environmental challenges. We are open to working with your team to create a dispersal strategy.

Please let us know if this is of interest and we can explore delivery logistics. 

Sincerely,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: Sand and Gravel - New Orleans to Jebel Ali
email_chain.body:
Mr. Beck,

We have received your estimates for the different shipping options to Jebel Ali. Is it possible to have one estimate that combines the *cheapest* option of shipment for *each type* (e.g., the cheapest bulk option, the cheapest container option, etc.)? Essentially, combining different shipping methods for one shipment.

Regards,
Khalid

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: Sand and Gravel - New Orleans to Jebel Ali
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Khalid,

Thank you for the clarification. Unfortunately, that is not a feasible approach. Attempting to combine different shipping methods for a single 2,000 MT shipment to Jebel Ali would result in significantly higher costs due to logistical complexities and handling charges compared to using a single, consistent shipping method.

Sincerely,
Robert Beck

email_chain.body:
Dear New Customer,

Hope your request made it through! I'm back from celebrating my birthday at the 1st Club in Liverpool. Thanks for the well wishes.

Regarding your query about the vessel:

The hull number appears to be 18, and the length is approximately 52m.
The vessel was built around 2000 in Denmark.
It's constructed of carbon steel, DNV-2G grade, with a maximum class of 100A1.
She has a bulk cargo capacity of about 1500 tons.

To properly assess the insurance requirements and provide a hull condition report, could you please provide the vessel's name? 

Sincerely,
John Smith

It's a lovely ship and I'm hoping to potentially use it for my business. What kind of insurance would be required for a vessel like that? If possible, could you also send a report on her hull condition as soon as you have one? I forgot the ships name. 

Kind Regards,

email_chain.subject: Discrepancies in Deliveries - Colombo Shipments
email_chain.body:
Dear [LCL Operator],

We have identified discrepancies in the consignments delivered to Colombo in your last shipment, specifically concerning the items listed below. With one exception, the information on the booking orders does not match the actual deliveries to the consignees. Furthermore, in some cases, invoices are missing from the delivery notes.

Consequently, we are unable to process payment at this time. Please address the following issues:

1) Invoice number: [Invoice Number], date of delivery: [Date of Delivery] - Does not correspond with the consignments listed below. (The delivery notes attached to each consignment reference the same invoice number).

2) Invoice number: [Invoice Number], date of delivery: [Date of Delivery] - Does not correspond with the consignments listed below. (Delivery note shows a different invoice number).

3) Invoice number: [Invoice Number], date of delivery: [Date of Delivery] - Does not correspond with the consignments listed below. (The delivery [rest of the sentence is cut]).

email_chain.subject: RE: Chemical Spill at Railyard - Vessel Space Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello,

My name is Jane Doe and I work for ABC Supply in Virginia. I am following up on the chemical spill situation in West Virginia. We are concerned about potential disruptions to our supply chain.

As you may be aware:

1.  **Chemical Spill:** Tank cars derailed and released approximately 100,000 lbs. of a mixture of chemicals into the Kanawha River.
2.  **West Virginia Official:** Governor Tomblin has declared a state of emergency for Jackson and Kanawha counties.
3.  **Port Closure:** We understand the Cosco Kuwait may be out of service this weekend.

We need to explore alternative shipping options. Please advise if you have available vessel space, particularly for ExxonMobil shipments affected by this event.

Thank you,
Jane Doe
ABC Supply

email_chain.subject: RE: Chemical Spill - Kanawha River Impact and Mitigation
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Doe,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the chemical spill in the Kanawha River. We are closely monitoring the situation and its potential impact on shipping operations.

As you are aware, on November 19, 2013, a chemical spill occurred in the Kanawha River in West Virginia. Due to the contamination, the Kanawha River is currently unusable. We have been informed that operators of an oil terminal in Point Pleasant are requesting permission to release the terminal's contents into a nearby creek as a possible mitigation strategy. This highlights the severity of the situation.

Regarding your request for vessel space, we are evaluating availability and will provide an update as soon as possible.

We also understand that 'Virginians for a Natural Gas Free America' are circulating a petition to declare a state of emergency and potentially shut down the Dominion Natural Gas Pipeline. We are not involved in this political action but understand it could add further complications to the situation.

Sincerely,
Shipper Oh
Allied Shipping

email_chain.subject: RE: Chemical Spill at Railyard - Vessel Space Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Oh,

I am following up on my previous email regarding the chemical spill and potential vessel space availability. Thank you for your update on the Kanawha River situation.

We are concerned about potential disruptions to our supply chain due to the chemical spill in the Kanawha River. To reiterate:

1.  **Chemical Spill:** Tank cars derailed and released approximately 100,000 lbs. of a mixture of chemicals into the Kanawha River.
2.  **West Virginia Official:** Governor Tomblin has declared a state of emergency for Jackson and Kanawha counties.
3.  **Port Closure:** We understand the Cosco Kuwait may be out of service this weekend.

Do you have any further information regarding vessel availability? 

We also had an incident on September 22nd, 2013 involving an accident during training, I can provide more detail about this upon request. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jane Doe
ABC Supply

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 600 MT Feed Barley - Nador to Ningbo - November Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Fadi,

We are looking to ship 600 MT of feed barley from Nador to Ningbo in November. Could you please provide us with the earliest laycan you can guarantee?

Regards,

Samer Gibson

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 600 MT Feed Barley - Nador to Ningbo - November Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Samer,

Thank you for your inquiry. I'm very sorry, but loading from Nador is not possible at this time. Our vessel is currently in Turkey with cargo and will likely be heading to Europe shortly thereafter. 

As of now, I don't have any alternative options for lifting your cargo from Nador. The earliest I could potentially offer something would be the second week of November, pending vessel availability.

Regards,

Fadi

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 600 MT Feed Barley - Nador to Ningbo - November Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Fadi,

Following up on your previous email, I was wondering if our potential trans-shipment to Ningbo from Jebel Ali Port around November 10th is still feasible?

Regards,

Samer Gibson

email_chain.subject: Potential Spot Cargo - Tanjung Pelepas - 75 MT Feed Barley
email_chain.body:
Hey Fadi,

We have a reservation at Tanjung Pelepas to load 75 MT of feed barley by Friday, November 5th. We can secure a vessel and let you know the rate later. Would you be able to take a spot? The earliest the vessel can arrive at the port is Saturday, November 6th.

Thank you for your time,

Sharif

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: BTI Pulp Shipment - Damen Arrival
email_chain.body:
Hello Dr. Moreno,

Could you please provide the estimated weight of the 8,000 MT of BTI pulp arriving at Damen, routed via Colombo, Panama, and Suez, with an expected arrival around May 21st?

Also, are you open to discussing potential adjustments to the freight rate for a possible earlier shipment around May 10th?

Sincerely,
Dana Miller

email_chain.subject: Update: Panama Canal Transit - BTI Pulp Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Moreno,

Following up on our earlier conversation, I wanted to share an update regarding the Panama Canal transit for the BTI pulp shipment. The Estimated Time (ET) through the canal appears to be approximately 31 hours. This suggests a potential for an earlier arrival in Colombo.

I will continue to monitor the situation and provide further updates as they become available.

Sincerely,
Dana Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Update: Panama Canal Transit - BTI Pulp Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Dana,

Thank you for this information regarding the Panama Canal transit. We haven't observed consistently favorable ETs through the canal recently, but we've strategically placed a container as a backup measure.

The good news is that we have space available to ship a smaller volume of BTI pulp with significantly shorter ETs. We hadn't initially planned for a rate adjustment for this smaller volume. However, if you'd like to submit a proposal, we're open to reviewing it and determining the most feasible solution.

Additionally, please let us know if you have any cargo ready for departure on the 10th or 11th.

Sincerely,
David Moreno

email_chain.subject: Re: Update: Panama Canal Transit - BTI Pulp Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

Thank you for your reply. That's great news about the potential for an earlier shipment! We're interested in taking advantage of that opportunity, but I can't confirm the exact volume we'll be able to ship until we receive confirmation from Colombo, which we expect on Wednesday. 

Once we receive the information and have a container ready to go around the 10th, I'll definitely let you know. 

I'll be in touch soon, and thank you for all your help so far!

Dana Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Update: Panama Canal Transit - BTI Pulp Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Dana,

I'm glad to hear from you. We can offer a lower rate for shipments on the 9th and 10th of this month. However, please understand that we can't finalize any commitment until at least the 18th of May, as we need to know the precise volume of pulp you'll be shipping.

Sincerely,
David Moreno

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Shipments: USG to China & Middle East to USG

2.  100,000 MT shipment of crude oil from the Middle East to the US Gulf of Mexico via the Suez Canal. Can you confirm if your vessel can load by week 15 and laycan by week 16?

Kindly confirm availability and specifications.

Regards,
Marius van Zyl

email_chain.body:

Thank you for your inquiry. We have a vessel, Afrindia FSRU, chartered by an Asian partner, which is expected to load approximately 250,000 m3 of crude on Monday, May 11th, 2020, and be cleared for sail by Tuesday, May 12th, 2020, under a time charter.

Please confirm if this aligns with your Afrindia FSRU charter schedule.

Kind regards,
Marnie

Kindly contact the partner chartering party directly at chartering@asianpartner.com. They will be able to assist you with the Afrindia FSRU charter schedule.

Regards,
Marius

Currently, I am located in Basingstoke, Hampshire, and holding a 3-year contract.

I am looking for work as an engineer at a local organization, where I can utilize the skills and knowledge I have acquired through my education and experience.

I am a research and technical specialist, also fluent in German, and specialized in material test and characterization. 

I have prepared an attached copy of my CV for your reference. I am currently in the process of preparing my visa application. However, I am confident that I can be working for you by October.

If you have any questions please let me know.

Sorry for the delay! I'm working on your quote for the sulfuric acid shipment now. I have some information for you below. The vessel option is through Magenta, who will pick up the cargo from Manzanillo and deliver it to our Port of Entry in Corpus Christi. The original vessel sail date was set for January 15th, but that has since passed. Your security letter wasn't ready at the time. The vessel options are as follows:

1.  Magenta - As you mentioned, this is the cheapest option, but with a longer transit time.

    *   Transit Time: 37 days
    *   Freight Cost: $5,990

2.  PCT - This is the fastest vessel, but the cost is very high.

    *   Transit Time: 26 days
    *   Freight Cost: $29,990

3.  PCT - This option is a better value than Magenta, and...

email_chain.subject: Shipment Update - October 2024 & Tokyo Office Opening
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Singh,

Quick update on our operations. In October 2024, we shipped over 1,000 tanks of LPG and 300 MT of vegetable oil from Saudi Arabia to Vietnam. We are scheduled to ship another 300 tanks of LPG and 200 MT of vegetable oil to Vietnam in January 2025.

Also, we've recently opened a new sales office in Tokyo.

Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions regarding our recent shipments or the Tokyo office.

Thanks,
Nathan Miller

email_chain.subject: Confirmation: LPG & Vegetable Oil Shipment - Saudi Arabia to Vietnam
email_chain.body:

This email confirms the successful loading of 1,000 tanks of LPG and 300 MT of vegetable oil from Saudi Arabia to Vietnam, per our schedule. The additional shipment to Vietnam in January 2025 is also on track.

Please don't hesitate to contact me with any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Jacob Smith

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Allegations Against a Client
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We are writing to you today to inquire about recent allegations of fraud against one of our clients.

Last week, we received a complaint from a job applicant claiming to have been scammed out of $100,000 by our client. The applicant alleges that our client offered them a job as a software developer and requested they wire $100,000 to an account for "development work." However, the applicant claims the money was never received, and our client never contacted them again.

Our client denies these allegations and has provided documentation verifying their location and business hours. We have also conducted an internal review and found no record of communication between our client and the applicant.

We understand you may be concerned about this matter, and we apologize for any inconvenience it may cause. We are committed to providing a safe and reliable service, and...

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Update - October 2024 & Tokyo Office Opening
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Singh,

We appreciate the update on the recent shipments. Our team is excited about the new opportunities in Tokyo.

Please let us know if you have any questions or require any further information from our end.

Best regards,
Charles Davis

Best regards,
Eric Smith

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - Rotterdam to Houston
email_chain.body:
Phil,

Following up on Charlene's request, please confirm the number of slots available as detailed in the attached spreadsheet.

Charles Ingram

email_chain.subject: Requested Laycan Slots - Rotterdam to Houston
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Santander,

We require the following available slots for our cargoes:

CARGO     DES     ETA       PORT    LCDD    BPSP    DDSP
ARG ARG1
CGZ ARG2    RDT     2023-11-21  RHD     25      1       25
ARG ARG3    RDT     2023-11-21  RHD     25      1       25
ARG ARG4    RDT     2023-11-21  RHD     25      1       25
ARG ARG5    RDT     2023-11-21  RHD     25      1       25
ARG ARG6    RDT     2023-11-21  RHD     25      1       25

Thank you for your assistance.

Regards,

*Note: ETA should read as 'Estimated Time of Arrival', PORT 'Port of discharge', LCDD 'Laycan Cancelling Date Day', BPSP 'Berth Provisionally Set on Port Day', DDSP 'Deadline Discharge Start Port Day'.

email_chain.subject: Grain Fixture - Manzanillo to Salalah
email_chain.body:
Dear Janowski,

Hoping to arrange a fixture for some grain to Salalah. I've got 4,200 MT from Manzanillo to Salalah. Do you have any opportunities for a backhaul from Salalah to Manzanillo, preferably something that could fill up the vessel?

Thanks,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Fixture - Manzanillo to Salalah
email_chain.body:
Mike,

Nice to hear from you. I'm not sure if I can help with the grain fixture but I do have access to specialized equipment. 

To clarify, this isn't my machine directly, but I have connections to a mobile crane. It's a 40' truck crane, 2WD, with a liquid pressure test kit and a 'Smokin Box' on the side with a winch. It's self-contained with a large diesel capacity (40,000 gallons).

You can see pictures at http://www.bradcoengineering.com. It's an Arizona 18m Truck Crane 2WD with a swivel winch in the front, holding up to 1000kg (2200lbs).

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain Fixture - Manzanillo to Salalah
email_chain.body:
Mike,

See attached file for pictures.

I also just received a text message from someone looking for crane services. I believe my crane fits his needs, so we can discuss pricing and ownership if this is of interest to you.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Biomass Shipment from Hamburg to Yokohama
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Best,

I hope you are having a good day.

I recently reviewed your website and find your services very interesting. I am writing to inquire about your services for loading and unloading a shipment of biomass from Hamburg to Yokohama.

Could you please let me know if you handle this type of cargo on this route? Additionally, I would appreciate it if you could confirm whether your rates are competitive with other providers. Finally, I would also like to know if currency exchange rate fluctuations affect your pricing.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Natalie

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Biomass Shipment from Hamburg to Yokohama
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Best,

I am following up on my previous email. I understand that inboxes can be full and emails may get lost.

I am aware that container transport costs from Hamburg to Yokohama have increased recently. I'm wondering if there's any possibility of a discounted rate given the change in pricing. Would it be possible for you to offer a discounted price, and confirm it via email?

I apologize for any inconvenience caused by my delayed follow up and I would be happy to discuss covering any expenses incurred as a result.

Thank you again, and I hope to hear from you soon.

Sincerely,
Natalie

email_chain.subject: Following up: Biomass Shipment from Hamburg to Yokohama
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Best,

I hope you're doing well.

I've revisited your website and remain very impressed with the services you offer.

Sincerely,
Natalie

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Biomass Shipment from Hamburg to Yokohama - Providing Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Best,

Hi! I apologize for the delayed response. I was tied up in meetings and unable to reply sooner.

I'm currently finalizing the details for a shipment of a 20-foot container to be transported from Hamburg to Yokohama. Would it be possible to provide you with the specific details of the cargo and receive an estimated transportation cost? I can provide all necessary information regarding the cargo at your convenience.

Thank you for your time and prompt response.

Sincerely,
Natalie

email_chain.body:

Hi,

Thanks,

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: Fuel Oil from Seadrill to Gibraltar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Park,

We require a vessel to transport approximately 2000 MT of fuel oil from Seadrill (location to be confirmed, but likely a rig in the North Sea) to Gibraltar. 

Could you please provide a quote and estimated timeframe for this voyage?

As a separate inquiry, what is your current freight rate for transporting charcoal?

Thank you,

Carlos Rodriguez

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Fuel Oil from Seadrill to Gibraltar
email_chain.body:
Dear Carlos,

Thank you for your inquiry.

Regarding the fuel oil transport, please confirm the exact loading location for Seadrill so we can provide an accurate quote. We can offer arrival dates within the window of April 3rd, 4th, 6th, 9th or 12th, with discharge completing by April 7th, 8th or 15th.

Also, could you provide more details about the charcoal shipment you mentioned? We need to know the volume/weight, loading port (presumably Singapore, based on your second request), and destination (South Australia).

For the Singapore to South Australia request, please advise the commodity and quantity to enable us to find the cheapest vessel.

Best regards,

Mr. Park

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry: 15,000 MT Wood Pulp - Shenzhen to Shanghai
email_chain.body:

We are looking to ship 15,000 MT of wood pulp from Shenzhen to Shanghai. Assuming a constant vessel speed, could you please provide a preliminary laycan estimate for this charter?

Thanks,
Hans

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry: 15,000 MT Wood Pulp - Shenzhen to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rajesh,

Following up on the Shenzhen to Shanghai charter. We're also considering alternative pulp suppliers. Are you still interested in brokering a sale and purchase (S&P) deal and sourcing from a new producer as we previously discussed?

If not, I'll focus on working with the two existing suppliers. Please note that we're anticipating at least a two-week lead time for chartering.

Thanks,
Hans

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry: 15,000 MT Wood Pulp - Shenzhen to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Hey Hans,

Okay, I've sent back the Profit/Loss (P/L) for the potential S&P chartering deal.

Regarding the Shenzhen to Shanghai shipment, I've also sent you a preliminary laycan based on standard transit times. To refine this, I would greatly appreciate receiving *your* estimated laycan as well, to provide a more concrete target day for the charter.

As discussed, we generally prefer not to commit to a firm laycan without some confirmation from your end. However, I'm also hesitant to finalize the contract until I have at least one confirmed lead. Therefore, I'd be grateful if you could provide your estimated laycan as soon as possible.

Thanks & Best,
T.N.

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry: 15,000 MT Wood Pulp - Shenzhen to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Nagawaramma,

As per your request, I can provide our estimated laycan for the Shenzhen to Shanghai shipment. Our target shipment date is September 24, 2021, with an estimated arrival date of September 28, 2021.

Best regards,
Hans

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Options - Potential Breakout
email_chain.body:
Great news!

While I'd love to claim credit for the recent move in crude, it appears to be event-driven. The Q4 2013 outlook call seems to have given crude oil a final push. The $42.5 level couldn't sustain the move for long.

Looking at the broader picture, crude is currently confirming our expected trading zone of $40-$46. 

There are other factors at play influencing crude, which I'll elaborate on in my next email.

Stay tuned!

Chichi

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Options - Potential Breakout
email_chain.body:
Good morning Chichi,

Given the 50 EMA is approaching the $42.5 level, would now be an appropriate time to place a cut-loss order?

Regards,
Jackie

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Options - Potential Breakout
email_chain.body:
Great news!

The more volatile our position becomes, the higher the risk. Therefore, there's no need to increase our exposure to crude options, as we're already in an optimal position.

Regarding your question about cut-loss, a stop is not necessary because our exit point at $42.5 is sufficiently protective.

Chichi

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Breakout Scenario
email_chain.body:
Chichi,

Without wasting time, here's the breakout scenario:

At $38.5, crude was in a trading zone.
At $40, it closed above the $38.5 handle (outside the trading range).
Next, at $40.2 on the 7/23 call, it triggered the highest swing up since 7/2 (at $42.5).
Finally, at $42.5, we've entered an overbought zone (an up-trending market).

So, what happens?

Chichi

email_chain.subject: NVOCC Quote Request - 1500 MT Cargo to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Mr. Green,

We require your best quote on an NVOCC basis for the following shipment:

Freight: 1500 MT to Rotterdam (c.i.f.)
Cargo Type: Dry Bulb (Assuming this refers to the cargo type, please confirm)
Packaging: 40' Open Top Containers
Total Weight: 12,048 kgs (12,000 kgs + 32 kgs document weight + VAT/Tax)

Thanks,
Louis

email_chain.subject: Re: NVOCC Quote Request - 1500 MT Cargo to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Louis,

Thank you for your quote request.

To provide an accurate quote, we require further information about the cargo. Please specify:

1.  The precise name/description of the cargo (e.g., is it glass bulbs, flower bulbs, etc.?)
2.  Detailed cargo specifications for each container type used (if applicable):

*   Total package:
*   Gross weight:
*   Net weight:
*   Number of packing units:
*   Cubic measurement (m3):
*   Number of 20' containers required:
*   Number of 40' containers required:
*   Number of 45' containers required:

We look forward to receiving this information so we can prepare your quote.

Regards,
Mr. Green

email_chain.subject: Re: NVOCC Quote Request - 1500 MT Cargo to Rotterdam - URGENT - Confirmation Needed
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Green,

Following up on your request for cargo details. We are the shipper of this cargo and are confirming details from our supplier, Sea Voyage. 

To reiterate, we urgently require confirmation of your cargo specifications (i.e., packing, total weight, and dimensions) to proceed with booking the containers. Please revert with the requested information as soon as possible.

We have tentatively scheduled the container arrival at Port Freeport in 5-6 weeks and need to finalize booking ASAP. Your prompt response is highly appreciated, as we expect the container to arrive in approximately one week after booking. We need to coordinate with the dock master at Port Freeport.

We require written confirmation of the shipment details. Thank you for your cooperation.

Regards,
Louis

email_chain.subject: Contractual problems
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Peters,
I'm looking for an email to use as a follow-up email to an

• What if the subject of the email is about or from an unknown person?

• If you email somebody, be aware that a disclosure statement must be made if

When replying, use a generic subject:

• For example: "Contractual problems".

Note that some companies may not appreciate you contacting their employees at home by email. Some employees may also respond at their office's email address.

• What if the email is very urgent? If the email is urgent, you can

email_chain.subject: Contractual problems
email_chain.body: If you're emailing someone, be aware that the recipient can see the original message if you include labelss in the e-mail. To prevent people from seeing the message labelss, add this line to the labels of your email:

email_chain.subject: Contractual problems
email_chain.body:
Always specify if an email is a formal request. For example:

" I'm attaching a draft copy of a letter to discuss the options we have to resolve the problem at the scheduled meeting on Wednesday."

• Can I send emails with attachments if the recipient is from another company?
There's no reason why a person from one company cannot send an email with an attachment to another company. It is a good idea to send attachments in a compressed format such as zip or rar.

Thank you for your guidance. I have already engaged in a conversation with the customer and am awaiting their final decision. As requested, I have forwarded the document the customer provided. Do you have any feedback on it?

Regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Aviation Fuel Shipment - Houston to Amsterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

The documents appear to be in order. However, there are two tasks you need to address:

1.  Secure an alternative mode of transport for the remaining 1,200 MT of aviation fuel that the customer is unwilling to take back. This presents a significant profit opportunity, given its near-immediate demand in Amsterdam. Since the customer is not inclined to transport it to Belgium, selling it on the spot market is the most viable option. Ensure diligent management of the contract's credit risk.

2. Sell your FOB Hamburg cargo to the customer for a lump sum, to ensure optimal compensation.

Remember to leverage the previously discussed additional document to mitigate potential risks.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

The vessel is scheduled for an earlier-than-anticipated departure on August 16th, and delaying the loading beyond that date might cause us to miss the optimal tide window, potentially incurring delays until the following Monday.

Could you please confirm if this change is possible on your end?

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Emmet

The correct container has been loaded, and I have attached a photograph showing the container with the accurate trade name. I have also requested the forwarding agent at the port to contact you to confirm the correct trade name for inclusion on the bill of lading.

Could you please amend the bill of lading to reflect the correct trade name and send me a confirmation email indicating that the change has been made? I will then forward the updated B/L to the relevant parties.

Thank you for your assistance.

Sincerely,
Emmet

email_chain.body:

On behalf of our client, we regret to inform you that there are discrepancies in the declarations for the booking from Port Harcourt to Benin. Consequently, the entry of the container associated with this booking is currently prohibited.

The corrected declaration must be submitted to us for approval before the booking can be re-registered. Please provide the corrected information as soon as possible.

Kindly,

email_chain.subject: Re: Re-booking Request: Port Harcourt to Benin - Bill of Lading Amendment
email_chain.body:
Hello Emmet,

Unfortunately, we are unable to accommodate the requested amendments for the booking from Port Harcourt to Benin. This booking has been flagged by our client and is currently being intercepted. As we cannot approve any changes under these circumstances, the booking must be dropped.

Kindly,

email_chain.subject: Project Proposal Request: Indonesian Seawall Repair Project
email_chain.body:
Good evening Messrs. Kinan & Keshab,

Please accept my apologies for contacting you on this urgent matter. Our lead project manager has had to attend to a family emergency, and I'm temporarily covering their responsibilities.

We are seeking a project manager for a significant project: the repair of a 400km network of seawalls along the Long Island coast of Indonesia. We require a detailed proposal, including all necessary technical specifications, as soon as possible.

Due to the sensitive nature of this project and the involvement of multiple international stakeholders, we must emphasize the need for strict confidentiality. We require that this opportunity not be discussed with anyone outside of your core proposal team. Breach of confidentiality will immediately disqualify your firm from consideration.

This project will be executed by a consortium of international experts, and we believe your firm's expertise in seawall engineering would be a valuable contribution. We are aware of your experience in the Indian market, however, note that the focus of this project is specifically Indonesia.

We look forward to receiving your proposal.

Sincerely,
John Doe
Acting Project Manager
Global Construction Group

email_chain.subject: Re: Project Proposal Request: Indonesian Seawall Repair Project
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Doe,

Thank you for contacting us. We appreciate the opportunity to submit a proposal for the Indonesian Seawall Repair Project. 

Our proposal will feature highly experienced individuals with a strong understanding of project management and relevant experience in similar coastal engineering projects. We understand the need for confidentiality and assure you that we will adhere to the highest ethical standards.

We are preparing a detailed proposal that will address all the technical specifications and project requirements. We look forward to the possibility of collaborating with Global Construction Group on this important initiative.

Sincerely,
Kinan & Keshab
One Universe Global Plc.

email_chain.subject: 6000 DWT Unit Schedule Inquiry - Bremerhaven to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

Could you please check the schedule for a 6000 DWT unit for the 4th week of February, routing from Bremerhaven to Shanghai?

Thanks a lot.

Regards,

email_chain.subject: RE: 6000 DWT Unit Schedule Inquiry - Bremerhaven to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Bonjour Matthieu,

Following a phone call with the shipowners, we have scheduled the positioning to Bremerhaven for your client on February 6th and departure on February 16th, 2016. The ship will be loading from Berth C at Bremerhaven.

Port of call in 18 days will be Baogang on February 26th, Dayi on February 27th, and Shanghai on February 28th. The expected load port will be Jinqiao on March 8th.

Please find the itinerary attached.

Best regards,

email_chain.subject: Container Booking Dates and Requirements - Jinqiao
email_chain.body:
Bonjour Matthieu,

The dates for booking the containers are as follows:

LATEST END OF COMMERCIAL TRANSHIPMENT OF CONTAINERS:
* SGM delivery of a cargo to be loaded, in closed loop terminals or in door-to-door service. The cargo delivery must be provided at the latest on the SGM arrival date at the terminal, unless otherwise specified.

LATEST START OF COMMERCIAL TRANSHIPMENT OF CONTAINERS:
* Request for changing existing bookings.
* SGM dispatching of a cargo loaded in the corresponding SGM terminal to be delivered to the consignee in a closed loop terminal or in door-to-door service, unless otherwise specified.

From the next day following the last date mentioned above, the SGM will be entitled to keep the equipment blocked at the storage area.

JINQIAO MAHUL TERMINAL: We don’t allow containers from Zone 2 being released in the Terminal.

The first set of containers can be released in 45 days from the end of the loading operation. For the remaining containers, it will take 50 days. The first set of containers released must be from the same storage area where they were first stored at the terminal.

email_chain.subject: RE: Container Booking Dates and Requirements - Jinqiao
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

Additional container requirements for Jinqiao are as follows:

•	There is no limitation of weight on the 40’ and 20’ containers.

•	The containers must comply with the special conditions mentioned below:

−	Containers must have a blockage no greater than 2.5cm (measurement measured from the center line) to load and to unload the cargo. If the blockage is greater than 2.5cm (measurements taken from the center line), it will be the responsibility of the carrier to accept the equipment.

−	Exposed wooden blocks, wooden blocks in contact with tarpaulins, or exposed boards of wood boards, do not conform to our standards.

email_chain.subject: RE: Container Booking Dates and Requirements - Jinqiao (cont.)
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

Further Jinqiao terminal conditions:

−	One Vortex vent per 20’ container, for each row of pallets, shall be installed. This is particularly important in case of accidents (e.g., explosion, fire) to avoid containers from flooding.

•	The presentation and the placement of the containers must be followed precisely.

•	No chemical loading. Exceptions will be made only by the Shipping Company’s representative and on the condition of having the application form filled in by the Tank Cleaning department with a valid authorization from the Ship’s Master.

•	RORO: no crossing by ramp allowed between two terminals.

•	Hazardous substances are not permitted in Jinqiao.

•	Containers from China and less than 20’ can be offloaded directly in the shed, on the floor, upon loading on trailers.

•	Containers from Europe can be offloaded in the

email_chain.subject: Customer Usage Patterns and CVR
email_chain.body:
I have two customers who have kept buying from me repeatedly, one for 1,000 orders and the other for 2,000 orders. Are they using my online tool, or are they just purchasing over the phone, or both?

There’s no clear answer to this, but here are a few pointers to help you make sense of this.

Remember that the CVR (Customer Value Retention Rate) is the percentage of customers that come back to you for a repeat order. You can calculate this by looking at the percentage of orders that came back to you (or came back to you but didn’t purchase again)

So, if you sold 200 widgets to company A, 50% of those widgets were purchased again the next time A purchased from you. In this example, your CVR is 50%. Note: these measurements can be used to accurately predict how well your company’s

email_chain.subject: Long-Term Customer - Tool Usage?
email_chain.body:
I have one customer who purchased from me 2,000 times over a period of 20 years. Is he using my online tool? What about all the others?

Well, you can’t just blindly assume that everyone who has purchased from you is using the same tools. So, you need to make a few assumptions:

1. If your customer made 2,000 purchases over a period of 20 years, then you can assume that he used your tools for at least 20 years (that is, 20 years ago).

email_chain.subject: E-commerce Plugin Monetization Plan
email_chain.body:
I am thinking about using your plugin for e-commerce. Do you have a plan to monetize it? Or do you plan to offer it for free?

Yes, I have a plan to monetize the plugin. I plan to do this by offering the plugin as a monthly subscription. The subscription will be priced at $100 per month. In other words, you will need to pay $100 per month to use the plugin.

This is one of the ways that I plan to monetize the plugin. The other way is by selling the plugin as a paid one-time purchase. I will be discussing this more in the next few days.

email_chain.subject: Re: Heavy Gasoline - Cartagena - Urgent Shipment
email_chain.body:

Please be aware that potential weather impacts and possible Suez Canal congestion could affect transit times. The earliest we could realistically schedule a vessel for loading in Cartagena is approximately 14 days from now.

Alternatively, we can attempt to secure a faster vessel, but this would incur an additional premium of approximately 7% to cover the increased costs and associated risks.

I'm attaching some indicative transport cost estimates for your review. These estimates include port dues; however, the figures are subject to change depending on the final contract details.

Kind regards,

Simon

Could you confirm the exact volume you wish to ship at your earliest convenience. Our usual weekly schedule is on the 27th of January.

If you're ready to proceed, I can send you the final quote today once I confirm the latest port fees.

Thanks,

Simon

Simon

Dear Phoebe,

Thank you for your inquiry and interest in our vessels. We have reviewed the charter party you sent.

Please note the following:

1) Our standard charter parties are generated automatically and will be sent to you in PDF format. While the terms are largely predefined, certain aspects such as rate, charter period, and specific safety requirements are customizable prior to signing the charter agreement.

2) Our standard terms and conditions are available on our website (http://www.onlinecharter.net/) and as a PDF. All crew members are required to read and agree to these terms before serving on our vessels. Please ensure these terms are understood.

Sincerely,
Mr. Palazzani

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request - MV [Vessel Name - Insert if known]
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Palazzani,

We have reviewed your standard charter party and incorporated the necessary amendments as discussed.

Please send us the official charter party document, including our proposed amendments, for final review.

Attached, please find our amended version for your reference.

Regards,

Phoebe

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request - MV [Vessel Name - Insert if known]
email_chain.body:
Dear Phoebe,

Please ensure you forward the legal documentation for all crew members prior to onboarding. This documentation must include:

*   Valid Passport
*   Relevant Certificates of Competency
*   Valid Ship Security Officer (SSO) certificate, or equivalent
*   Medical Certificate (e.g., ENG1 or equivalent Med5)

Please let us know if you have any questions regarding these requirements.

As a reminder, our standard terms and conditions are available on our website (http://www.onlinecharter.net/) and as a PDF. These terms must be read and agreed to by all crew members before they are eligible to serve on our vessels.

Sincerely,
Mr. Palazzani

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Request - MV [Vessel Name - Insert if known]
email_chain.body:
Dear Phoebe,

Thank you for your inquiry and interest in our vessels. We have reviewed the charter party you have sent us.

Sincerely,
Mr. Palazzani

email_chain.subject: Diesel Fuel Estimate Request: Antwerp to Santos
email_chain.body:

Many thanks,
Florent

email_chain.subject: RE: Diesel Fuel Estimate Request: Antwerp to Santos
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Belanova,

Thank you for your email regarding the 8,000 MT of diesel to be delivered. To proceed, I require some additional information:

1.  A carrier name (excluding Valeriano) and its sailing schedule to Santos.
2.  An estimated date for the next available delivery window, and a confirmation of availability next week.
3.  Cargo delivery details, including maximum speed and load line draft.
4.  Confirmation of the vessel's readiness for the next delivery.
5.  Details of any applicable bunker surcharges.
6.  Your expected ETA in Santos and the date of payment (if not already included in your initial estimate).
7.  Please reply with the above information at your earliest convenience.

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Yours sincerely,
Florent

email_chain.subject: RE: Diesel Fuel Estimate Request: Antwerp to Santos
email_chain.body:

Further to our previous correspondence, could you please confirm the expected arrival date at Santos? This will allow us to confirm payment promptly upon delivery, as our agents already have the fuel purchase order in place.

Thank you,
Florent

email_chain.body:

Could you please provide the vessel details for the *Valeriano*, including its sailing schedule to Santos? I'd like to arrange for payment promptly upon delivery, so clarity on the delivery schedule is greatly appreciated.

Thank you,

Florent

- Thursday, May 24th. Would delivery by Saturday, May 26th be feasible?

Chen

Jonas

Chen

email_chain.body:

I am Matthieu, Logistics Expert at Al Mada Shipping Company. Thank you for your inquiry. We would be happy to assist you with your bitumen shipment.

Please find our initial quote below:

*   Origin: Jubail, Saudi Arabia
*   Destination: Salalah, Oman

We will follow up with you shortly and keep you updated on the status of your shipment.

Sincerely,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Ocean Freight Quote Request: Bitumen Shipment - Jubail to Salalah
email_chain.body:

We require an ocean freight quote for a bitumen shipment from Jubail, Saudi Arabia to Salalah, Oman, scheduled for next month.

email_chain.subject: Re: Ocean Freight Quote Request: Bitumen Shipment - Jubail to Salalah
email_chain.body:

After reviewing your request, we regret to inform you that we are unable to offer our services for this particular shipment, for the following reasons:

email_chain.subject: Funchal Documentation - Important Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Perez,

It has been brought to my attention that you will be handling the documentation for our mutual client in Funchal next month. We need to clarify our position regarding documentation. While we will provide all essential documentation, we cannot guarantee the availability of certain non-essential documents, specifically notices of loads and demurrage calculations in advance. This is due to their dependence on real-time operational data.

Therefore, we will not be held accountable for any costs incurred directly or indirectly as a result of the unavailability of these specific documents beforehand. We will, of course, provide all required documentation pertaining to safe navigation, cargo manifest and any mandatory port documentation.

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you would like to discuss this further.

Best wishes,

Margarita Madison

email_chain.subject: Re: Funchal Documentation - Important Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Margarita,

I am concerned to hear that comprehensive documentation may not be readily available. The potential absence of expected documentation, specifically load notices and demurrage estimates, could cause significant complications and delays, adding unnecessary pressure to our client.

It is imperative that all reasonably expected documentation be provided. As I have explained, comprehensive documentation is the only way I can adequately safeguard my client's interests and ensure a smooth operation in Funchal. Unexpected surprises can lead to financial exposure for my client.

I require your confirmation by the end of day Wednesday (July 12th) that all possible documentation will be issued to the best of your company's ability. If I do not receive this confirmation by that time, I will have no option but to proceed with issuing my client's letter of indemnity to mitigate potential losses.

Kind regards,

Luis Perez

email_chain.subject: Complaint Regarding Cruise Irregularities
email_chain.body:
I am contacting you to express my concerns regarding issues that arose during a recent cruise. 

Despite the itinerary advertised on the website stating a 5-hour daytime lunch break would be included, this was not the case. The client's cruise commenced early in the morning. On the first afternoon, the cruise stopped for only one hour, which coincided with the client's usual lunchtime.

Subsequently, our client informed the cruise company that she would be unable to participate in further activities during the latter part of the cruise, owing to her pre-arranged travel plans for the following morning. 

Unfortunately, after the single stop, the client briefly returned to her cabin to change her attire for dinner. While I acknowledge that her actions might be perceived as less than entirely justified, I am unsure how to best represent our client's interests in this situation, considering the discrepancy in the promised itinerary. I believe that the cruise company should compensate the client for the disappointment...

(B) FAS Karachi Arrival Date:
(C) Origin Country Code:

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Maersk Backload Campaign Report
email_chain.body:
Dear Madame Van Den Dungen,

I've seen your recent report on Maersk’s backload campaign, in which you estimate a potential US$30 million in business generation. I am very interested in this information, and I was hoping you could provide additional details on your research methodology. Could you elaborate on the sources you consulted, and whether your research is based on proprietary or publicly available data?

Yours faithfully,

Wilson Knight

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Maersk Backload Campaign Report
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Knight,

Thank you for your interest in my report on the Maersk backload campaign. I would be happy to share some high-level findings with you. Please note that while the full report is confidential and proprietary, the underlying analysis is based on publicly available data, including Maersk's public statements, port statistics, and industry reports. I believe this will be sufficient to demonstrate the validity of my work.

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any further questions.

Kind regards,

Elise van den Dungen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Maersk Backload Campaign Report
email_chain.body:
Dear Miss van den Dungen,

Thank you very much for offering to share more details about your research. The information you're planning to release will be very useful in the context of my ongoing backload campaign strategies. I'd be happy to provide you with any relevant, non-confidential data points from our internal operations that could potentially further refine the accuracy of your research. Let me know if that is of interest to you.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon,

Wilson Knight

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Maersk Backload Campaign Report
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Knight,

Thank you so much for offering to share relevant data with me. Access to internal operational data would certainly be beneficial in refining the accuracy of my report. I would be happy to review any information you are willing to provide. Please let me know the best way to send it to you for review before publishing the report.

Kind regards,

Elise van den Dungen

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry: 7,000 MT Coal Durban to Tokyo
email_chain.body:
Hello Martin,

Let me tell you a little story. When I was a young boy, my father would regularly take me to the harbour where we would buy a shiny new fishing boat. I can still remember vividly how excited we were about the boat. I even drew my own boat on the beach, before we took it for a spin. I'm sure you can imagine how sad I was when my father came back, covered in blood! The poor boy (in my boat) couldn't swim! My father managed to catch the boy and somehow held onto the rope to the boat until the boy calmed down enough to reach for the rope. We are both thankful that the boat didn't sink. I tell you this story because I feel I have had a similar experience with this project. At first I had grand plans, and a shiny

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Cricket Equipment Shipment to Quetta
email_chain.body:
Hello Andrea,

I'm shipping a container of cricket equipment from Brisbane to Quetta. Could you please advise if the cricket equipment requires any special handling or customs procedures during transit?

Regards,
Saroop

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Cricket Equipment Shipment to Quetta
email_chain.body:
Hi Saroop,

To clarify, are you looking to send cricket equipment to me, or are you inquiring about customs clearance for your shipment?

I need to know if it is necessary to get customs clearance for a container of cricket equipment I'm shipping to Quetta from Brisbane.

Thanks,
Saroop

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Cricket Equipment Shipment to Quetta
email_chain.body:
Hi Saroop,

Good to hear from you. I just received my visa. I'm preparing to pick up my shipment and travel to Quetta. I shipped a container of cricket equipment from Brisbane, and I need to know if you can assist with picking it up from the port and handling the customs clearance.

Alternatively, do I need to hire a local customs agent to get it cleared? Also, could you provide contact information for the shipping agent at the port?

Regards,
Andrea

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Cricket Equipment Shipment to Quetta
email_chain.body:
Hey Andrea,

I've taken your advice and hired a local customs agent to clear the cricket equipment. I've also made arrangements to pick up the container from the port. The agent emphasized the importance of clearing the equipment promptly to avoid potential storage fees or even the container being sold off.

I'll be flying to Quetta in approximately 10 days and will arrive at the port to retrieve the container. The agent mentioned that a truck will be arranged to transport the container to my final destination. I do have a few questions:

1. How do you typically handle payment for customs clearance?
2. Should I anticipate additional fees from the trucking company?
3. I'm concerned about space. What if the container is completely full? I need to ensure all my cricket equipment can fit.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Cricket Equipment Shipment to Quetta
email_chain.body:
Hi Saroop,

Regarding your questions:

1.  *How do you typically handle payment for customs clearance?* 
If you're paying the agent directly, I suggest using a prepaid card and retaining all receipts. The agent will use those funds to cover the customs fees and maintain records. Upon collecting your cricket equipment, you'll reimburse the agent and keep their receipt.

2.  *Should I anticipate additional fees from the trucking company?*
I highly recommend requesting a detailed quote from the customs agent that includes transportation. Once you approve the cost, pay the agent, and they should manage the paperwork. Make sure to keep a copy of the quote for your records.

3.   I did not find any information regarding the answer to your third question. So I removed it.

Maria Garcia

email_chain.subject: RE: Methanol Shipment - Yokohama to Halifax

You were right, it's tight, but we can accommodate the 2,300 MT of methanol to Halifax on the 14th. We can only guarantee that date using a Maersk vessel, which will incur an additional $300 charge. Otherwise, no problem.

Nick Fleming

email_chain.subject: RE: Methanol Shipment - Yokohama to Halifax

Once again, I am grateful for your diligence in delivering on a timely basis. I also appreciate your hard work in reorganizing the team to ensure a smooth transition to the new projects. I will definitely be referring your excellent service to others, should any of them be in need of reliable project managers.

I have a new project that I think would be a good fit for your organization, as it would allow you to continue to impress my clients. Please let me know if you are interested in the project and what our next steps would be. You can reach me at (555)-555-5555.

email_chain.subject: Cotton Inquiry and Sellers
email_chain.body:
Hello James,

Could you put me in touch with some cotton sellers? I'd like to have them come to my office next week for a price inquiry. Also, could you briefly outline your procedure for dispatching cotton from Port Sudan to Qingdao?

Best regards,
Isabelle

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Inquiry and Sellers
email_chain.body:
Dear Isabelle,

Thank you for your inquiry. For cotton-related matters, please contact Mr. Adebayouba Ayodeji either through your office or by calling us directly in Lagos at +234-803-571-0994.

Sincerely,
Mutebi Group Plc
[Est. 1986]
We are renowned as a marketing company for local rice and cotton. In 2011, we decided to begin cotton marketing, particularly for our reputable local spinning mill clients. To this end, we have been actively developing a network of registered cotton farmers, with the ultimate goal of providing and marketing cotton to our spinning mill clients as well as other cotton users locally and internationally. To this end, our company is currently working with cotton farmers in Benue, Kano, Jigawa and other Northern States, to establish and manage quality agricultural activities (Farming and ginning) in a business-like manner.

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Inquiry and Sellers
email_chain.body:
Good day,

I am trying to contact Mr. Ayodeji but need his email address. Could you please provide it?

Additionally, I have a few questions regarding your cotton operations:

*   Is there after-sales service on the farm after the cotton is harvested?
*   What is the average acreage of 1 hectare?
*   Are you affiliated with any cotton gin? If so, how can we explore a business relationship?
*   Are you currently supplying cotton to spinning mills in Nigeria? If yes, have you already secured enough buyers for the 2015/2016 season?
*   How do you determine the prices for each cotton type on your platform?
*   How do you sell and generate your profits?

Thank you for your time.

Best regards,
Isabelle

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Inquiry and Sellers
email_chain.body:
Dear Isabelle,

This is Michael Adebayo, working with Mr. Ayodeji Adebayouba. Mr. Ayodeji is the Regional General Manager. You can reach me directly at michael.adebayo@outlook.com or by phone at +2348054092947.

I will forward your questions to the appropriate department and ensure you receive prompt answers.

Best regards,
Michael Adebayo

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Inquiry and Sellers
email_chain.body:
Dear Isabelle,

We thank you for contacting us and for your interest in potentially investing in our cotton farming operation.

We are currently growing cotton in partnership with registered and experienced cotton farmers in Benue State.

We offer long-term partnership opportunities to investors or customers of our cotton product.

Through this partnership, your company will have access to our farming base and cotton production statistics.

With the current average cotton yield of approximately 900 kgs/acre, we anticipate achieving a yield of 1,800 kgs/acre with improved farming techniques.

We look forward to discussing this further with you.

Sincerely,
Mutebi Group Plc

We believe we can potentially cut the berth time by one day. Would you be able to confirm if dispatching by December 20th, or earlier, is feasible with this adjusted schedule?

email_chain.subject: Confidential Offer
email_chain.body:
Mr. Wallach,

This is Meribor. I have a very special offer for you. I have some work for you that will not take a lot of time or energy. If you take the job, I can give you half of the money upfront. I think you will find the job easy and the pay outstanding. I need a single person. No partners.

Job Description:

1. I am moving illegal goods from Port Benda to Port Wussco on the submarine Andrea, via Port Aini. Andrea will be in Port Benda for 3 days.

2. You must find the exact arrival time of the Andrea. The Andrea will leave Port Wussco the same day for Port Minab.

3. You must find a way to get the goods safely from Andrea to Port Wussco. That is important.

4. [Content cut due to the email fragment in the raw text]

email_chain.subject: Aluminum Shipment - Mombasa to Haiphong - Urgent Tariff Concerns
email_chain.body:
Hi Koen,

We have a 6,500 MT shipment of aluminum ready to go from Mombasa to Haiphong. Is it still feasible to ship by July 19th, 2024? We're concerned about potential tariff increases related to COP26, so please let us know your best offer for this shipment. 

Many thanks,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: RE: Aluminum Shipment - Mombasa to Haiphong - Urgent Tariff Concerns
email_chain.body:
Koen,

Hope you’re well.

I've been reviewing the COP26 tax proposal and its potential impact. As you know, the EDC tax rate is projected to increase to 6% in 2024, potentially reaching $70/MT if it doesn't increase further in subsequent years. Therefore, shipping this order before these changes take effect is a priority, as we are planning to increase our exposure to aluminum.

I have a few questions regarding the tax implications:

1. The current EDC tax rate is 3%, with an expected increase of 3% in 2024 and potentially 4% in 2025. Is there any further clarity on projected rates beyond 2025? I understand this is subject to change, but any insight would be helpful.

Many thanks,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: RE: Aluminum Shipment - Mombasa to Haiphong - Urgent Tariff Concerns
email_chain.body:
Koen,

Following up on our discussion, we also have another product we are looking to ship in November 2024. Do you think it is worth considering a new LCOE contract in addition to the standard shipping costs for this?

I understand that there's a potential for prices to drop because of the weakening Dalian index, but that it may be difficult to find lumps in the market and LCOEs are becoming harder to secure. I'd appreciate your insights.

Many thanks,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Aluminum Shipment - Documentation & FMC Declaration
email_chain.body:
Koen,

I've sent the shipment documentation in this email. Please let me know if there are any issues.

I've also attached the FMC Declaration in case that's something you require.

Please feel free to reach out if you have any questions. 

Many thanks for your help!

Adrian

email_chain.body:

I haven't received any communication from you regarding this additional amount, and I was waiting for your update before making the payment. If it's indeed related to the ELT, the amount seems higher than expected. Could you please clarify?

Many thanks for your assistance,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Late Delivery - Additional Charges
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Fletcher,

We regret to inform you that due to the late delivery, we must apply additional charges as per our agreement. These charges are as follows:

Overtime Fee: USD 1,500 (calculated at 150% of the original overtime rate due to the delay).

Please confirm your agreement with these charges. Thank you for your understanding.

Best regards,
Emma

email_chain.subject: RE: Late Delivery - Additional Charges
email_chain.body:
Dear Emma,

I understand that there are additional costs due to the unforeseen delay. However, the delay was caused by circumstances outside of our control, specifically the port congestion. 

Given the circumstances, I propose the following adjustment to the charges:

Overtime Fee: USD 1,500 (as per your calculation).
Compensation for our losses incurred as a result of the delay: USD 1,000.

I hope this is agreeable to you.

Best regards,
Fletcher

Rate Inquiry - 1500 MT Chemical Products - Asia

Good afternoon Mr. James,

I am interested in offloading 1500 MT of chemical products in Asia. We are looking at a 2500 GP container and need to complete the shipment within the next 30 days. Could you please provide a rate quotation?

Thanks,

Daniel Mills

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry - 1500 MT Chemical Products - Asia
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Mills,

Thank you for your email regarding a rate for shipping 1500 MT of chemical products in a 2500 GP container to Asia.

Please see the rates below for your consideration:

1. Per Unit Rate (USD/MT):
     2500GP: 27,650

2. Consolidation Basis (USD/MT):
     2500GP: 27,650

Assuming your vessel will be ready to load around June 16th, 2024, we will be using standard SWB bags (1250 kgs each).

Please let me know if these rates are acceptable. 

Regards,

Robert James

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry - 1500 MT Chemical Products - Asia
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. James,

Thank you for your email. We will have the full cargo ready to load as per your proposed schedule for the container mentioned. The cargo will be delivered to your docks on the 15th of June 2024.

Thank you,

Daniel Mills

Greetings Mr. James,

We are pleased to confirm our shipment order of 2500GP of chemical materials from our ship’s berth at Your Company’s Port on June 16th, 2024, to the same port. Our shipping line will be Vessel Name, which will be arriving at the port on June 15th, 2024.

email_chain.subject: Cargo Availability Request - Lime and Vegetable Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Benjamin,

We require information on your vessel availability to avoid potential cargo delays. We are planning to ship three consecutive loads of lime, followed by a shipment of vegetable oil approximately two weeks later.

We understand you have a dry cargo vessel suitable for the lime shipments. However, it appears that the vessel would only be available for the vegetable oil after a two-week laytime. 

Could you please advise on your available vessels for the initial lime shipments at your earliest convenience, and then again closer to the date you estimate to be available for the vegetable oil shipment?

We appreciate your prompt response.

Thank you,

Luis Garcia

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Availability Request - Lime and Vegetable Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Luis,

Thank you for your inquiry. Our vessel availability is as follows:

Vessel "KT BV": Available from December 27, 2013, for loading lime. Subsequently available for another lime load on January 2, 2014, and for a load of vegetable oil on or around January 15, 2014. This timeline appears suitable for your vegetable oil shipment.

Vessel "RHV BV": Available from December 27, 2013, for loading lime. However, this vessel can handle a load of vegetable oil starting on December 29, 2013.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Sincerely,

Nina Williams

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Availability Request - Lime and Vegetable Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Nina,

Thank you for your offer. We accept your offer for the load of lime available on the vessel "KT BV" starting December 27, 2013.

We would ...

email_chain.subject: KT BV - Lime Cargo Loading Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Williams,

I have been in contact with the transporter responsible for loading your vessel "KT BV". They are planning to commence loading this morning.

While I don't yet have the complete bill of lading, we can proceed with a load confirmation if acceptable. We require a copy of the bill of lading and a signed cargo receipt for our records.

Please advise when we can expect to receive these documents.

Thank you,

Luis Garcia

email_chain.subject: Re: KT BV - Lime Cargo Loading Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Luis,

We are pleased to confirm that we anticipate receiving the cargo receipt from your shipper by tomorrow, December 31, 2013. 

Furthermore, we have confirmed that our master will receive the bill of lading. While I don't have an exact arrival time, he will be available at our pier tomorrow, December 31, 2013.

Sincerely,

Nina Williams

email_chain.subject: Re: KT BV - Lime Cargo Loading Confirmation - Document Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Luis,

Further to my previous email regarding your cargo, I now have a copy of the signed cargo receipt.

Our master is scheduled to arrive at our pier around 10:00 AM on January 1, 2014. If the bill of lading arrives before then, we will gladly send you a copy.

Could you please confirm if this arrangement is acceptable?

Sincerely,

Nina Williams

Our client also wants to avoid demurrage charges, so please confirm this with Globex.

email_chain.body:

Following up on our previous conversation regarding the 7,500 MT polyethylene pellets shipment. Can you please provide an earlier laycan date if possible, and confirm again that no demurrage will be charged? We want to avoid any delays.

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Anthracite Coal Inquiry - West Bengal to Kuching
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

We are looking to ship approximately 4,100 MT of anthracite coal from West Bengal to Kuching. Could you please confirm your demurrage rate and any weekend berth restrictions at Kuching?

Also, would you anticipate being able to provide a lump sum freight quote for this shipment?

Regards,

Jade Lee

email_chain.subject: Re: Anthracite Coal Inquiry - West Bengal to Kuching
email_chain.body:
Morning Jade,

Thank you for your email.

The demurrage charge would be USD 10 per day, subject to ICD (Inland Container Depot) storage fees. We anticipate requiring a two-week clearance period.

We can provide a lump sum freight quote upon receipt of further details, including your firm contract offer (FCO), bill of lading (B/L) details, and DCS (Document Clearance System) information.

Regarding coal testing samples: these can be shipped with the main consignment, or we can arrange pickup from the ICD. Please note that we cannot open samples at the ICD itself; this will need to be done at the port facility where the shipment is scheduled for loading.

We currently have a berth window available from July 26th to August 3rd. Loading can be scheduled within this timeframe.

Should you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to ask.

Best regards,

Transglobal Shipping

email_chain.subject: Re: Anthracite Coal Inquiry - West Bengal to Kuching
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your prompt response.

Could you please provide additional information regarding the sample testing procedure?

Are you able to process the cargo under our standard terms & conditions?

Is it possible to receive a copy of your terms & conditions via email?

Finally, what is the preferred method for submitting the completed quotation to you?

Regards,

Jade Lee

email_chain.subject: Re: Anthracite Coal Inquiry - West Bengal to Kuching
email_chain.body:
Thanks Jade for your prompt response,

It’s my pleasure to provide the requested information:

Sample testing will be conducted at the port facility prior to cargo loading. We require a sample FCO for each item being tested. Please note that the test report will provide results for each item, but will not specify the quantity of each item tested individually. The invoice for the samples will be generated separately from the main cargo invoice.

Could you please confirm whether you can accept our standard terms and conditions? We can send these to you.

Best regards,

Transglobal Shipping

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Steel Shipment from Port Klang to Khor Al Zubair - Lightering Issue
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Phal,

We are facing an urgent issue with the steel shipment from Port Klang to Khor Al Zubair. Due to lightering complications at the port, we need to discharge the cargo within the next 3 hours. email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Steel Shipment from Port Klang to Khor Al Zubair - Lightering Issue
email_chain.body:
Dear Prince,

I assume you are referring to the STS discharge of cargo off of the BULKER at Berth 7 in Port Klang, Malaysia.

The most reliable vessel currently available would be the bulker ZEMASHTO. You can find the ZEMASHTO's schedule at the following link; please check for planned port calls: http://www.fleeter.com/Schedu...CafCoMarine-DwhThomo.txt.

You may also contact Mr. E. Sary, the agent in Port Klang, by sending him an email to sary@kelangmarinesdn.com.

Sincerely,
Quan Chu

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Steel Shipment from Port Klang to Khor Al Zubair - Lightering Issue
email_chain.body:
Dear Quan Chu,

Thank you for your prompt response. I have discussed this with Mr. Sary, our representative in Port Klang. He confirms that the ZEMASHTO, one of our vessels, is currently on the berth and has approximately 8 hours remaining to offload. Therefore, I agree that this vessel is likely the most suitable for the cargo discharge from the BULKER at Berth 7 in Port Klang, Malaysia.

Should there be any other issues or inquiries, please feel free to contact me.

Regards,
Prince
