email_chain.subject: Diesel Shipment Inquiry - Venezuela to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hello M/s Alex,

I need to schedule a shipment of 3,200 MT of diesel from Venezuela to Rotterdam. I have 8 deliveries planned from July 15 to August 1. What is your deposit policy for such a shipment? Do you prefer payment by wire transfer or cash?

Looking forward to your reply,

Tal

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Inquiry - Venezuela to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hi Tal,

Thank you for the inquiry. We would be glad to proceed. 

Our minimum deposit is US$100,000 per shipment. For 8 shipments, the total minimum deposit required would be US$800,000, payable in 8 installments of US$100,000 each. This amount will be deducted from the total value of your shipments.

For instance, if we ship 3,200 MT of diesel at US$500 per MT, the total cost would be US$1,600,000. The US$800,000 deposit will be deducted, making the remaining balance US$800,000.

This advance payment is required to guarantee your shipment.

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Inquiry - Venezuela to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hi Tal,

Please see the email below for context. I apologize for any misunderstanding or abrupt ending in the previous email. 
Our forwarders are more risk-averse than most people think. They have limited resources and allocate most of their funds to freight. They don't have the flexibility to take risks on shipments. I hope you understand their concerns.

Regards,

Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Inquiry - Venezuela to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hi Tal,

I apologize for the previous email. I am very sorry for the misunderstanding regarding the deposit requirement.

The reason for the higher deposit amount, compared to what most clients usually pay, is the substantial amount involved and the short notice.

This advance payment is to guarantee your shipment and ensure that you will be able to pay for our freight charges. This amount will be considered as a surety for your freight charges.

Our forwarders are more risk-averse than what most people would think. They have limited resources and allocate most of their funds to freight. They do not have the flexibility to take risks on any shipment, and I fully understand their concerns.

I hope you have a good day.

Regards,

Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Inquiry - Venezuela to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hi Tal,

Please see the email below for the explanation regarding the deposit.

Our forwarders are more risk-averse than what most people would think. They have limited resources and allocate most of their funds to freight. They don't have the flexibility to take risks on shipments, and I fully understand their concerns.

I hope you have a good day.

Regards,

Alex

email_chain.body:
Hi Tom,

To provide you with an accurate quote, I need some additional information:

*   What is the maximum allowable weight per container?
*   What is the 'use-by' or 'sell-by' date for the pork?
*   Are there any specific requirements for the port of discharge in Amsterdam (e.g., specific terminal)?

Thank you,
Zoe

| November 20th, 2022  | €5,850.00            |

Please note these are subject to change based on space availability and fuel surcharges. Providing the requested details from my previous email will allow me to give you a firm quote.

Zoe

email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry: Rotterdam to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Dear Globex Logistics,

My name is Pat Smith, and I'm looking to arrange shipment of approximately 2,900 MT of cargo from Rotterdam to Mombasa. I would like to know if you have a suitable vessel departing late next month that could handle this. Could you please provide your laycan options?

Best wishes,
Pat Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry: Rotterdam to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi Pat,

Thanks for your inquiry. To assess our ability to accommodate your shipment, please provide the following details:

1. Cargo Name
2. Gross Tonnage (GT) / Net Tonnage (NT) of the vessel you're looking for.
3. Gross Weight of the cargo
4. Packaging Details (e.g., bagged, palletized, etc.)
5. Type of Shipment: LCL (Less than Container Load) or FCL (Full Container Load) - or break bulk if neither
6. Preferred Loading Window in Rotterdam
7. Port of Discharge: Mombasa (confirming)
8. If containerized, preferred Container Type (e.g., 20' GP, 40' HC)

Thanks,
Globex Logistics

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 6,000 MT Liquid Sugar to Surabaya
email_chain.body:
Hi,

We would like to move 6,000 MT of liquid sugar to Surabaya, ideally using a heavy lift/project cargo carrier with a capacity around 27,000 MT. Do you have any vessel availability for loading by the 20th of November? Could you also provide information on your earliest demurrage structure?

Thank you for your time.

Brian

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 6,000 MT Liquid Sugar to Surabaya
email_chain.body:
Dear Brian,

Thank you for your inquiry. Unfortunately, we do not have any vessel availability for loading by November 20th due to prior commitments and scheduling constraints. The earliest we would have a suitable vessel available would be around November 25th.

Regarding demurrage, the rates are subject to negotiation based on several factors, including the specific vessel and the agreed-upon laytime. Our starting point for demurrage is typically USD 1.00 per cubic foot per day.

Shipowner's Demurrage Policy (FOB Conditions):
US$ 1.00 per cubic foot per day, subject to a maximum annual rate per cubic foot of US$ 75.

Please let us know if the November 25th timeframe is feasible, and we can discuss further details.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 6,000 MT Liquid Sugar to Surabaya
email_chain.body:
Sorry Brian,

Following a thorough review of our current vessel schedules, I regret to inform you that we have no available slots to Surabaya until August. 

Thanks and best regards,
Katie

email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry - Cartagena to Calcutta
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Fernandez,

I hope this email finds you well.

I am writing to inquire about the possibility of transporting approximately 50,000 metric tons (MT) of a specialized chemical product from Cartagena to Calcutta by the end of October. 

Would your vessel be available for such a shipment within that timeframe? Could you please also confirm whether your vessel's lines can be used for the simultaneous transportation of rubber?

Finally, please provide a cost estimate for this voyage.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Cartagena to Calcutta
email_chain.body:
Dear Victor,

Thank you for your inquiry.

Unfortunately, I must inform you that transporting 50,000 MT of the mentioned chemical within your requested timeframe is not feasible. Our available vessel currently has a maximum cargo capacity of 30,000 MT.

Yes, the vessel's lines can be used for transporting rubber concurrently.

Regarding pricing:

*   Hypothetical Napalm Transport (if capacity allowed): 100,000 USD per round trip
*   Rubber Transport: 10,000 USD per round trip
*   Additional fees: 200,000 Rupees

Please note that these prices are estimates and subject to change based on market conditions and final cargo specifications.

If you wish to proceed, payment can be made to the following account:

Account Name: Steven Catherst
Email: ddc@thegoodstuff.com

Regards,
Roger Mertens

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Cartagena to Calcutta
email_chain.body:
Sir,

Please send the requested account details via secure mail. Time is of the essence.

Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Cartagena to Calcutta
email_chain.body:
Sir,

The account information you provided in the last email may have been compromised. I will now be sending you the account number.

Username:
thegoodstuff
Password:
dccccccc

Please change your password if necessary.

Thanks,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Cartagena to Calcutta
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Upon further review, I regret to inform you that I cannot proceed with transporting your goods, even at the reduced capacity of 30,000 MT that my vessel is able to transport. The available cargo space currently filled with other obligations.

Given your willingness to share financial information, and the potential lost profits due to this canceled agreement, I have decided to charge you 2% of the hypothetical value of the remaining 20,000 MT (the difference between your request of 50,000 MT and our current maximum capacity of 30,000 MT) of the specialized chemical product.

To calculate this, I will proceed with a hypothetical 1,000 MT 'trip' to quantify the cost. This fictional 'trip' will incur the following charges:

*   100,000 USD (Hypothetical Napalm Transport)
*   100,000 USD (Hypothetical Rubber Transport)
*   200,000 Rupees (Additional Fees)
*   1,200 USD (Hypothetical Napalm Cost per Roundtrip)

Please remit payment to the following account:

Username:
cckkkl
Password:
tweq7vc

Best Regards,
Roger Mertens

You're the most responsive, I have to say. I'm sure the guys on my end will adjust to the $300 TEC FOB CS price for the April 19 shipment. I'll get back to you on this later.

Regards,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Inquiry

Hi Dana,

Thanks,
Carl

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Carl,

Is the sale of the April 19 methanol shipment completed, or would you consider 50k MT at $300 TEC FOB CS? The booking cost is $35 per unit of MT.

Regards,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Dana,

Thanks for the note. I'm glad we reached an agreement on price for 25k MT. I can lock it in for 50k MT of the April 19 methanol at $300 TEC FOB CS, and I'm ready to book it now. Is that a deal?

Thanks,
Carl

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Inquiry
email_chain.body: Yes, Carl, I'm ready to finalize the sale of the April 19 methanol at $300 TEC FOB CS. We're going to need a booking cost of $35 per unit of MT to hold the cargo in Rotterdam.

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Carl,

That's good news. I'll send you an invoice shortly. We're going to need a booking cost of $35 per unit of MT to hold the cargo in Rotterdam, and of course we'll have to pay for delivery to destination.

Best,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Sales Rep Budget Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi there,

I was at a function recently and met someone who mentioned an annual budget for sales representatives. They suggested it might be around $200,000, but I wanted to get a more accurate figure. Could you tell me what the budget was last year?

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Sales Rep Budget Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

Last year, the total budget for the Sales Rep division was approximately $2,500,000.

If you could potentially bring in that kind of revenue, I'd be very interested in discussing it further. Please feel free to contact me directly at unknown@example.com.

Regards,
[Sender Name]

email_chain.subject: Re: Sales Rep Budget Inquiry
email_chain.body:
That'll be $50,000, then.

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: RE: Sales Rep Budget Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

After a lot of thought, I've decided that you're really, really good at this. Actually, I would like you to run my company from now on, unless you need me to write any of the code.

Regards,
[Sender Name]

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: 1000 MT Coal to Al Khobar

Joseph

Joseph,

Apologies, in my previous email I failed to specify the coal types needed. We require both bituminous and anthracite coal. This requirement will be ongoing for the next couple of months. Please confirm if you can still provide freight options considering these coal types and the repeated shipments.

Yours Truly,
Tom

Emily

Tom,

My apologies for the delayed response. I'm writing to inform you that our last shipment received from you was 15% over the agreed-upon dimensions. This caused significant issues during handling.

Could you please ensure that all dimensions are strictly adhered to for this week's shipment and future deliveries? Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Best Regards,
Shawn

email_chain.subject: Positive Feedback on Rail Scrap Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Shawn,

I'm writing to confirm that we have received your shipment of rail scrap. I must say that your team did an excellent job with the logistics and handling. We appreciate the smooth and efficient delivery.

Sincerely,
Customer Feedback Team

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Diesel Shipment - Amsterdam to Karachi
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Reid,

I need to transport 5,000 MT of diesel from Amsterdam to Karachi. The earliest shipment is required.

How can you help us with this?

Kind regards,
Ann Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Diesel Shipment - Amsterdam to Karachi
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Reid,

Following up on Ann Jones' email regarding the 5,000 MT diesel shipment from Amsterdam to Karachi.

I have a few clarifying questions about your services:

1. Do you provide dedicated customer support throughout the shipping process?
2. If not, will we be responsible for managing all shipping details independently?
3. Could you please provide a list of the required documents for this shipment?
4. Could you please provide indicative air and ocean freight rates for shipping this cargo from Amsterdam to Karachi?

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Janni Meier

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Diesel Shipment - Amsterdam to Karachi
email_chain.body:
Hello Janni,

Thank you for reaching out. We appreciate your interest in our freight shipping services.

Our company offers professional freight shipping solutions to and from Karachi. We strive to provide our customers with the most cost-effective solutions for transporting their cargo.

Regarding your questions, we do offer customer support. We can certainly provide indicative ocean and air freight prices, but for an accurate quote, we will need more information regarding the exact specifications of the diesel, desired delivery date, and incoterms required. We will also require all necessary documentation (e.g. commercial invoice, packing list, etc.), as is standard procedure.

To get started with a formal quote, please provide the above information.

Kind regards,
Aarjav Patel

email_chain.subject: Freight Offer: 5,000 MT Base Chemicals - Hamburg to Elsenborn
email_chain.body:
Dear Ernesto,

Our vessel [THE VESSEL] is available to carry a 5,000 MT chemical shipment of base chemicals from Hamburg to Elsenborn (Mouth of the Meuse river). The charter cost is 80% of the total freight value. A Letter of Credit will be available from your bank upon arrival at the discharge port.

We can call at Hamburg on March 24th, subject to charter agreement within 24 hours and cargo onboard by March 26th.

We look forward to closing this deal.

Kind regards,
Irina Petrov

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer: 5,000 MT Base Chemicals - Hamburg to Elsenborn
email_chain.body:
Dear Irina,

Thank you for your email and for sending the draft contract in advance. I will review it this evening and call you tomorrow with any remarks.

Thanks again.

Regards,
Sven Jansen

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer: 5,000 MT Base Chemicals - Hamburg to Elsenborn - Letter of Credit Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Sven,

Thank you for your feedback regarding the Letter of Credit. We experienced some internal restructuring with our banking partners, but these issues have now been resolved. Our new banking arrangements will be fully operational from March 24th onwards.

Kind regards,
Martin Weber

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 4,000 MT Steel Ingots - Caracas to Acapulco
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Hernandez,

Our group needs to ship 4,000 MT of steel ingots from Caracas to Acapulco. Could you please confirm your interest in securing space on your latest vessel, and if you foresee any potential port congestion at either end?

Yours,

Patrick Santiago

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 4,000 MT Steel Ingots - Caracas to Acapulco
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Santiago,

Good morning.

We currently have sufficient space for your shipment of steel ingots on our vessel. We anticipate sailing from Caracas around January 4th, with an estimated arrival in Acapulco approximately 15 days later. We are not currently anticipating any significant port congestion; however, we will continue to monitor the situation. 

Would you like to proceed with booking this shipment?

Sincerely,

Hernandez

P.S. Once we receive your confirmation, we can add your cargo to the vessel manifest.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 4,000 MT Steel Ingots - Caracas to Acapulco
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hernandez,

Thank you for your prompt response and the proposed schedule. Please keep us updated on any potential issues with port congestion, especially in Acapulco. 

Yes, please consider this email as confirmation that we would like to proceed with the booking for the January 4th sailing.

Best Regards,

Guillermo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 4,000 MT Steel Ingots - Caracas to Acapulco
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Santiago,

Thank you for your confirmation. We will monitor the situation and let you know immediately if there are any changes to the schedule due to port congestion or any other unforeseen circumstances.

Sincerely,

Hernandez

email_chain.subject: Update: Potential Delay - Caracas to Acapulco Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Santiago,

We've received word of increased cargo volume passing through Acapulco, which might cause delays. We may need to postpone loading your cargo by approximately one week. We will continue monitoring the situation closely and provide another update as soon as possible.

Sincerely,

Hernandez

email_chain.subject: Re: Update: Potential Delay - Caracas to Acapulco Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hernandez,

We received some good news from our contacts in Acapulco! The congestion appears to be clearing. We now anticipate the steel ingots will arrive in Acapulco around February 9th, barring any further unforeseen delays. Please confirm if you are able to accomodate this estimated arrival date.

Best regards,

Guillermo

email_chain.subject: Re: Update: Potential Delay - Caracas to Acapulco Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Santiago,

Thank you for the update. I have adjusted the vessel manifest to reflect the estimated arrival date of February 9th. I will contact you immediately should there be any last-minute changes.

Best regards,

Hernandez

email_chain.subject: Maize Flour Inquiry - Oxera
email_chain.body:

Could you confirm your availability to pick up 2,000 MT of maize flour from Oxera next week?

Best wishes,

email_chain.body:

Thank you for your email. Unfortunately, I will be unavailable during the week of May 16th to May 22nd, and won't be able to visit your office then.

I am currently able to be in your country only on May 15th, 17th, and 19th. Please advise on the most convenient day for you.

Best regards,

Anna Nansen

email_chain.subject: Re: Maize Flour Inquiry - Oxera
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Nansen,

Thank you for your email. Unfortunately, I am only able to make arrangements for a meeting on the 21st or 22nd of May. I apologize for any inconvenience.

Giorgio

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry - Kaohsiung Departure
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Blake,

We have approximately 8,000 MT of chemical product due to depart from Kaohsiung. We're looking to fill some of the remaining space. We're planning on shipping 1,000 MT of adhesives and 2,000 MT of lighteners. We're open to either FCL or LCL.

Could you please provide a quote?

Thanks,
Robert Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Kaohsiung Departure
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

We have confirmed available space for 1,000 MT of adhesives to be loaded in Kaohsiung. 

Our service charge for this shipment would be US$300.  The estimated outgassing cost for 1,000 MT is US$25 per day.

We are expecting the truck on February 10th.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Regards,
Shawn Lee

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry - Kaohsiung Departure - FCL Received
email_chain.body:
Robert,

This confirms that we've received your FCL containing the adhesives and lighteners from Kaohsiung. 

Please let us know if you require any further services in the future.

Thank you!

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - Shipment #9999 - Zhejiang to Los Angeles
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

Our supplier has provided us with the following freight details: shipment #9999 from Zhejiang, destination Los Angeles.

We have received the FCL quote and outgassing cost Shawn provided for the Kaohsiung shipment. We now have a separate requirement:

We have 1,000 MT of adhesives and 1,000 MT of lighteners ready for shipment from Zhejiang to Los Angeles. We are willing to receive the shipment between February 10th and February 12th.

Please quote us on the following and confirm:

The buyer would like to cover the shipment on either the 10th or 12th of February. 

Please advise by Friday, February 1st, 2018.

Thank you.

email_chain.subject: RE: Freight Quote Request - Shipment #9999 - Zhejiang to Los Angeles
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Please find attached our quotation for the above-listed goods.

Please review and let us know if you have any questions or require changes.

Thank you,
Bhaiyya Cargo Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Booking Inquiry: 3,600 MT Cheddar Cheese - Marseille to Kobe
email_chain.body:
Mr. K,

We have a 3,600 MT shipment of cheddar cheese from Marseille to Kobe. Can we book a spot on one of your vessels in May?

All the best,
Madeleine

email_chain.subject: RE: Cheddar Cheese Inspection - Marseille Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Madeleine,

The team and I had an inspection in Calais today. Unfortunately, the cheddar cheese from Marseille isn't holding up to our quality standards. We will reject this portion of the shipment.

Please confirm what we should do with the rejected shipment and ship the rest of the cargo (if any), hopefully by tomorrow.

We will take responsibility for the inspection costs related to this rejection.

Sincerely,
Michael

email_chain.subject: RE: Booking Inquiry: 3,600 MT Cheddar Cheese - Marseille to Kobe - UPDATE
email_chain.body:
Mr. K,

Following our previous email, we've been in touch with our client regarding the cheese inspection in Calais. They've agreed to a 100% refund for the rejected portion. They've also agreed to reimburse us for the $7,500 we paid in shipping costs related to the rejected portion of the shipment.

On a personal note, this trip gave me the opportunity to see the Parisian railway station, which was fascinating! We'll keep you updated on the process of getting the remaining (if any) cheese to Kobe.

All the best,
Madeleine

email_chain.subject: Action Required: File for Kobe Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. K,

Please send the necessary file to the 'green inbox' and let me know once you've sent it. Once it's in the green inbox, I can mark it as completed.

All the best,
Madeleine

email_chain.subject: Schedule Update - Next Two Months
email_chain.body:
Mr. K,

I'll let you know next week what my schedule will be like for the next two months.

All the best,
Madeleine

email_chain.body:

Kind regards,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: Urgent Request: 250MT Liquid Nitrogen - Alexandria to Balikpapan
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Huang,

We require 250MT of liquid nitrogen to be shipped from Alexandria to Balikpapan by the end of this week. The intended vessel is scheduled to enter dry dock at 16:00 today, so we would appreciate receiving your offer by 12:00.

Regarding the attached EPCD (Energy Performance Certificate Document), please let me know if you require any further information.

Mr. Lewis is a major shareholder in the shipping company, Mr. Green will leave our brokering firm at the end of the month.

Sincerely,
Daniel James
NGL

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Request: 250MT Liquid Nitrogen - Alexandria to Balikpapan
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Huang,

We have a potential booking for 250MT of liquid nitrogen from Alexandria to Balikpapan onboard vessel XXX, scheduled to depart in four days. She will be in dry dock for approximately 20 days after arrival, so timely action is crucial.

However, I see that your current confirmed order is only for 150MT. Please confirm if you still require the full 250MT, as this affects available shipping capacity.

Sincerely,
Daniel James
NGL

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Request: 250MT Liquid Nitrogen - Alexandria to Balikpapan
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Huang,

Unfortunately, I am unable to confirm the shipment onboard vessel XXX at this time. I have consulted with my broker, Mr. Lewis, who has indicated the capacity is no longer available.

Mr. Lewis may be able to source an alternative vessel with sufficient capacity. You can contact him directly if you wish. I can provide his contact information upon request.

Sincerely,
Daniel James
NGL

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - Polymers Rotterdam to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Hi Chris,

We're commencing our first voyage and need a freight quote. I'm initially looking at a rate with a 0.5% minimum guaranteed, or $35/MT on 6,500MT of polymers from Rotterdam to Hamburg.

I'm willing to consider offers as low as $20/MT. Do you think that's a fair starting point?

Thanks in advance,

Judy

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Polymers Rotterdam to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Hey Judy,

$20/MT is a fair rate given the circumstances. If you're happy with that price, we can arrange a contract.

Thanks for the inquiry!

Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Polymers Rotterdam to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Hi Chris,

That rate is not in line with our internal expectations.

Thanks,
Judy

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Polymers Rotterdam to Hamburg

email_chain.subject: Confession
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

I have to tell you the truth. I've had an affair. There is no getting away from it. We've been meeting every weekend, and I don't know what I'll do now, but we can't carry on the way we are. It was probably my fault that we got involved in the first place; the sexual tension was there all the time. Please be understanding. I don't really want to get into details, but we have met in places and done things that we shouldn't have. It has to stop. Please don't say anything to Fiona. I don't know if you know or not, but we've been seeing each other for over a year now.

Don't say anything to anyone else; it would be best if you just took a few days off work to let me come to terms with things.

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: Sohar to Mombasa - 8,400 MT Clinker
email_chain.body:
Dear Shipping Team,

Could your vessel handle a shipment of 8,400 MT of clinker from Sohar, Oman, to Mombasa, Kenya?

Also, please clarify whether you apply a bunker escalation clause or offer a fixed rate for the voyage.

Regards,
Andrew Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Sohar to Mombasa - 8,400 MT Clinker
email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

Thank you for your inquiry.

Regarding your question about bunker escalation clauses, it's common practice in the sea cargo market to use both simple and indexed escalation clauses due to the fluctuating nature of bunker prices and their impact on bulk rates. These rates are inherently linked to bunker prices and tonnage.

Escalation clauses allow us to adjust rates in response to bunker price increases, providing a mechanism to maintain a fair rate over the duration of the voyage rather than renegotiating or terminating the contract prematurely. This is particularly beneficial when concerns exist regarding potential bunker price increases.

By indexing the contract to bunker prices, both parties have a vested interest in cost savings and transparency. Should bunker prices rise, the contract rates will be adjusted accordingly, allowing for timely adjustments instead of waiting for renewal or termination.

I hope this clarifies our approach. We will provide a specific quote based on current bunker prices, and detail how any escalation clause would be applied to the quoted rate.

Sincerely,
Shipping Company Quote Team

email_chain.subject: Order Status: 12,900 MT Steel Plates to El País
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Gualtieri,

I'm emailing to check on the status of our order for 12,900 MT of steel plates being shipped from Rotterdam to El País. We are currently experiencing delays with customs clearance on our end and wanted to inquire about any issues you might be facing at the port of origin that could be contributing to this.

Any information you can provide regarding the shipment's progress and any customs-related challenges in Rotterdam would be greatly appreciated.

Regards,

Greg Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Status: 12,900 MT Steel Plates to El País
email_chain.body:
Dear Greg,

Thank you for your email. We are aware of the potential for delays at El País customs. Unfortunately, we are experiencing some minor setbacks here in Rotterdam due to increased COVID-19 related security measures, which are impacting processing times for export documentation. 

We are working diligently to ensure full compliance with all regulations to minimize any further delays on your end. We've been proactively communicating about this; however, I wanted to reassure you that we are doing everything possible to keep the shipment on track.

If you have any further questions or specific concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Best Regards,

Rob Janssen

email_chain.body:
Dear Bernard,

Do dry ports exist in Vietnam? I need to send around 4,000 kgs of auto parts from Ho Chi Minh City to Da Lat, just passing through. Any idea what the charges would be?

Thank you,

Jack

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Shipping Auto Parts from HCMC to Da Lat
email_chain.body:
Dear Jack,

Thank you for your email. Yes, we do have dry ports in Vietnam. You mentioned Sava Customs clearance, with an office in Hai Phong port. The service charge for Sava is approximately USD 100 per 40' container. However, we don't have many customers using Sava, as we don't specialize in handling customs duty payments specifically.

If you have any other questions, please feel free to contact me.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely yours,

Bernard

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Shipping Auto Parts from HCMC to Da Lat
email_chain.body:
Thanks Bernard,

It sounds like we shouldn't use Sava then. Is the tariff USD 1,650 per container? The website states USD 600 per container, but is that for *everything* we need to pay? Or is that just the charge for Sava? Thanks.

Jack

email_chain.subject: Cambodia Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Bernard,

Thank you for your information. The charges for your services look reasonable; however, I still need to check for the final quotation and would appreciate your advice on that.

Also, is the term of payment 30% before shipping out the container and the balance upon arrival in Cambodia?

Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Cambodia Shipment Inquiry - Quotation Request
email_chain.body:
Hello Bernard,

Thanks again for the information on your services; however, I still need to review the formal quotation. Can you send it to me in PDF format?

Thanks.

email_chain.subject: Re: Cambodia Shipment Inquiry - Quotation Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Bernard,

Thank you for sending me the PDF file; but I still need clarification regarding the quotation.

I need to know the port of loading in China, and the estimated transit time.

Thanks.

email_chain.subject: Korea Shipment Inquiry - Customs Clearance
email_chain.body:
Dear Bernard,

I've been researching customs clearance requirements on various websites, including yours, and I've come to the conclusion that we *have* to use Sava Customs clearance. Is that correct? If not, can you please give me an alternative? I have two cargo shipments from my warehouse in Korea (Dong Ha Port) which I would like to send to Cambodia. Thanks.

email_chain.subject: Cost Estimate Request - Korea to Cambodia
email_chain.body:
Hi Bernard,

Can you please provide an estimate of the costs for your services regarding the shipment from Korea to Cambodia?

I also have some questions:
1. Does the information I gave you already include all your services? If not, how much will it cost in total?
2. Are the import duties excluded from the quotation?

Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Loading Time Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Bernard,

Thanks for all your information on the services you can provide for us.

Could you please also tell me the estimated time for loading the container in Korea?

labels.load_port: Ho Chi Minh City, Dong Ha Port

We are looking for a carrier to move 10 containers from the Americas (exact port to be confirmed) to a port in the Mediterranean in May. Could you provide us with a quote for a suitable vessel? 

Thanks in advance.

email_chain.subject: Potential Cargo: 6,600 MT LSHS - Al Khobar/Zeebrugge to Balikpapan
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We have a potential cargo opportunity for loading in mid-June, requiring a vessel within the next seven days.

Details are as follows:

*   Port of Loading & Draft:
    *   Al Khobar, Saudi Arabia (15-16 meters)
    *   Zeebrugge, Belgium (13.2 meters)
*   Weight: 6,600 MT of LSHS (Low Sulphur Heavy Stock)
*   Discharge Port: Balikpapan, Indonesia
*   Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) at Discharge Port: Mid-May 2023 (Likely incorrect, please disregard)

Please let me know if you have a suitable vessel available.

Thank you,

Mr. Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Cargo: 6,600 MT LSHS - Al Khobar/Zeebrugge to Balikpapan
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Following up on my previous email regarding the potential cargo for loading in mid-June.

Details are as follows:

*   Port of Loading & Draft:
    *   Al Khobar, Saudi Arabia (15-16 meters)
    *   Zeebrugge, Belgium (13.2 meters)
*   Weight: 6,600 MT of LSHS (Low Sulphur Heavy Stock)
*   Discharge Port: Balikpapan, Indonesia
*   Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) at Discharge Port: Mid-May 2023 (Likely incorrect, please disregard)

Please let me know if you have a suitable vessel available.

Thank you,

Mr. Chen

email_chain.subject: Regarding Suez Canal Transit for Balikpapan Bound Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Zee,

In response to your inquiry, the IMO regulations regarding Suez Canal transit only allow vessels to transit within 24 hours after the loading of LSHS. This timeframe is too tight considering the scheduled sailing window for the cargo ship destined for Balikpapan.

Please let me know if you have any other suggestions.

Regards,

Mr. Chen
Manager, International Trade Department
Inland Water Transportation Corporation

email_chain.subject: Cargo to Northern Borneo from Bangladesh
email_chain.body:
Mr. Chen,

We are currently coordinating the transport of a cargo from Bangladesh to the northern part of Borneo.

email_chain.subject: Shipping Quote Request: Coffee Beans - Shanghai to Paris
email_chain.body:

Could you please provide a shipping quote for 400 kg of coffee beans from Shanghai to Paris? I require a rate to Paris for shipment sometime next month.

Nicole

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: Coffee Beans - Shanghai to Paris
email_chain.body:
Dear Nicole,

Thank you for your email.  We are preparing a quote for the shipment of your 400 kg of coffee beans from Shanghai to Paris. Please note that our initial estimation for air freight is approximately $400. We are offering you a promotional 40% discount, bringing the price down to $240. This figure will be included in the final, detailed quote.

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - Wheat Export to Ensenada
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Taylor,

I’m working on an export of bulk wheat from Mina Al Ahmar to Ensenada. Could you provide me with a freight quote? Is that for regular service or L/C (Letter of Credit)?

Regards,
Lea Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Wheat Export to Ensenada
email_chain.body:
Hi Lea,

Thanks for your email. I have attached our Mexican market page with all our destinations and fees. The quote for 500 tonnes is as follows: $4,500.00 plus V.A.T.

Regards,
Jenna Taylor

(Attachment: Mexican Market Page.pdf)

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Wheat Export to Ensenada
email_chain.body:
Hi Jenna,

Thank you so much for your quote. Would the price be lower for refrigerated service? I ideally need to ship within the next couple of days, but a refrigerated service with a longer transit time (up to 20 days) might be acceptable if cost-effective.

Regards,
Lea Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Wheat Export to Ensenada
email_chain.body:
Hi Lea,

Thank you for your message. We can offer refrigerated service to that port. With a reefer vessel, the full container load (FCL) transit time would be approximately 12 days, and certainly less than 20 days.

Regards,
Jenna Taylor

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Wheat Export to Ensenada
email_chain.body:
Thank you, Jenna. Could I also have the FOB price for 4000 Tons of Wheat? Can we make a prepaid payment, or do you require an initial deposit? What are the applicable rates for this service?

I would also like to know the inland transportation charge of $1.50 (presumably per ton) from port to consumer. Are there any restrictions on wheat grade, or specific certificates required?

Regards,
Lea Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Wheat Export to Ensenada
email_chain.body:
Hi Lea,

Please could you specify the wheat grade required for your purchase? I can also attach a sample certificate for your review.

Regards,
Jenna Taylor

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Wheat Export to Ensenada
email_chain.body:
Hi Jenna,

We will be needing the following wheat grades:
1027--410, 2554--320, 3044--330

Are any additional certificates needed? Will the wheat need to be transported by barge? We also need to know the origin of the wheat.

Regards,
Lea Miller

Thanks,
Chris

Chris

Thanks,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Office Location

email_chain.subject: Chemical Shipment Inquiry - Hamburg to Gdansk

Sincerely,
Louis Dumont

email_chain.subject: Re: Chemical Shipment Inquiry - Hamburg to Gdansk
email_chain.body:
Hi Sven,

Following up on our previous email. We received the following response from your colleagues:

"We regret to inform you that we are currently unable to accommodate a shipment of chemicals from Hamburg to Gdansk.
Please also inform us of your preferred loading dates and any specific cargo handling requirements. The reference to a standard rate was for informational purposes only."

Thank you.
Louis

email_chain.subject: Re: Chemical Shipment Inquiry - Hamburg to Gdansk - URGENT
email_chain.body:
Sven,

That is completely unacceptable! The lack of a proper response to our inquiry and the apparent refusal to discuss our specific needs is extremely disappointing. We have therefore decided to engage an alternative freight forwarder for this chemical shipment.

Best wishes,
Louis

email_chain.subject: Regarding Contractual Agreements and Service Levels
email_chain.body:
Hi Sven,

Our company has reviewed our contractual agreements with ShippingCo, and we are very disappointed that this appears to be your standard response to our shipment requests. I hope this can be addressed internally.

Louis

email_chain.body:

I am inquiring about shipping 1,000 MT of mica ore from Murmansk to Japan or China, with a laycan of August 15th. Kindly reply with your best lump sum rate including demurrage and reefer rate.

Thanks,
Osvaldo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 1000MT Mica Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Osvaldo,

Thank you for your letter of May 31, 2011. Please let us know the preferred shipping date and more detailed cargo specifications.

I am still analyzing the situation and may contact you again next week.

Yours sincerely,

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 1000MT Mica Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Referring to your email of April 20, 2011, I am just back from vacation. We would like to ship the 1,000 tons of mica ore around June 25th and expect arrival by the end of July. Please inform us of the shipping cost as early as possible.

Yours sincerely,
Osvaldo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 1000MT Mica Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Thanks for your reply. I have re-read our contract carefully. Do you still need me to sign it? I am ready to ship your cargo as soon as I get your signed contract and other necessary documents, like bills of lading, air waybill etc. Please let me know as soon as possible.

Thanks,
Osvaldo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 1000MT Mica Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Osvaldo,

Pleased to have you on board with our shipping company. Thank you for your letter. I just received your letter dated May 31, 2011. Please do not worry about the shipment delay. Since you are our valued customer, we would like to provide the best possible service to you.

Sincerely,

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 1000MT Mica Ore Shipment - Pricing and Documentation
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We still need to know when your price will be available. Also, could your price be higher than quoted by your competitor? And are there any other documents required in addition to the price? I am expecting your reply by tomorrow.

Best regards,
Osvaldo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 1000MT Mica Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Osvaldo,

We have just finished the technical reevaluation. As you know, we have some difficulties due to the current weather conditions and the damages caused by Hurricane Irene. The situation in New York and elsewhere is very serious. We are not ready to perform a test of samples as yet.

Sincerely,

email_chain.subject: Re: Sulphuric Acid Shipment Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Karina,

Thank you for your sulphuric acid enquiry. Based on our past experience, most vessels from Antwerp take 10-12 days to arrive in Houston.

Also, many vessels are fully loaded for India with sulphuric acid as ballast cargo, which can mean lower revenue and potentially higher freight costs for shipments to other destinations. Considering the current international economic uncertainty, I would recommend exploring a break-bulk vessel to optimize freight costs.

Please advise on your specific shipper requirements, and I'd be happy to provide a quotation.

Kind regards,
Jon Davies

email_chain.subject: Re: Sulphuric Acid Shipment Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Jon,

Thank you for your prompt response and insights. We appreciate the information regarding potential challenges with standard vessel routes.

Could you please provide a detailed quotation for shipping one (1) unit (21.3 cubic meters) of sulphuric acid at 1.32 specific gravity, based on our shipper's specifications, FCA Houston port?

Kind regards,
Karina Lopez

email_chain.subject: FW: SO2 Shipment - Request for Quotation
email_chain.body:
Jon,

Thanks for your follow up. I have received Karina's updated enquiry and have forwarded it to our contact in India, who will be able to provide you both with a detailed quotation.

Thank you,
Adrian Smith

email_chain.subject: SO2 Shipment - Freight Quotation
email_chain.body:
Dear Karina,

Please find the freight cost quotation for the SO2 shipment as requested.

### Shipper info:

Freight Cost: $10,500.00
Freight FCL: 1 CTN x 21.3 cubic meters @ 1.32 specific gravity

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Kind regards,
Jon Davies

email_chain.subject: Cottonseed Oil Shipment Request - Rotterdam to Casablanca
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Ambrose,

Could you handle 8,500 MT of cottonseed oil from Rotterdam to Casablanca in the last week of August? The cargo is awaiting freighter loading. Could you please confirm your demurrage and laytime charges?

Best regards,
Emily Carter

email_chain.subject: Re: Cottonseed Oil Shipment Request - Rotterdam to Casablanca
email_chain.body:
Dear Emily,

Thank you for contacting Ambrose Shipping. We'd be happy to handle your cottonseed oil shipment. 

To confirm, you require shipment of 8,500 MT from Rotterdam to Casablanca in the last week of August. We will require documentation to arrange the vessel. Please send the necessary documentation as soon as possible so we can confirm loading schedules and provide a comprehensive freight quote.

Regarding demurrage and laytime, our standard charges will apply and will be detailed in our formal quote once the documentation is reviewed.

Sincerely,
Cynthia Ambrose

email_chain.subject: Re: Cottonseed Oil Shipment Request - Rotterdam to Casablanca - Provisional Booking Confirmed
email_chain.body:
Hi Emily,

Following our previous correspondence and receipt of initial documentation, we can confirm provisional booking for your 8,500 MT cottonseed oil shipment from Rotterdam to Casablanca on August 30th, subject to final documentation review and payment terms agreement.

Please send us the remaining shipment documents as soon as possible so we can finalize the arrangements for loading. We can discuss payment terms at your earliest convenience.

Thanks,
Cynthia Ambrose

email_chain.subject: Cottonseed Oil Shipment - Loading Arrangements Commencing
email_chain.body:
Hello Emily,

The cottonseed oil shipment is now in our possession at Rotterdam, and we are commencing loading arrangements in anticipation of the August 30th sailing. Thank you again for booking with Ambrose Shipping.

Sincerely,
Cynthia Ambrose

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Potential Purchase of MS Higgle High
email_chain.body:
Hello,

I am writing to express my interest in potentially purchasing the MS Higgle High. I require more information about the vessel before proceeding.

Could you please provide any available records, including the build date, last renovation date, type of fuel it uses, and whether it is equipped for refrigerated cargo (and if so, its capacity)?

Any additional information you can provide would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your time and I look forward to your reply.

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Opportunity: Sale of Ship - High Hope
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

I am writing to inform you about a sales opportunity for the ship High Hope. As you can see from the attached document, the ship is in very good condition and requires no further investment. It is a fully operational and modern vessel.

The vessel was previously purchased by the shipyard. It is a 36,000t vessel with 12M2 equipment. The vessel has completed an inspection, cleaned its engine and is ready for its new owner. 

Please do not hesitate to contact me for more information.

Best regards,
Victor

email_chain.subject: Ship Acquisition Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Transport Quotation Request - Port Louis to Toliara
email_chain.body:
Hi Dan,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the transport of crude oil from Port Louis to Toliara. I understand you are looking for a quotation. 

I've checked with our sales representative, and they mentioned having already spoken with you about this particular cargo. I have confirmed that we have a crew member currently in Port Louis and a suitable vessel arriving around February 1st. We would likely utilize one of our own cargo vessels for this transport.

I've already contacted the vessel to confirm their availability, and they have responded positively. We anticipate being able to provide you with a formal quotation by the end of today, after I've discussed the operational details with my manager to ensure accuracy.

Regards,
Robby

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Transport Quotation Request - Port Louis to Toliara
email_chain.body:
Hi Dan,

Thank you for contacting us with your quotation request. Following confirmation with my manager, please find the estimated quotation details below:

*   **Route:** Port Louis (PL) to Toliara (MRW)
*   **Arrival Port:** Port Louis
*   **Departure Port:** Toliara
*   **ETA:** February 3rd, 2024
*   **Crew:** 3 sailors
*   **Fare:** $4,000 per sailor
*   **Voyage:** 7 days
*   **VOCSURV(+):** La Reunion (This refers to the vessel completing its VOCSURV requirements in La Reunion.)
*   **Departure from Port Louis:** February 3rd, 2024
*   **Transport costs (0.5% per day x 10,000 MT):** $500
*   **Total cost:** $6,500

We will send you the official bill in PDF format via email shortly.

Kind regards,
Robby

email_chain.subject: LPG Shipment Request: Rotterdam to Montreal
email_chain.body:

Sincerely,
Melissa

email_chain.subject: LPG Shipment Inquiry: Riga to Rotterdam - August
email_chain.body:
Hi Jonas,

Please let me know your weekend rates for August to cover a 4,000 MT LPG shipment from Riga to Rotterdam. We have a vessel leaving for Rotterdam on August 16th and require a three-day turnaround. Is there any possibility of scheduling the delivery for the early morning of August 19th?

Best regards,
Leandro

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Request: Rotterdam to Montreal
email_chain.body:
Hi Melissa,

We currently have one tanker available around your dates, the Baltic Sky. However, the weekend rate for a shipment of that size is US$120/MT. This exceeds your daywork cap of US$100/MT, as I understand it. Could you please provide the planned loading dates for the cargo so we can give you a more accurate quote?

Regards,
Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry: Riga to Rotterdam - August
email_chain.body: Hi Leandro,

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry: Riga to Rotterdam - August

Sorry about that. We're pretty flexible. We can reduce the load to 3,500 MT and aim for a departure on the morning of August 19th. We could also potentially arrange for another tanker if needed.

Regards,
Leandro

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry: Riga to Rotterdam - August
email_chain.body:

We're currently fully booked for the early morning of August 19th. However, we might have availability if you could deliver the cargo on a Saturday or Sunday instead. Please let me know if you're interested in exploring those options.

Regards,
Jonas

Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry: Riga to Rotterdam - August

Paul

[Sender Name from Marketing Dept.]

Dear Ms. Smith,

I apologize for the delayed response; I was traveling in Hamburg this week. I have some urgent news regarding the 12,500 MT of paper rolls. The supplier in Hamburg has offered to provide them to us for free, which is fantastic! Arrangements are already in place with the supplier.

We have also finalized all suppliers for our project. I've spoken to a colleague in New Orleans about this project. I can send you more information if needed.

Thank you,
Paul

Paul

email_chain.body:

Paul

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore Inquiry - Santos to Richards Bay
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Johnson,

We require a 36,000 MT cargo of iron ore from Santos to Richards Bay. We have a very strong buyer who wants a May delivery, could you commit to that?

You mentioned your vessel has the capacity to do a 2-week voyage – is that the case?

Best Regards,
David Miller

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore Trading Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We’re interested in trading iron ore. A friend recommended you, and I've been meaning to contact you for a while. Would you be free to speak about it?

Thanks,
John Anderson

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Inquiry - Santos to Richards Bay
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

We can offer a discount on shipments if you book an entire vessel. For our standard capacity (45,000 MT), we can offer a 3% discount for early bookings.

Regards,
Jenny Davis

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Inquiry - Santos to Richards Bay
email_chain.body:
We can offer a discount on our shipments, if you can book us an entire ship. For the capacity we’ve got (45,000MT), we can offer a 3% discount for early bookings.

Regards,
Jenny Davis

Please have a look at your inbox for our last message. If we’re looking to book an entire ship, we can’t offer any discount. We’d like to hear back from you before our next message reaches you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Inquiry - Santos to Richards Bay
email_chain.body:
Hello again.

We can offer a discount on shipments if you book an entire vessel. For our standard capacity (45,000 MT), we can offer a 3% discount for early bookings.

Regards,
Jenny Davis

We have to send this message at the very last minute before the quote arrives. This is because we’ve agreed to trade iron ore, which we cannot do while John and David are in charge of this shipment. They will look at this message before receiving your next quote. You can see this by clicking your recent message, which you’ll find on the “previous message” button.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Bunker Costs - Soybeans from New Orleans to Poland
email_chain.body:
Hi Gary,

We are looking to ship 7,000 MT of soybeans from New Orleans to Poland. Could you let me know what the current bunker charges are to Ashdod?

Regards,
Isabella

email_chain.subject: Fwd: [IN2-9985: Bid Request]
email_chain.body:
Hi Gary,

Could you let me know what the bunker charges are to Ashdod from New Orleans with 7,000 MT of soybeans? This is regarding the bid request [IN2-9985].

email_chain.subject: Re: [IN2-9985: Bid Request]
email_chain.body:
Gary,

My client was recently asking how much we will need to pay for bunker charges from New Orleans to Ashdod for 7,000 MT of soybeans. I've already informed him that we would need to estimate the cost. Therefore, I would really appreciate it if you could provide an estimate.

Thanks,
Valentina

email_chain.subject: Re: [IN2-9985: Bid Request]
email_chain.body:
Hi Valentina,

Please be advised that the bunker costs from New Orleans to Ashdod will likely be around $35/Mt. However, this is just an estimate and the actual costs may vary depending on various factors.

I would recommend that you reach out to a reliable company that deals with bunker charges for more accurate information.

You can also contact your local port authority or the port in Ashdod directly to get an idea of the bunker costs.

I hope this helps, and let me know if you require further assistance.

Kind regards,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request: Fertiliser - Fujairah to Dammam
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. White,

We have 4,600 MT of chemical fertiliser to ship from Fujairah to Dammam. Could you please provide a CIF quote, and advise if there are any weather-related or weekend berthing limitations at either port?

Regards,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request: Fertiliser - Fujairah to Dammam
email_chain.body:
Dear Steve,

On behalf of our client, I am responding to your email of May 18, 2009, regarding the potential shipment of chemical fertiliser from Fujairah to Dammam. 

We understand the product to be Co2N fertiliser based on information provided to us. If this is correct, our client is interested in purchasing this fertiliser in bulk. We would like a freight forwarder to provide a CIF rate from Fujairah to either Dammam or Dhuabh in Saudi Arabia for unloading. 

Please advise on the earliest availability of the product for shipment in May 2009.

Yours truly,

Ali bin Ahmed
Ali FZC
P.O. Box 75264
Sharjah, United Arab Emirates
Tel: 8008 755
Fax: [Fax number missing]

email_chain.subject: RE: Re: Freight Quote Request: Fertiliser - Fujairah to Dammam
email_chain.body:
Dear Ali,

Thank you for your offer. However, our client is *not* open to using Fujairah port as the origin. We are open to using ports closest to our client, such as Dammam, Jubail, Dhuabh, or any other suitable port within Saudi Arabia. 

Could you please confirm if shipment from those ports is viable, and also confirm your earliest availability for May 2009? Kindly send us your latest offers from these ports.

Regards,

Dania
Conference Transports
2nd Floor, Merchant Tower
Port Saeed
Dubai, United Arab Emirates
Tel: +971 (0)4 280 7081
Fax: +971 (0)4 280 7051
Email: conference1@conferenceuae.com

email_chain.body:
The cargo may be loaded by the shipper at the next best charter rate.

Please let me know how your customer expects to proceed. Could you provide an offer based on the initial proposal? We are looking at potential weekly spot shipments, but this would likely be FOB due to the spot availability.

email_chain.subject: Revised Quote for Organic Corn Shipment - HKG to LA

Regards,
Duy

email_chain.subject: RE: Revised Quote for Organic Corn Shipment - HKG to LA
email_chain.body:
Duy,

Kindly confirm your commitment. We will book the shipping once we receive the FOB quote from your end, as previously discussed. Please revert as soon as possible, as we are waiting for your offer.

Once you provide the FOB quote, we can inform our buyer about the price and shipping rates.

As this requires a quick response, we need clarification on whether we can send out the request for a firm rate, along with a detailed invoice for shipping, enabling the buyer to commit to the volume.

Once we receive your commitment from the buyer, we will proceed with forwarding the cargo.

Thank you in advance. Kindly revert.

Best Regards,
Sujal

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Loading - Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Hi Lisa,

We are loading 3000 MT of crude oil today from Marseille to Beirut. Our earliest available berth in Marseille is Tuesday 27th July. Could you confirm your ETA for tonight and let me know if Thursday or Friday are acceptable for unloading your equipment in Marseille?

Best,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Loading - Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Dear Gary,

We are currently en route to Beaune but our current ETA for your port in Marseille is around 22:00 local time tonight. As our equipment needs to be unloaded, it would be preferable to do so in Marseille. We will be available in Marseille from Thursday 29th July. If you have a vessel available in Beirut, could we use that to offload our equipment at a later date instead?

Best,
Karen (Lisa)

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Loading - Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Dear Lisa,

We have a vessel available to unload in Marseille on Saturday 31st July. It will be a slower vessel as it is our own. We still have you listed for a 22:00 local time arrival in Marseille. What time would you like to unload your equipment on Saturday, and what lashing instructions should we follow?

Best,
Gary

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Loading - Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Dear Gary,

We have had a delay in unloading at Beaune due to the strong winds. We are currently in port at Beaune and we hope to have a crane available for unloading in the next few hours. I have also just received confirmation that we have a vessel available in Marseille on Monday 2nd August. The ETA for your port will be around 22:00 local time. Are you still looking for us to unload on Saturday 31st July? What time would you like to unload your equipment, and what lashing instructions should we follow?

Best,
Karen (Lisa)

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Loading - Marseille to Beirut
email_chain.body:
Dear Lisa,

We have just landed in Marseille and will be able to unload in the next few hours. Are you still looking for us to unload on Saturday 31st July? What time would you like to unload your equipment and what should our lashing instructions be? What instructions to follow for your lashing and should we wait for the final confirmation of weather?

email_chain.subject: Quicklime Shipment Inquiry - Aqaba to Hamoun
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Mustafa,

Could you let me know if you have space available for 7,200 MT of quicklime from Aqaba to Hamoun (Wadi Aysba)? I'm interested in a September or October delivery, with a loading window of approximately three weeks.

Kind regards,
Bill

email_chain.subject: Re: Quicklime Shipment Inquiry - Aqaba to Hamoun
email_chain.body:
Dear Bill,

Thank you for your email. Yes, we have capacity for 7,200 MT of quicklime for loading at Hamoun (Wadi Aysba) in September or October. Our preferred vessel, the Maersk Europa, is currently scheduled to arrive around October 3rd. We estimate a full loading to take approximately two weeks from that date. Therefore, October 3rd is our tentative loading start date.

Kind regards,
Helen

email_chain.subject: Re: Quicklime Shipment Inquiry - Aqaba to Hamoun
email_chain.body:
Dear Helen,

Thank you for your email. Could you please provide a quotation for the shipping cost of this 7,200 MT delivery? I'd like to finalize a contract before the end of this week.

Kind regards,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Quicklime Shipment Inquiry - Aqaba to Hamoun
email_chain.body:
Dear Abdullah,

We can offer a shipping cost of 300 USD per metric ton for the 7,200 MT of quicklime from Aqaba to Hamoun (Wadi Aysba). This price is based on prepaid consignment in Aqaba.

Kind regards,
Helen

email_chain.subject: Re: Quicklime Shipment Inquiry - Aqaba to Hamoun - Order Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Helen,

Thank you for your email. I'd like to place an order for 7,200 MT of quicklime to be shipped from Aqaba to Hamoun (Wadi Aysba) in September or October, with loading onboard the Maersk Europa tentatively scheduled for October 3rd, as previously discussed.

Kind regards,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Checking In on the Project

email_chain.subject: Checking In - First Month at ExampleCompany
email_chain.body:
Hi Karen,

Hope you're having a good Sunday! I wanted to check in on how your first month at ExampleCompany is progressing.

I understand that starting a new job can be a challenging adjustment. I wanted to see how you're doing and if you have any questions or concerns.

Please feel free to reach out anytime.

Best regards,
Stacey

email_chain.subject: Congratulations on the New Product Launch!
email_chain.body:
Good morning Karen,

Congratulations on the successful launch of your new product! The launch video was impressive, and I believe this product has the potential to make a real difference in people's lives.

I just wanted to check in and see how you're feeling about it all. It's perfectly normal to feel a bit overwhelmed with a new product release, but remember its potential to help your customers succeed.

If you ever need to talk, just let me know.

As usual, the storage charge, if utilized, is applied to the line fee from the warehouse. It is not included in the standard freight rate.

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry: Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:

Would you consider a 5,000 MT voyage of 20-ft. ISO containers loaded with electronics, toys, and arts from Singapore to Zaragoza?

Looking forward to hearing from you,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Frank,

Thanks for your email. We are happy to explore transporting your commodities via sea-freight. Kindly provide detailed shipment specifications, including a comprehensive cargo list.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: Singapore to Zaragoza - Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Stella,

Thank you so much for your swift response. I am sending you the shipment details of our commodities as an attachment.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: Singapore to Zaragoza - Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Frank,

I have reviewed your email and the attached shipment details. It looks good to us, pending documentation.

Do you have the Certificate of Origin (CoO)? We are tentatively planning to ship your commodities to Spain around August 12th, pending confirmation of all required documents.

Have a good day,
Stella

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: Singapore to Zaragoza - Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Thank you so much for your email.

Can you please confirm that you will get back to me regarding the CoO ASAP?

Looking forward to hearing from you.
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: Singapore to Zaragoza - CoO Attached + Additional Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Stella,

I just sent you the CoO for the exports from Singapore to Spain. I also want to know if it will be possible for you to transport the following commodities:

Consumer Goods; Toys; Electronics; Industrial Components; Metal Products; Fabricated Metals; Automotive Parts; Ores; and Agricultural Products.

Please advise at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your cooperation.
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: Singapore to Zaragoza - CoO Attached + Additional Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We received your email and Certificate of Origin. However, we regret to inform you that we cannot ship your commodities to Spain at this time. As you may know, the US and the EU do not currently have a free trade agreement (FTA) that would accommodate these goods.

labels.commodity: electronics, toys, arts, consumer goods, industrial components, metal products, fabricated metals, automotive parts, ores, agricultural products

email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Norland,

We are looking to ship 6,000 MT of milk powder from Beirut to San Francisco. We've received a quote from Yazaki Shipping. Is it possible to discuss our options and potentially get a competitive quote from your end? We are aiming for the most efficient and cost-effective solution.

Thank you,
Maria Garcia

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 6000 MT Milk Powder - Beirut to San Francisco - TMA1 Report Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Maria!

Thanks for your message! Yes, I'm currently working on a TMA1 report and exploring ways to improve efficiency in our shipping processes. Currently, we primarily use email to communicate with Yazaki regarding order and scheduling inquiries.

I've heard that some competitors, like Yasakawa, may utilize different approaches. Would it be possible to discuss your experiences and suggestions in more depth? It's for my assignment, so any insights would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you!
Love,
Evie

email_chain.subject: Follow up: Shipping Process & Potential Yazaki Collaboration
email_chain.body:
Hello Maria,

I recently had a discussion about a potential collaboration with Yousef from Yazaki Shipping. He was interested in understanding our shipping processes, so I used the opportunity to discuss some ideas with him.

I've been researching shipping booking processes and noticed significant changes in recent years. I was hoping you could offer some advice based on your experience in optimizing shipping procedures, and also, give your perspective on collaborating with Yazaki. Any insights would be appreciated. 

Love,
Evie

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 120,000 MT Avi Base Oil - Rotterdam to Dalian
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bader,

We would like to confirm our interest in purchasing 120,000 MT of Avi base oil from Rotterdam to Dalian. Are there any suitable vessel sailings available next week that could accommodate this shipment?

Regards,

Marc Johnson

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 120,000 MT Avi Base Oil - Rotterdam to Dalian
email_chain.body:
Dear Marc,

Yes, we currently have two vessels carrying Avi base oil scheduled to depart from Rotterdam next week. One is heading to Felixstowe, ETA Monday, March 10th, and the other is sailing to Hamburg, ETA Tuesday, March 11th. However, these are not going to Dalian. Let me check what is available to Dalian.

Regards,

Jerome Bader

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 120,000 MT Avi Base Oil - Rotterdam to Dalian
email_chain.body:
Hello Jerome,

Thanks for the quick response. Following up on Marc's email, could you provide freight cost estimates and anticipated transit times for a dedicated vessel from Rotterdam to Dalian carrying 120,000 MT of Avi base oil?

Regards,

Tom Williams

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 120,000 MT Avi Base Oil - Rotterdam to Dalian
email_chain.body:
Hi Tom,

For a full vessel charter Rotterdam to Dalian, the current market rate is approximately USD 3100 per Metric Tonne Cubic Foot (MTCF). Assuming a vessel with 12-meter tanks and a 2-meter cargo hold, the estimated transit time to the US Gulf Coast would be around 10 days. However, that transit time is for US Gulf Coast, not Dalian. Let me double check on a transit time estimate to Dalian. I will get back to you shortly.

Regards,

Jerome Bader

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 120,000 MT Avi Base Oil - Rotterdam to Dalian
email_chain.body:
Thank you, Jerome. Our team is now preparing a purchase offer based on the information provided. We await the charter party details for review.

Regards,

Tom Williams

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 120,000 MT Avi Base Oil - Rotterdam to Dalian
email_chain.body:
Jerome,

Could you please share the charter party agreement for our review?

Regards,

Tom Williams

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 120,000 MT Avi Base Oil - Rotterdam to Dalian
email_chain.body:
Attached is the charter party agreement as requested. We will need the offer finalized next week.

Regards,

Jerome Bader

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 120,000 MT Avi Base Oil - Rotterdam to Dalian
email_chain.body:
Hi Jerome,

Our client has agreed to sign the contract.

Regards,

Tom Williams

email_chain.subject: Wheat Shipment - Victoria to Portland

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment - Victoria to Portland
email_chain.body:
Hello Helena,

Regarding your inquiry about dock availability and scheduling for the upcoming wheat shipments:

To ensure smooth operations for the multiple vessels we anticipate from your company, we're optimizing lane usage. 

Here's the tentative schedule for this week:

Lane 1: Occupied Monday - Friday
WL5: Assigned to Lane 1 for Thursday and Friday.
WL7: Booked for Friday through Monday.
WL5 & WL6: Assigned to Lane 1 for Monday and Tuesday of next week.
WL6: Assigned to Lane 1 for Wednesday & Thursday of next week.

This plan should maximize the utilization of both lanes. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause, but it's the best solution to maintain operational efficiency. Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Lucia

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment - Victoria to Portland
email_chain.body:

Based on your updated response regarding docking, I've updated the TO (Terms of Origin) and FW (Freight Waybill) sections of our invoice to indicate [Portland OR Inbound] along with [Terminal Docking Bay] - thanks!

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 1,000 MT Brake Fluid - Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Chris,

We are looking to arrange a 1,000 MT cargo of brake fluid from Port Said to Mombasa. What is the current turnaround time for this route, and does your daily service schedule align with our estimated arrival date?

Regards,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 1,000 MT Brake Fluid - Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelly,

Thanks for reaching out.

As mentioned in our previous communications (though I don't have access to those emails), our standard turnaround time for the Port Said to Mombasa route is typically around 4-5 days. However, this can fluctuate depending on factors like logistics, customs clearance efficiency, and potential terminal delays.

Our standard service schedule includes departures twice a week. To better assess feasibility, could you provide a specific estimated arrival date? We may be able to accommodate changes or exceptions if necessary.

Please find attached our latest price list for your reference.

Kind regards,
Bobby

[Attachment: Pricing List]

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 1,000 MT Brake Fluid - Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Chris,

Thank you for the prompt response, Bobby.

Our vessel is scheduled to arrive in Port Said on April 15th, and we require a prompt shipment to Mombasa. Is it possible to expedite the standard turnaround time in this case? We have a pressing deadline, and every day is crucial.

Please also let me know if any additional charges would apply for this expedited service.

Thanks again,
John

[Attachment: Shipping Quotation]

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 1,000 MT Brake Fluid - Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hello John,

Thanks for your email.

Yes, we can likely expedite the turnaround time for your shipment arriving on April 15th. We can arrange for priority loading and transportation of the cargo to the port as soon as it's available. Additionally, we can prioritize the necessary customs and logistics processes to streamline the overall turnaround.

However, please be aware that expedited services do incur additional charges. To provide you with an accurate quote, could you please share the attached Shipping Quotation file so we can review the current offer and adjust for these additional services?

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Thanks again for your business.

Janelle

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka
email_chain.body:
Simon,

Could you please suggest a suitable vessel for transporting 4,000 MT of, uh, *specialty chemicals*, from Shanghai to Sri Lanka?  Let me know if a vessel of yours can sail in early May, or if mid-June would be preferable.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

Our standard container vessel sails at approximately 11-12 knots. We have a fully containerized vessel departing from Shanghai that currently sails at about 60% capacity (capable of holding 5,000 MT). It's scheduled to arrive in Hong Kong on June 1st and Sri Lanka on June 9th, early morning.

Let me know if you are interested, and we can discuss the final details and arrangements.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka
email_chain.body:
My thoughts align with the solution proposed by Simon at CIQM.

Sincere regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka - Clarification
email_chain.body:
Mike,

To clarify, could you please provide the following details as soon as possible? I will then contact you to confirm availability and pricing.

Please confirm:

1.  The name of the vessel (if known) that is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka around mid-June.
2.  The approximate arrival time in Sri Lanka.
3.  Whether you require details for other ports of call or any additional vessel information.

Your replies will help me provide the most suitable solutions.

Please let me know.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka - Clarification - Follow Up
email_chain.body:
Mike,

I understand your urgency in transporting approximately 4000 MT to Sri Lanka as quickly as possible. It appears you are working under a tight timeframe.

However, the details provided so far are insufficient for me to make a determination. In our industry, time is of the essence, and I can only wait another 48 hours for complete information.

It seems you're looking for a fully containerized vessel in Sri Lanka to load with containers arriving in Colombo over the past two weeks, and you need this expedited. You may be willing to pay a premium for this.

What you are requesting...

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka - Clarification - Pointing Out Lack of Info
email_chain.body:
Mike,

Firstly, thank you for considering CIQM. Secondly, I must say, the clarity of your request is not quite there yet.

Kindly review your email. I see some gaps in the information provided. I am not sure how would you interpret my replies, to these points, due to the lack of clarity of the request. 

Have a good day.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka - Vessel Name and Capacity
email_chain.body:
Mike,

Thank you for your message. It appears there might be a misunderstanding. I am specifically requesting the vessel's name, arrival time in Sri Lanka, and its approximate capacity for transporting 4000 MT.

To be clear, please provide:

1. The name of the vessel arriving in Sri Lanka around mid-June.
2. The approximate...

email_chain.subject: Your Canada to New Zealand Cruise - July 2010
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

We're excited you've booked our Canada to New Zealand cruise for July 2010! To help us personalize your experience, could you please fill out the attached questionnaire and let me know if you have any special requests?

Many thanks,

Melinda

email_chain.subject: Your Cruise Itinerary and Questionnaire
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

I have attached the cruise itinerary, along with the questionnaire and some additional information regarding dining options and onboard activities. Please review at your convenience.

Please let me know if you have any special requests or dietary requirements. Otherwise, you can simply sign and return the attached questionnaire at your earliest convenience.

It will be my pleasure to assist you with your needs.

Sincerely,
Melinda

P.S. Regarding the itinerary's note about crew patience, we appreciate your understanding that our team comes from diverse backgrounds and cultures. We are committed to providing excellent service and appreciate your patience as they learn and grow.

email_chain.subject: Following Up: Cruise Questionnaire and Itinerary
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

I hope this email finds you well.

I was just wondering whether you received the booking form, along with the itinerary and other documents that were sent to you in the previous email. If you haven't received them, please let me know and I will resend them immediately.

All the best,
Melinda

email_chain.subject: Regarding your Cruise Questionnaire
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

We are so sorry for the delay in acknowledging receipt of your completed questionnaire. There seems to have been an issue with our email server which meant we didn't receive it promptly. We have now received it and will be in touch with you shortly regarding any specific requests you made.

Many thanks,
Melinda

P.S. Again, apologies for the delay. Our IT department has resolved the issue.
