email_chain.subject: Customs Bond Issue
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Daniel,

I recently emailed Mr. John regarding a potential issue. He informed me that customs in his country are requesting a $1 million bond for each shipment. We have confirmed that similar requirements exist in other client countries.

Mr. John has been asked to obtain the necessary documentation to address any potential customs-related issues.

Please advise on how you will proceed.

Thank you,
Jack Burns

email_chain.subject: Bank Confirmation Regarding Customs Bond
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. John,

As I just informed you, Mr. Lewis's bank contacted me regarding the customs bond. He is requesting that you ensure the necessary bond papers are obtained from Palinka Company.

Please call me and inform me of your decision regarding this matter.

Thank you,
Jack Burns

email_chain.subject: Re: Customs Bond Issue
email_chain.body:
Good day sir,

I received the emails you sent to John. He informed me that he cannot provide the bond papers without his supervisor's approval. However, we will be sending them on the next available flight.

Please confirm the exact delivery address, and we will ensure timely delivery.

Thank you, and we look forward to continuing our successful business relationship.

Sincerely yours,
Daniel James

email_chain.subject: Dry Bulk Shipping Investment Opportunity
email_chain.body:
Dear M. Corbin,

We are currently evaluating potential investors for dry bulk shipping opportunities. Our selection process has begun, and we would be pleased to consider your participation.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
Vladimir

email_chain.subject: Re: Dry Bulk Shipping Investment Opportunity
email_chain.body:
Dear M. Corbin,

Following up on Vladimir's email, I wanted to provide some context on the current market. The dry bulk finance market is experiencing significant activity, particularly centered around Singapore. Large volumes of capital are flowing from banks and investment firms into the sector.

The crucial question is whether this influx of shipping loans will translate into improved returns for the shipping sector and positively impact financing as a whole. 

If you would like to discuss the potential opportunities and pitfalls surrounding dry bulk finance in more detail, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Best regards,
Anatoliy

email_chain.subject: Dry Bulk Finance Market Dynamics
email_chain.body:
Dear M. Corbin,

As a continuation of our discussion, the dry bulk finance market is indeed booming due to the current low interest rate environment and increased commodity demand. However, these low rates present a double-edged sword.

While companies can borrow at lower rates, their potential interest income is also reduced, potentially impacting overall profit margins. This faster loan repayment is offset by reduced profit.

Furthermore, fluctuations in commodity demand can lead to increased unsold capacity, impacting shipping companies' financial performance.

In this environment, the key to profitability lies in cost reduction and improved operational efficiency.

Sincerely,
Anatoliy

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15
email_chain.body: Hello!

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15
email_chain.body: There are no current cargoes available, but we are working on it. Please stay tuned.

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15
email_chain.body:
I will not take “no” for an answer! :-o

1. What is the daily rate?
2. What is the minimum booking/minimum cargo?
3. What is the bunker clause?
4. What is the co2/h2/12 LCL?
5. What is the grain specific LCL?
6. What is the minimum volume for CO2/C2/15?
7. Are the runs regular?

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15
email_chain.body:
I do not know the bunker clause, and I have never seen a rate for CO2/C2/15/Co2/C2/14/CO2/C2/13. I do not know if your company could obtain a quote. It is very strange to me that they do not know what their rates are. I assume there may be some competitive issues.

I do not know the bunker clause, and I have never seen a rate for CO2/C2/15/Co2/C2/14/CO2/C2/13.

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15
email_chain.body: I still don't have a rate. Our contacts at your company have no idea what their rates are. There were very few quotes in the market for CO2/C2/15. You will have to check with another carrier.

For shipments to Portugal, we offer pickup from either Dallas or Houston. Please let us know your preferred pickup location as soon as possible.

John

John

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request: Oil Field Machinery - Houston to East London
email_chain.body:
Howdy John,

Just a quick note to check availability for shipping 5,200 MT of oil field machinery from Houston to East London. 

Would it be possible to give us a quote for an upcoming cargo leaving in the next couple of weeks? Also, could you please include the cost for 40 days’ demurrage in your quote?

Thanks so much,
Bert

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request: Oil Field Machinery - Houston to East London
email_chain.body:
Hey Bert,

Just wanted to let you know that the farm machinery shipment that departed on the weekly 3:20 pm flight from Houston to Cape Town (via connecting flight to East London) has arrived in East London and has been unloaded. We believe that all items were received safely by your client. 

I'm afraid I don't have any information on John's pending quote for the Oil Field Machinery at the moment.

Have a great day,
Nicola

email_chain.subject: Image usage request
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Maddy,

The sample email included an image of Ms. Karina. I would like to know if it's possible for me to use this image in an email to you. Is that permitted?

Kind regards,
Sana

email_chain.subject: Re: Image usage request
email_chain.body:
Hey Maddy,

I apologize, but I'm not entirely sure I understand your initial request regarding the image. Could you please clarify what you're asking?

I'm happy to share the image with you if that's what you need.

Kind regards,
Sana

email_chain.subject: Re: Image usage request
email_chain.body:
Hey Ms. Maddy,

Could you please elaborate on what you need from me concerning the image of Ms. Karina? I'm not sure how you intend to use it in your email, but generally, you should be able to insert it directly into the email body.

Kind regards,
Sana

email_chain.subject: Re: Image usage request
email_chain.body:
Hey Ms. Maddy,

How can I be of assistance? I hope you're doing well.

Attached is the image of Ms. Karina, in case that clarifies things.

Kind regards,
Sana

email_chain.subject: Re: Image usage request
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Maddy,

Perhaps you need to rephrase your request. I'm still uncertain about what you're asking me to do.

To reiterate, my original question was: Am I allowed to use this image in *my* email?

Kind regards,
Sana

email_chain.subject: Re: Image usage request
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Maddy,

Thank you for your reply! I appreciate it.

I am looking forward to hearing back from you regarding permission to use the image.

Kind regards,
Sana

email_chain.subject: Re: Image usage request
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Maddy,

Could you please let me know when you would like me to send the information I mentioned previously? (Presumably, this information includes the image in question).

Kind regards,
Sana

email_chain.subject: Re: Image usage request
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Maddy,

Thank you for your reply! I'm glad to hear I'm meeting expectations.

I will let you know as soon as I have the image ready to send (assuming I get your permission to use it).

Kind regards,
Sana

email_chain.subject: New Warehouse Location Announcement
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Tang,

I am pleased to announce that our new warehouse will be located in Shenzhen, within the customs-bonded area. This allows for efficient import and export processes.

It has 3 floors, with a total floor area of 1,600m2. We will continue to supply high-quality, cost-effective products and competitive logistics services from this location.

I hope you are well and invite you to visit us soon!

Yours sincerely,
Arthur Lee

email_chain.subject: Factory Testing and Sample Delivery
email_chain.body:
Dear Dr. Tang,

Thanks for your last email. We are currently on schedule with the new factory setup. We plan to conduct initial testing next week and need your assistance. We would like to provide you with four samples for testing.

One sample is specifically designated for thorough testing in your lab. If all tests pass successfully, we will proceed with full-scale manufacturing.

We will send out the samples next week. Please test them at your lab and let us know if you identify any issues. If there are any problems with the sample, we will adjust the manufacturing process and provide revised samples.

Sincerely,
[My Company Name]

email_chain.subject: LPG Shipment Update
email_chain.body:
Hello Emilio,

Thank you for your email. I hope you are enjoying your Christmas. We still need to load your shipment of LPG. Can you provide a value date by Monday morning please?

Thank you,
Ben

email_chain.subject: RE: LPG Shipment Update - RLC Case Logging
email_chain.body:
Hello again Emilio,

I heard from Logan at the dealership. He is taking the day off today. Given the circumstances, he suggested you might want to discuss the RLC case and log it yourself if you agree it's beneficial. 

Could you please let me know whether you wish to handle the case logging yourself or prefer a member of our staff to do it?

Please respond by Monday morning.

Thank you,
Ben

email_chain.subject: Fuel Pump Upgrade Notification
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr./Ms. Vargas,

We are writing to inform you that we will be upgrading the fuel pump in your vehicle to a more reliable model. This service will be performed proactively at 45,000 miles. 

We understand this is an inconvenience, especially since we previously offered to extend the warranty on the current RLC pump. However, this unscheduled service will ensure optimal performance and reliability.

The service is scheduled for Saturday, January 1st. You can bring your car in anytime during the day. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and believe this upgrade is in your best interest.

If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact us.

Sincerely,
Logan Walker

email_chain.subject: Important Update Regarding Your LPG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr./Ms. Li,

We regret to inform you that your LPG shipment has not yet arrived at the dealership. We are actively working to resolve this issue and will notify you with a confirmed delivery date as soon as possible.

We sincerely apologize for this delay.

Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions.

Sincerely,
Logan Walker

email_chain.subject: Regarding Fuel Pump Upgrade & LPG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Logan,

Thank you for your email. I was just wondering about the fuel pump upgrade mentioned in your email from Friday. I'm also waiting for an update regarding Ju Li's LPG shipment, as per your other email.

Could you please provide updates on both issues as soon as possible?

My apologies for the delayed response.

Ben

email_chain.subject: Overdue Payment for Kerosene Shipments - Lagos to Casablanca
email_chain.body:
Dear Mammoud,

This is a reminder that your payment for the kerosene shipments from Lagos to Casablanca is overdue. We would appreciate it if you could arrange for payment as soon as possible.

Kind regards,
Ben

email_chain.subject: Re: Overdue Payment for Kerosene Shipments - Lagos to Casablanca
email_chain.body:
Dear Ben,

I sincerely apologize for the delay in payment. We've been experiencing some unexpected technical issues with our network, which has hindered our ability to process transactions promptly. We understand the importance of fulfilling our financial obligations and are working diligently to resolve the issue. We expect to have it sorted out within the next few days.

Again, please accept our apologies for any inconvenience this may have caused.

Regards,
Mammoud

email_chain.subject: Re: Overdue Payment for Kerosene Shipments - Lagos to Casablanca
email_chain.body:
Dear Mammoud,

It's that time of year when we are becoming increasingly busy, and due to high demand, please be aware that your upcoming order might be delayed slightly. We are doing everything we can to minimise disruption and you should receive your shipment soon. We appreciate your patience.

Regards,
Ben

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry: Almond Meal - Algeciras to Marseille
email_chain.body:
Hi Jarrett,

I would like to understand the shipping schedule and rates for moving 50,000 MT of almond meal from Algeciras to Marseille over the next 3 months. Would the most efficient route be via the Suez Canal?

Thanks.

Best regards,
Siddhartha

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: Almond Meal - Algeciras to Marseille
email_chain.body:
Jarrett,

To clarify my previous email, the shipment is 50,000 MT of almond meal in dry bulk, loaded into 25' containers.

I'm looking for a shipment from Algeciras Port on or around November 1st, 2016 (01/11/2016) to Marseille, with delivery to Terminal Lagrange by November 4th, 2016 (04/11/2016).

Please provide me with a quote for this specific itinerary.

Thanks,
Siddhartha

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: Almond Meal - Algeciras to Marseille
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Siddhartha,

I have reviewed your request and have attached our current rates and schedule for container shipping to Marseille. Unfortunately, we are fully booked from October 2016 through January 2017. The next available space on this particular route would be January 19th, 2017.

Based on the available space on our vessels at that time, a preliminary estimate would be USD 9,350 per container. Please note that this is a general estimate, and the final rates will be confirmed only after we have officially assigned space for your shipment. We will communicate the precise, fixed rates as soon as they are available.

Please find attached our standard terms and conditions, along with a document outlining container specifications.

Sincerely,
Jarrett

email_chain.subject: Tanker Charter Inquiry - Fuel Oil Nagasaki to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Davis,

We are seeking to charter a tanker to load approximately 15,000 MT of Fuel Oil from Nagasaki to Singapore, with a required loading window by October 25th. We also have an option to extend the cargo size by an additional 10,000 MT.

Please confirm your availability to provide a suitable vessel for this shipment.

Best regards,

Ryan

email_chain.subject: Re: Tanker Charter Inquiry - Fuel Oil Nagasaki to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Hi Ryan,

Thank you for your email regarding the potential charter from Nagasaki to Singapore. I'm checking vessel availability for the October 25th loading window. It's a tight turnaround, but I'll let you know if we can find a suitable tanker.

Regards,

Alan Davis

email_chain.subject: Re: Tanker Charter Inquiry - Fuel Oil Nagasaki to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Hi Ryan,

Following up on Alan's email, we've identified a tanker that may be available around the 25th. It's currently carrying a partial cargo, which could potentially allow for your 15,000 MT. To proceed, we'd need to agree on and execute a charter party agreement as soon as possible.

Could you please confirm your readiness to proceed with this option, given the very short timeframe? If we can't finalize arrangements quickly (ideally within the next day or two), we'll need to explore alternative options.

Regards,

Julie Miller

email_chain.subject: Freight Request - St. Petersburg, Shanghai, Busan
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Petch,

I need to book three vessels for shipments next month:

*   3,000 MT from St. Petersburg to Portovik
*   2,200 MT from Shanghai to San Juan
*   5,000 MT from Busan to Rostock

Could you please let me know if your rates are competitive for these routes?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Request - St. Petersburg, Shanghai, Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Thank you for your inquiry. Here's a breakdown of our estimated rates:

*   St. Petersburg to Portovik: $60/MT via container ship.
*   Shanghai to San Juan: Approximately 50% chance of securing a bulk carrier. Estimated cost is $45/MT.
*   Busan to Rostock: Estimated cost of $4/MT via bulk carrier.

Based on these estimates, the total cost for all three shipments would be $165,000. This is the lowest rate we can currently offer.

Kind regards,
Ilya Petch

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Request - St. Petersburg, Shanghai, Busan
email_chain.body:
Dear Ilya,

Thank you for the quick response.

Regarding your quote:

"The cost of $4/MT from Busan to Rostock in bulk carrier is estimated. We are quoting you a total of $165,000 for all the above. This rate is the lowest that we can offer."

This rate seems reasonable. I will be in touch soon to discuss the next steps.

Best regards,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Sugar Cane Transshipment - Jiangyin to Rotterdam to Washington
email_chain.body:
Hello Sir,

We are inquiring about the lead time and availability for transhipping 7,000 MT of sugar cane (REF50) from Jiangyin, China, to Rotterdam, and then onward shipping from Rotterdam to Washington, D.C.

Could you advise if you can arrange this under CIF terms, and clarify your earliest laycan slot?

Regards,
Mr. Ashok

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Sugar Cane Transshipment - Jiangyin to Rotterdam to Washington
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ashok,

Thank you for your enquiry regarding the potential export of 7,000 MT of sugar cane from Jiangyin, Jiangsu Province, China, to Washington, D.C. port, USA.

For your reference, please find below our non-binding best available freight quote for the cargo in FCL mode from China, Russia, or Taiwan to the USA. This is a preliminary estimate for similar routes and cargo types. A precise quote will require more specific details.

Please note that the quoted rate does not include: clearance charges, tuck-in/out charge, loading/unloading charges, VGM declaration, terminal and pilotage fees, lockage fees, vessel port call surcharge, or detention/demurrage charges.

In addition to the freight rate, you will also have to pay terminal handling charges, which are based on the type of service selected and the handling facilities required.

Quoted rates also exclude shipper’s and consignee’s transport insurance, which depends on the loading and unloading of goods in transit.

We await further details from you so that we can formulate a precise offer.

Sincerely,
Shipping Company Sales Team

email_chain.subject: Request for Ocean Shipment: Europe to California - Footwear
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We are looking for a shipping solution for 5000 x 20' pallets of various types of shoes and footwear (shoe boxes only) from Europe to California, with a preferred sailing date of January 29, 2017.

The estimated weight is 30,000 lbs (approximately 13,608 kg) per shipment.

Please find attached a detailed Information Guide to assist you in securing the correct information and documentation.

For any shipments from China, we can also arrange on our behalf.

Please do not hesitate to contact me should you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Mr. Yang

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Empty Container Transport - Hamburg to St. John's, NL
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We are looking for a cargo vessel or agent capable of carrying an empty container from Hamburg, Germany, to St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador (NL), Canada. 

The transportation of the empty container must commence from Hamburg on January 23, 2017, and arrive at the port of St. John's on or before January 28, 2017. The service includes both loading and unloading of the empty container.

Please let us know your availability and rates for such transportation.

Please do not hesitate to contact me should you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Mr. Yang

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Full Container Transport - Hamburg to Detroit
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We are looking for a cargo vessel or agent that is capable of carrying a 40' full container from Hamburg, Germany, to Detroit, Michigan, USA. The transportation of the full container must start from Hamburg on January 30, 2017...

labels.commodity: Sugar Cane, Shoes, Empty Container, Unknown

email_chain.subject: Soymeal Quote Request - New Orleans to Shepparton
email_chain.body:
Dear Sales Team,

We are requesting a quote for the shipment of 3,200 MT of soymeal from New Orleans to Shepparton, Australia. Please provide a lump sum price for this order.

Best wishes,

Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Soymeal Quote Request - New Orleans to Shepparton
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

Thank you for your inquiry. Upon reviewing your account history, we noticed limited activity related to soymeal shipments. Your previous deliveries have been consistent for the past six months, but not involving soymeal, and your typical monthly volumes are significantly higher than the requested 3,200 MT.

Our standard minimum order size for providing competitive quotes is 50,000 MT. Could you please elaborate on the circumstances of this smaller request, or perhaps indicate potential for larger, consistent volumes in the future? 

Regards,

Kirsty Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Soymeal Quote Request - New Orleans to Shepparton
email_chain.body:
Dear Kirsty,

Thanks for getting back to me. I understand your reservations. 

Having reflected on it, we can offer you a reduced rate if we guarantee delivery of at least 1,000 tonnes per month, for an extended period. Given that we have a similar monthly requirement of soymeal, this doesn’t cause us any significant disruption to our operation.

email_chain.subject: Re: Soymeal Quote Request - New Orleans to Shepparton
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

Following up on Kirsty's email, we've considered your proposal. We can offer a reduced rate based on a guaranteed minimum delivery of 1,000 MT per month for an extended period, contingent upon securing the necessary volumes.

To proceed, we need confirmation of your commitment to deliver the specified quantity, along with a proposed delivery schedule. We'll send our latest supply schedule for your review. Please let us know if you're interested in pursuing this agreement.

Best wishes,

Joe Smith

email_chain.subject: Jet Fuel Shipment - Rotterdam to New Orleans
email_chain.body:
Hi Maria,

I'm looking at shipping 11,500 MT of jet fuel from Rotterdam to New Orleans, via the Suez Canal. Could you please send me the laycan details, from outload to Estimated Date of Completion of Transfer (EDCT), and confirm if you can match the JWC (Joint War Committee) requirements?

Many thanks,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Jet Fuel Shipment - Rotterdam to New Orleans
email_chain.body:
Dear Simon,

Apologies for the delay in getting back to you. I've reviewed the vessel schedule.

Please confirm the following:

1.  Estimated onboard time for Suez Canal transit: 10 hours.
2.  Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) in New Orleans: June 17, 2022.
3.  Vessel Name: L5
    Master & Chief Mate: Captain Henrique Damasceno & Mercu Regalado

Could you please confirm the charterer's specific time requirements from dock to EDCT?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Jet Fuel Shipment - Rotterdam to New Orleans
email_chain.body:
Hi Maria,

The charterer has specified an EDCT of 23:59 on June 13, 2022. Does that still work with the schedule you offered with the ETA of June 12th?

Many thanks,
Jim

email_chain.subject: Re: Jet Fuel Shipment - Rotterdam to New Orleans
email_chain.body:
Dear Jim,

It depends on the exact timing. We can potentially start loading oil from 05:00 until 05:30. However, unfortunately, we won't be able to load after 06:30 until the next day. For example, we could load oil until 09:00 on Monday, June 13, 2022, but if we can't start loading before 09:30, we won't be able to finish before 18:00, so we'd finish at 05:30 on June 14, 2022.

We'll have to stop loading after 06:30 as the EDCT supervisor doesn't allow any further loading after that time. I'll double-check the ETA again.

Thank you,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Kerosene Shipment - Las Palmas
email_chain.body:

Eva

email_chain.subject: Re: Kerosene Shipment - Las Palmas - Schedule Change Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Eva,

We were wondering if we could push the loading operation up by a day to Saturday, September 10th. As you may have noticed, the winds are picking up and are expected to worsen as we get closer to Icy Cape and Snowy Mountain. We are concerned that this might slow us down if it means having to tack against onshore winds, or worse, get caught in a rounding with significantly larger waves than anticipated.

This job is essential, so I wanted to check with you about the possibility of moving the loading date forward. 

Thanks so much,

Julie

email_chain.subject: Re: Kerosene Shipment - Las Palmas - Schedule Change Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Julie,

Thanks for getting back to me. Unfortunately, I'll be in Hong Kong from September 7th to 11th, so the earliest the job can commence is September 13th. I'm sorry this is going to cause you an inconvenience.

Please change my flights accordingly. I'll be able to fly back on the 13th, but my bags will need to be forwarded from Hong Kong to Paris, then to Marseille, and finally to Valencia. Please ensure they arrive in Valencia by the 12th of September.

Best,

Eva

email_chain.subject: Re: Kerosene Shipment - Las Palmas - Schedule Change Request - Valencia Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Eva,

Thanks for letting me know about your arrival schedule! We're planning to depart on September 15th and arrive on September 19th. We'll be staying at the Grand Hôtel du Grand Port Maritime on the 16th. You will know exactly where to find us when you arrive in Valencia!

Regards,

Julie

email_chain.subject: Re: Kerosene Shipment - Las Palmas - Schedule Change Request - Crew Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Eva,

Yes! We're going to get in touch with the crew today! This is the right solution for us. Thank you!

Regards,

Julie

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Lobster Shipment to the Middle East
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bond,

Blue Car, a lobster exporter based in Halifax, has been delivering lobsters globally for over 20 years. We are exploring the possibility of expanding our reach to the Middle East and would appreciate your insights.

Do you have any suggestions or expertise on how to best transport our lobsters to that region?

Thanks,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Lobster Shipment to the Middle East
email_chain.body:
Good morning Anthony,

I am Dwight, Business Manager at Bond Carriers. Thank you for your inquiry.

You're correct, transporting lobsters to the Middle East is certainly feasible. I've discussed this with our management team.

I'd be happy to explore potential solutions with you. Perhaps we can schedule a meeting to discuss the specific requirements of your operation?

Regards,
Dwight

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Lobster Shipment to the Middle East
email_chain.body:
Dwight,

I'd like to discuss this further. How can we set up a meeting? 

Would you mind if I include my assistant, Mr. Dougherty, in the conversation? If so, can we proceed with scheduling the meeting?

Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Lobster Shipment to the Middle East
email_chain.body:
Great Anthony,

We can meet at 10:00 AM tomorrow in your lobby. I estimate the meeting will last until noon. Mr. Dougherty is welcome to join. I'll have him look into the possible shipping lanes for the trip.

Understand that exploring these options involves some preliminary research. Could you give me a general idea of your budget for this shipment so we can tailor our research?

Thanks,
Dwight

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Lobster Shipment to the Middle East
email_chain.body:
Hi Dwight,

Thanks for your prompt response.

I understand that transporting lobsters to the Middle East will be expensive. I am sure it will involve transporting the lobsters to the port of Halifax, and then having them transported to the port of Dubai. 

Do you have any initial suggestions for how to potentially reduce costs?

Regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Lobster Shipment to the Middle East
email_chain.body:
Hi Anthony,

The transport of lobsters to the Middle East will definitely be influenced by several factors, such as the destination within the Middle East, the seasonality of the lobsters, the type of containers used, and the mode of transportation.

The cost will also depend on carrier availability and their rates. If you want detailed specifics, I would recommend contacting a shipping company specializing in lobster transport, such as Carriers USA. We've worked with them in the past.

See you tomorrow at 10.

Best,
Dwight. Tel: (Tel #)

Given these charges, I believe your margin would still be around 150,000 Euros, and we would be happy to proceed.

Could you please confirm your acceptance, and provide us with the payment needed for ship hire and insurance?

Thanks!

Mateo

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: 5,000 MT Refined Petroleum Products - Rotterdam to Port Sudan
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Williams,

We are seeking freight rates for 5,000 MT of refined petroleum products from Rotterdam to Port Sudan. Our purchase is subject to your best available freight rates and confirmed vessel loading.

Could you please advise on potential congestion at either port and provide a freight quote?

Regards,

Ann Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 5,000 MT Refined Petroleum Products - Rotterdam to Port Sudan
email_chain.body:
Dear Ann,

Thank you for your inquiry.

Unfortunately, we cannot accept the Rotterdam delivery option for the 5,000 MT of petroleum products to Port Sudan. Due to government regulations, we are not permitted to transship petroleum products through Rotterdam. We require the shipment to originate directly from the source and be delivered directly to Port Sudan on a FOB basis.

Thanks and best regards,

Andrew Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 5,000 MT Refined Petroleum Products - Rotterdam to Port Sudan
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Inquiry - Bahrain to Mina Al Ahmadi
email_chain.body:
Dear Tiana,

Vessel '8022' is scheduled to arrive in Manama, Bahrain, around January 14, 2015. We could potentially arrange a lumpsum deal, subject to the trader providing a Letter of Credit (L/C) covering the full tonnage (7,300 MT) and a separate L/C against a proforma invoice.

If you are interested, please advise your intended total tonnage. I will then provide you with the vessel manager’s contact information and their account number for sending the proforma invoice.

Regards,
Bravo Shipping

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Inquiry - Bahrain to Mina Al Ahmadi
email_chain.body:
Dear Bravo Shipping,

The vessel manager of '8022' has confirmed receipt of our proforma invoice for 7,300 MT. They have requested that the Letter of Credit be sent to their account number 421123. Could you please advise on the necessary steps to initiate the L/C process?

Regards,
Tiana Lopez

email_chain.subject: L/C Confirmation and Balance Transfer
email_chain.body:
Dear Bravo Shipping,

I have initiated the Letter of Credit for the agreed amount to the supplier. A copy is attached for your reference. The initial balance for this deal has also been transferred to your account.

Could you please confirm receipt of both the Letter of Credit and the details of the two L/Cs issued by your trade finance department (one for the supplier and one for the shipping line)? Kindly acknowledge their receipt and provide an estimated timeframe for when they will be available.

Regards,
Tiana Lopez

email_chain.subject: Re: L/C Confirmation and Balance Transfer
email_chain.body:
Dear Tiana,

Thank you for your email. As previously mentioned, our finance department has issued two separate Letters of Credit: one for the supplier and another for the shipping line. 

These L/Cs have not yet been credited to your account. I will notify you as soon as they have been processed. Please be assured that the L/Cs will be sent once all documentation is complete.

Regards,
Bravo Shipping

email_chain.subject: Remaining Balance Transfer
email_chain.body:
Dear Bravo Shipping,

Our company will be transferring the remaining balance of $14,000 USD to your account within the next two business days. Please acknowledge receipt of the balance transfer once it has been processed.

Thank you,
Tiana Lopez

email_chain.subject: Re: Remaining Balance Transfer
email_chain.body:
Dear Tiana,

Your balance transfer has been received. The payment is currently being processed and will be deposited into our account within the next few hours.

Thank you,
Bravo Shipping

email_chain.subject: Final Payment Confirmation and Vessel Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Tiana,

The $14,000 USD balance transfer has been received and successfully deposited into our account. 

Your Letter of Credit has also been fully processed and is ready for your reference.

Regarding the vessel, it is currently en route to the Arabian Gulf and is expected to arrive within the next few days. We will keep you updated on its progress.

Thank you for your business.

Regards,
Bravo Shipping

email_chain.subject: Dictation vs. Explanation
email_chain.body:
What is the difference between a dictation and an explanation? 

When I use a dictionary to explain the meaning of words, am I doing a dictionary dictation? 

A dictionary is a guide to words and their meanings. When you read a word or phrase in a book or magazine, you can look up the meaning in a dictionary to make sure you understand it.

Dictionaries can be used for many different purposes. For example, you might use a dictionary to explain the meaning of a word or phrase that you heard on the radio or TV.

email_chain.subject: Inland Transport of Coal - Felixstowe to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Jackson,

Could you please let me know the most efficient inland route for transporting coal from Felixstowe to Rotterdam in July?

I look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,
Melissa

email_chain.subject: Re: Inland Transport of Coal - Felixstowe to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Melissa,

There are a couple of common ways to move coal from Felixstowe to Rotterdam:

1.  Rail from Felixstowe to The Hook of Holland, where it's loaded onto barges.
2.  Direct shipment by sea.

However, based on current logistics, the most effective inland transport route for coal from Felixstowe to Rotterdam in July is typically via rail to the Hook of Holland.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Sincerely,
Andrew

email_chain.body:
Dear Andrew,

Melissa

email_chain.subject: Marketing Opportunities & Summer Promotions
email_chain.body:
Hi Team,

I wanted to share some potentially helpful items to incorporate into your outreach:

1.  Information on upcoming open houses or webinars we're hosting.
2.  Links to written guides detailing FESCO's various operational processes.
3.  Details on current marketing promotions.

You might consider highlighting the following:

*   **European Summer Sale:** 60% off list rates for all containers booked by July 20th, 2019.
*   **Additional European Discount:** All European shipments booked before September 1st will receive an additional 25% discount.

Contact your account manager for full promotion details.

We also have competitive rates to Portugal for those looking at summer destinations.

For more information, please don't hesitate to contact me.

Sincerely,
Diane

email_chain.subject: Re: Marketing Opportunities & Summer Promotions
email_chain.body:
Hi Diane,

Thanks for the information on the special rate. I will add the European Summer Sale and the additional European discount to my projects. I do have a question about the promotion for rail and ocean - could you provide more details? Is this promotion for shipments from Europe to North America only? Also, can you clarify the details of the rail promotion? Does it apply to all rail modes or specific rail lines?

Thanks,
Sandy

email_chain.subject: Re: Marketing Opportunities & Summer Promotions
email_chain.body:
Hi Sandy,

Regarding the rail promotion, it applies to any rail mode in any direction, but only to shipments booked before July 20th. Here's a sample promotion you can use in emails or web banners (feel free to adapt it):

**Sample Promotion (East Coast):** "Special rail rates available for shipments to/from the U.S. East Coast when booked before July 20th!"

Please note that special rates cannot be applied to shipments exclusively within North America.

We also have special ocean promotions for service to the U.S. East Coast.

Best,
Diane

email_chain.subject: Re: Marketing Opportunities & Summer Promotions - Additional Port Information
email_chain.body:
Hi Sandy,

To clarify, when we refer to the "East Coast" in the United States, it encompasses a broad area including ports like New York, Philadelphia, Boston, Baltimore, Wilmington, Richmond, Norfolk, Charleston, Savannah, Jacksonville, Miami, New Orleans, Houston, Galveston, Mobile, and New York City.

We also have promotions available to several ports on the West Coast, including Los Angeles, Long Beach, Tacoma, Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, Oakland, Richmond, and Wilmington. Additionally, don't forget about Gulf of Mexico ports like Mobile, Gulfport, New Orleans, and Houston.

You can find a complete list of our locations here: http://www.silverferries.com/locations

Best,
Diane

email_chain.subject: Re: Marketing Opportunities & Summer Promotions - Rail Promotion Added
email_chain.body:
Hi Diane,

I've added the rail promotion to the bottom of my emails. I'll also review the list of ports in the Gulf Coast area and incorporate that information into my email outreach to customers in that region.

Please let me know if there's anything else I can do to help.

Thanks,
Sandy

email_chain.body:
Hi Sandy,

I'll contact you shortly to arrange a site visit.

Best,
Diane

email_chain.subject: Re: Marketing Opportunities & Summer Promotions - Summer Sale Inclusion
email_chain.body:

Chantal Dubois

email_chain.subject: Re: CFW-CBZ OOG Rate - Alexandria Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Chantal,

Following up on the inquiry, we have a specific requirement for shipping refrigerators to Alexandria, Egypt. We would like to confirm a rate for a single container load to Alexandria Port for the following products:

Refrigerator:
  HP: 250 Volt, 50 Hz
  L x W x H: 1.5 meters x 1.5 meters x 2.5 meters
  3 units per 20-foot container
  Quantity: 40 units
  Total volume: Approximately 50 CBM (allowing for packing and securing)

Could you please provide a quote for this shipment?

Thanks,
Sales Team

email_chain.subject: Re: CFW-CBZ OOG Rate - Alexandria Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Thank you for the detailed information. Yes, we can ship these refrigerators. Please note that due to the size of the refrigerators and the limited space within a 20ft container, some disassembly might be required for optimal packing. I will work on getting you a quote that factors in this disassembly.

Regards,
Chantal Dubois

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: 9,000 MT Rice - Karachi to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Oliver,

I hope this email finds you well.

We would like to request a lump sum freight offer for the shipment of 9,000 MT of rice from Karachi to Mombasa. Could you please provide us with your rates for this voyage?

Many thanks,

Mehdi

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 9,000 MT Rice - Karachi to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Dear Mehdi,

Thank you for your inquiry.

Please allow me to offer you a base price of USD 55/MT on 9,000 MT. Our rice import prices generally range from USD 50/MT to USD 60/MT, and the estimated C&F price will be USD 65/MT. We would require shipment in November. 

Please confirm your acceptance and kindly send us your firm cargo availability details at your earliest convenience.

Kind regards,

[Your Name]

email_chain.subject: Charter Offer: Busan to Hong Kong - 10.5 Days
email_chain.body:
Hi Luca,

Happy to provide you with a charter offer for 10.5 days with port stay in Busan.

Please refer to the attached schedule for details.

A window of opportunity is now open. This 10.5-day charter may be secured, with an estimated time of arrival (ETA) in Hong Kong on May 3rd.

We have 6 units of 1,750 m3 capacity each available for delivery. The charter cost for the 3-week period is USD 8,400,000.

Sincerely,
Davin

email_chain.subject: RE: Charter Offer: Busan to Hong Kong - 10.5 Days
email_chain.body:
Dear Davin,

Based on the schedule in Attachment 1, we accept your offer for 1 x 1,750 m3 capacity at a rate of USD 1,800.00 per cubic meter per day. This constitutes a total of USD 3,150,000.00 for 10.5 days of the charter.

Please acknowledge receipt of this acceptance with a confirmation no later than 4.5 hours from the time of receipt of this email.

Regards,
Fabio

email_chain.subject: Space Available: 20,000MT Sugar - Kobe to Ma'anshan
email_chain.body:
Ms. Lin,

We are arranging transport for 20,000MT of sugar from Kobe to Ma’anshan. We have space available on the Ricka Maru, tentatively scheduled to depart around May 15th. Could you please inform us if this vessel and timeframe are suitable for your cargo?

Yours truly,

Don

email_chain.subject: Re: Space Available: 20,000MT Sugar - Kobe to Ma'anshan
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

I've been trying to reach you regarding the vessel Ricka Maru. We understand you have space available, with a tentative departure around May 15th. Could you confirm the vessel's availability for our cargo? If confirmed, we can place our order.

Thank you,

Jona

email_chain.subject: Re: Space Available: 20,000MT Sugar - Kobe to Ma'anshan
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your message, Jona.

We are currently experiencing high demand and space is limited. However, we are expecting a shipment of 40,000MT of sugar from Vietnam to Kobe soon, which will free up some capacity. We expect this to happen within the next 2 weeks.

Best regards,

Scotty

email_chain.subject: Re: Space Available: 20,000MT Sugar - Kobe to Ma'anshan
email_chain.body:
Thank you for the update, Scotty.

As you know, our customer’s expectations are high, and tight schedules are essential. We will need to start taking bookings again as soon as possible. We have an urgent requirement for 10,000MT of sugar from Kobe to Tianjin port in China within the next 15 days. Our firm is prepared to pay a premium for immediate availability.

Please let us know if the Ricka Maru is available.

Best regards,

Sean

email_chain.subject: Re: Space Available: 20,000MT Sugar - Kobe to Ma'anshan
email_chain.body:
Hi Sean,

Unfortunately, the Ricka Maru is currently not available for your cargo. I can offer a few other vessels for consideration, which would unfortunately delay your delivery schedule by a couple of days. I will send you a list of available vessels along with their estimated delivery schedules shortly.

Thank you,

Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Space Available: 20,000MT Sugar - Kobe to Ma'anshan
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your message Sean.

Good news, the Ricka Maru is now back on the schedule. As for the delivery schedules, there are no changes to our fleet’s current schedule since our last email.

Best regards,

Mike

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry - Tangier to Halifax via Lagos
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Martinez,

We need to charter a vessel from Tangier to Halifax. Please find below our cargo requirements:

*   20,000 MT of iron ore (loading port Bremerhaven)
*   15,000 MT of iron ore (loading port Lagos)

Final destination: Halifax.

Could you please give us your best price and the lead time to loading?

Thanks,

Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry - Tangier to Halifax via Lagos
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the transportation of your iron ore from Bremerhaven, Germany, to Lagos, Nigeria, and Halifax, Canada. We would be delighted to carry your cargo and assist you with your logistics requirements.

Our current lead time to loading in Bremerhaven is approximately 10 to 12 weeks. At the time of loading, our estimated port rates will be around $4.00 USD per metric ton. Picking up the additional 15,000 MT in Lagos will incur an estimated additional $1.00 USD per metric ton. We are happy to work with you to bring the rates in line with your budget.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

Mr. Martinez

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry - Tangier to Halifax via Lagos - MV Unknown
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Martinez,

I am writing regarding your quote for chartering the MV Unknown from Tangier to Halifax, with an intermediate port call in Lagos. I would like to proceed with this charter, but I need to resolve a few issues before I can send payment.

First, the floating rate seems to have increased since your last communication. I'm concerned that the final rate may exceed our budget. Could you please provide the current floating rate in USD and the cost of living in Lagos for the crew? I need these details before giving the final go-ahead.

Second, the lead time to loading is unfortunately too long for my project timeline. I need this vessel as soon as possible. Could you clarify the earliest possible loading date?

Thank you,

Alex

email_chain.subject: RE: Charter Inquiry - Tangier to Halifax via Lagos - MV Unknown
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martinez,

The 20,000 MT of iron ore will be loaded on the MV Unknown in Bremerhaven.
The additional 15,000 MT will be picked up in Lagos.

Your company was the only one that could give me an exact lead time to loading, so I appreciate that. Please provide the finalized rate as soon as possible. I would like to approve the chartering of the MV Unknown by next week.

Your floating rate appears to be a little high. The floating rate in London, where I will need the MV Unknown to pick up iron ore on another voyage, is $1.50 per metric ton. I feel that you should be charging something similar.

Regards,

Alex

email_chain.subject: RE: Charter Inquiry - Tangier to Halifax via Lagos - MV Unknown - Contract Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

Attached you will find the details of our previous discussion about our services and future cooperation regarding scheduled cargo transportation. If you have any questions or wish to amend this contract, please don't hesitate to contact us as soon as possible.

Also attached are our general conditions for cooperation, as well as some private conditions that may be added for your or our benefit. Please complete them and send them back to us for review and approval.

The form of payment is as per our standard General Conditions 9-11, which can also be viewed in the attached file. However, we recommend payment to our company's European bank account.

Best regards,

Mr. Martinez

email_chain.subject: Palm Oil Shipment: Antwerp to Shanghai - Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Zhang,

I've confirmed a 7,000 MT shipment of palm oil from Antwerp to Shanghai. Could you provide us with a quick freight quote?

Also, do you foresee any port draft limitations at Shanghai for this cargo size?

Kind regards,
Charles

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment: Antwerp to Shanghai - Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Charles,

Yes, shipment details received and confirmed!

I would recommend using the Neptun (NEO3) for this route. It's a hybrid vessel with a very low port draft, so there should be no draft limitations for NEO3 when discharging in Shanghai's deepwater port.

Best regards,
Tiffany

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment: Antwerp to Shanghai - Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Tiffany,

Thanks for your quick response. 

For a separate product import I'm planning (yarn and socks - very bulky), which port would you recommend for discharging to minimize draft issues and manpower costs? Thanks!

Best regards,
Charles

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment: Antwerp to Shanghai - Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Charles,

Regarding the yarn and socks shipment: if you have some flexibility on time, we'd recommend a short stop in Nanjing (Nanj). Allowing the vessel 4 days in Nanjing would allow for near-maximum draft utilization at that port, potentially improving overall discharge efficiency.

Nanjing generally has lower manpower and cargo handling costs compared to Shanghai. Considering Shanghai has higher terminal fees and draft constraints, a combined discharging strategy – starting in Nanjing – could be cost-effective.

Best regards,
Tiffany

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment: Antwerp to Shanghai - Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Tiffany,

We are very interested in working with your company. Thank you for your advice. Could you please forward my inquiry to the appropriate department for a more detailed proposal, or provide me with their contact information?

Best regards,
Charles

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Oil Shipment: Antwerp to Shanghai - Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Charles,

Please find my contact details below. I handle all initial inquiries myself and will guide you through the process. Please feel free to contact me directly.

+65 6225 2226
Tiffany Yu (General Manager)

The confiscated records are currently held at the State Department of Public Health.

email_chain.subject: Refrigerated Container Inquiry - Ginger Essential Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Shan,

We are planning to ship 33,000 liters of ginger essential oil from San Francisco to Taipei, packaged in 12" drums. Given the perishable nature of the product, we are interested in using your refrigerated containers. Is this a service you can provide?

Kind regards,
Kate Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Refrigerated Container Inquiry - Ginger Essential Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Kate,

Thank you for your email. We are happy to assist with your refrigerated shipping needs. We frequently use ISO refrigerated containers, which are specifically designed for temperature-sensitive products.

For example, we have successfully shipped large quantities of liquid chocolate spread and spray paint using these containers, maintaining optimal temperatures throughout the journey. We can provide a full ISO container for your ginger essential oil, ensuring its arrival in Taipei in perfect condition. We also offer pickup from your warehouse and delivery to your preferred shipping port.

Please let us know if you have any further questions.

Kind regards,
Mr. Shan

email_chain.subject: Dry Ice Shipment Inquiry - Chicago to Hong Kong
email_chain.body:
Hello,

I am inquiring about the cost of shipping a dry ice shipment from Chicago to Hong Kong. Would a 20ft container be necessary?

Kind regards,
Stacy Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Dry Ice Shipment Inquiry - Chicago to Hong Kong
email_chain.body:
Dear Stacy,

Thank you for your email. A dry ice shipment requires a refrigerated container. To ensure the safe and effective transportation of goods with dry ice, we utilize ISO containers. ISO stands for International Standards Organisation, the body responsible for standardizing shipping container designs.

ISO containers offer several advantages, especially their airtight seal, allowing them to be filled with dry ice (or other refrigerants) and maintain very low temperatures. This makes them ideal for transporting temperature-sensitive goods.

To provide an accurate quote, could you please provide further details about the specific items being shipped, their quantity, and required temperature range?

email_chain.subject: Re: Refrigerated Container Inquiry - Ginger Essential Oil Shipment - Price List and Port Information
email_chain.body:
Dear Kate,

I am glad to hear that you are interested in using one of our ISO refrigerated containers for your ginger oil shipment from San Francisco to Taipei. I have attached a price list for our services to give you an overview of the costs involved.

Our shipping prices are determined by the container size (20’ or 40’) and the distance between your warehouse in San Francisco and the closest port we serve. The attached list includes the ports we serve and their proximity to your location. We offer transportation via road, rail, sea, or air, allowing us to ship your essential oil using the most efficient route. We currently offer shipping to over 200 countries and territories.

Please review the attached documents and let me know if you have any questions.

Kind regards,
Mr. Shan

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Purchase: 20 MT
email_chain.body:
Dear Travis,

Yes, we have 20 MT ready for delivery on February 15, 2016. The FOB price is 141 USD. Shanghai shipping rates are 25 USD per MT. Our EXW rates are 33.75 USD per MT. The Incoterms are FOB = EXW.

We require a buyer prepared to cover the purchase cost plus shipping. If you accept our price, we can arrange delivery from Shanghai to your port.

Please confirm ASAP.

Thanks in advance,
Mylene

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Purchase: 20 MT
email_chain.body:
Thanks, Mylene, for the quick reply. We are interested in purchasing your wheat.

Please provide your bank account details so we can arrange to wire the funds for delivery on the 15th. We anticipate 20MT delivered in 30 days from the invoice date. We will invoice in Canadian dollars, and your company can invoice in RMB.

We will arrange the shipping from Shanghai to Montreal.

Kind regards,
Travis

email_chain.body:
Hey Mateo,

How are you doing?

The onboard fuel tankage on your vessel is decent, but I’m concerned about the fresh water tankage. How does the water demand on board compare to the volume of water you can carry?

That’s it for now. Thanks.

Best,
Martina

email_chain.subject: Offshore Support Vessel Proposal - Water Consumption Data
email_chain.body:
Hi Mateo,

My team is working on our offshore support vessel proposal, and we need to quantify the amount of water on board.

I understand the onboard fresh water tankage is sufficient for three weeks, but does the design include the daily washing needs of the crew? How much water is required for sanitary purposes, laundry, and washing the decks? We also need to calculate the volume of water consumed by the engines for the last five years of operating hours. Are those figures available?

Thanks,
Sharon

Could you please provide your freight charges for this voyage, including any potential late boarding fees?

Sales Team
Example Trading

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Recent Rescue at Sea
email_chain.body:
Dear Capt. Hu,

I am writing to inquire about a recent rescue operation I heard your vessel was involved in. I am deeply concerned about the well-being of a passenger you may have rescued.

Did the rescued individual make it to safety? Is he still alive and, if so, is he doing okay? If he is, I would like to offer some financial assistance.

If providing this information is not possible, could you suggest any other organizations or resources that might be able to help me find out about his well-being?

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
A Concerned Party

email_chain.subject: FOB Shipment Feedback Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

We recently received feedback from one of your previous customers regarding their experiences with FOB shipments handled by your company. We've compiled a brief report summarizing their concerns, which is attached.

Please let me know if you require any further information.

Warmest regards,

Anja

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Shipment Feedback Report
email_chain.body:
Anja,

I reviewed your email from December 1, 2019. To be clear, we haven't been contacted directly by any of your old customers regarding our FOB shipment experiences. Therefore, I'm unsure why we would be receiving a report based on such feedback.

While we're always happy to assist, presenting a point of view without supporting facts seems inappropriate. We don't inherently oppose FOB shipments. We consistently ensure all cargo is fully insured, regardless of the shipping method, covering the full value from our warehouse.

We would appreciate the opportunity to understand the specifics of this feedback and address any potential misconceptions.

Best regards,

Ken

email_chain.subject: Re: FOB Shipment Feedback Report
email_chain.body:
Hello Ken,

Thank you for your prompt response.

I apologize for the confusion. It appears there's been a miscommunication on my end. The report I mentioned was intended for internal use and should not have been sent to you directly. It summarized general industry feedback on FOB shipments, not specifically feedback solicited *from* your customers.

My intention was to open a discussion on FOB shipments and clarify your company's position, as your procedures are often considered best practice.

Again, my apologies for the misdirection. Please disregard the report.

Regards,
Anja

Hi Patrick,

Due to the complexity of these tests, they need to be run in the laboratory. Preparing a lab experiment for this type of request may take several hours. In some cases, the lab will need to send a sample to a third-party lab to be tested, which can take several days. This approach is necessary to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the final results. We are in the 'test' phase currently.

I am available to meet next week, please let me know what day works best for you. 

Regards,
Lab Management

email_chain.subject: Order Processing Confirmation
email_chain.body: I reviewed the order details and confirm that the order should be processed as described. I have forwarded this information to the department heads to update them on the order status.

email_chain.subject: Sample Analysis Update
email_chain.body: I received your email today. I can confirm that the sample was analyzed last Friday.

email_chain.subject: Batch Quality and Supplier Corrective Actions
email_chain.body:
I understand that the batch quality is the reason for rejection, and it will remain unapproved until the supplier implements corrective actions. Unfortunately, this cannot be resolved immediately.

We anticipate that the supplier will take corrective actions within a week. Following this, we can resubmit the request to the Quality Control Program (QCP) for approval. The key is that the corrective actions are effectively implemented and the results are visible to us.

Please note: A specific deadline for implementing the corrective actions should be communicated to the supplier by their contract manager.

email_chain.subject: Quality Review Findings - Supplier Product
email_chain.body:
My colleagues and I have completed a quality review of the product produced by the supplier. Our findings indicate that the company has consistently faced issues with this product since they began production. A review of the product history shows that all products produced have been defective. This violates our established standards, as the supplier lacks documented process controls for their production process.

The supplier has acknowledged working on this for an extended period without success.

I understand you will likely have questions. Please do not hesitate to ask, and feel free to request any information from our team. This is not an ideal situation, but I believe we should collaborate to resolve this issue.

email_chain.subject: PS Irene - Discharged Cargo List & Clearance Deadline
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Taylor,

Please find attached the list of cargo discharged from the PS Irene. As instructed, we require the discharge station to clear all imported goods by May 31, 2017. To ensure timely processing, we anticipate receiving confirmation of clearance on or before May 28, 2017. Please use Letter of Indemnity (LOI) 1001191957, also attached, for the clearance process.

Regards,
Dana Smith

email_chain.subject: Company Introduction and Partnership Opportunity
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

At our company, we are well-known for our sincerity, loyalty, honor, hard work, ethics, and professionalism. We have long-term business relationships with Fortune 500/Global top 500 companies in America, Europe, China, Asia, and the Middle East.

Our main projects include EPC projects for Airports, Power Plants, Steel Plants, and Port projects. We have special relationships with our clients and invite you to learn more about our company.

We have significant projects for Indian real estate and allied services, affiliated with developers who have a very good portfolio of projects. We act as suppliers for these projects.

We would be delighted to have you on board and earn your trust as a partner.

With all regards,
Regards,
Kalavathi Kalvathy

email_chain.subject: RE: Heat Exchanger Spec Sheet
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Kang,

Thank you very much for your message. I am pleased to know that you can provide us with the spec sheet for heat exchangers. We are in the process of selecting the right supplier for the project, and this is very helpful in shortlisting candidates as we can narrow down the scope of the project and have a clearer price estimate.

I have one further question: Are you the manufacturer or a supplier?

Thank you for forwarding the detailed T&D spec sheet along with all the information to our company. We would be grateful if you could share other contact details for your firm, and if your assistant is available by phone. I would appreciate an earliest possible response on this.

Thanking you,
Yours sincerely,
XYZ Project Manager

email_chain.subject: Thank You for Visiting Our Website
email_chain.body:
Hi,

Thank you for visiting our website. You can submit your email query and you will receive our reply as soon as possible.

We provide the most competitive prices, quality products, and services to our customers worldwide, and have long-term business cooperation with many famous European and American enterprises.

In the near future, we will put our price list on our website.

You are welcome to contact us if you have any questions about our product and service, or any other suggestions for developing the business.

With our best regards,
Best Regards,
XYZ
Technical Manager

email_chain.subject: Refrigeration Unit Inquiry
email_chain.body:

I have read your email and am very glad to see that you have interest in our product.

As a supplier of one brand of refrigeration unit (you can find it on Google), our customer business is mainly for refrigeration and air-conditioning units for big stores. Our current capacity is more than 40,000 units per year. If you are interested in our unit, please feel free to contact me.

Sincerely yours,
[Name]

email_chain.subject: Company Introduction - Printing Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Jane,

How are you? I hope you are doing well. My company was recently featured on the website of http://www.globalmarketing.org/.

We would like to introduce our company. We provide color, complete printing services for all your sales, marketing, and printing needs, including business cards, letterheads, envelopes, etc. We also offer personalization services.

email_chain.subject: Generator Pricing Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hey Arjun,

I have a new project where we’re going to need a 4000kVA high-power generator and a 150kVA low-power generator. Can you give me some ballpark pricing estimates, or refer me to a competent electrician if this isn't your area?

Best,
Vlad

email_chain.subject: Re: Generator Pricing Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Arjun,

Hope you're doing well!

I was very impressed with the backyard garden pond you built for me – your work is professional and clean. 

May I ask if your company also handles commercial projects? If so, could you send me some reference projects you've worked on in the past, specifically industrial or power-related ones? 

Best,
Vladimir Ivanov

email_chain.subject: Pricing Spreadsheet Requirements
email_chain.body:
I need a comprehensive spreadsheet with pricing for various power and industrial projects, with a detailed cost breakdown, including materials and labor.

For this, I’ll need a completely separate sheet for each project, as we’re working on several and need to track them individually. Our experience with another company resulted in inflated estimates due to combined material and labor costs. The prices should be straightforward. I only require the overall cost for each project, not a breakdown of every single component.

email_chain.subject: Project Update - Switching Providers
email_chain.body:
Sorry, Arjun.

While I appreciate your past work, the pricing for the last two projects was not satisfactory. I've decided to switch to another electrical company. I hope you understand and there are no hard feelings. 

Best,
Vladi

email_chain.subject: Re: Project Update - Switching Providers
email_chain.body:
Sorry for the delayed response.

I apologize for any interruptions or communication issues on my end. Our company, ProjectPlex, has been growing rapidly and we've also faced some internal challenges recently, which made it difficult to keep up. 

You may recall a few years ago I had a dental procedure that led to some extended downtime. Additionally, my wife and I were experiencing financial constraints, requiring me to take on additional work. This affected my ability to provide timely and accurate service, and possibly influenced the pricing you found unsatisfactory. I am working to resolve these issues and hope to be able to offer more competitive rates in the future.

Again, I apologize for any inconvenience, and I hope we can continue our working relationship in the future.

Best,
Arjun Singh

email_chain.subject: Re: Trading Possibilities - Virus Information
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Allen,

Here is some information about computer viruse.

#### The Nature of Viruses

A virus is a type of computer program, analogous to a self-replicating macro in a word processing program. A virus, once entered into a computer, takes control and executes a program that produces copies of itself. The advantage to a virus over a macro is that a virus is more difficult to detect and may be attached to legitimate files, in order to pass inspection. In other words, a virus is not usually flagged as a virus, even though it performs no legitimate function.

Many emails can be identified as viruses. If you are suspicious, call the person whose email it was, and tell them what it says. You will often find that it is not virus. When they change the text, it is an indication that the email originated as a virus. People are often infected by the virus that is passed in the body of the message, rather than attached to the message as a file. By the way, the name "virus" is appropriate because the virus will only replicate if the user opens the message, either by reading the message itself or by clicking on the attachment.

The more you know about viruses and virus protection, the more difficult it will be for the virus to control your computer.


Best regards,
Dr. Larson

email_chain.subject: Re: Urania - Proposed Environmental Safety Measures
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lin,

Thank you for your email. Regarding your proposal for additional environmental safety measures, the UCRATIS team has decided to take a different approach. We believe that communication with local authorities concerning the tanker Urania is sufficient to ensure environmental safety at this time. We are sharing our communications with nearby towns on this website: https://www.comportadecreciente.com/comporta.html.

The port authority will continue inspections of the lagoons and report to the relevant authorities, which falls outside of our scope. Please refer to the attached annex for information on the port authority's responsibilities.

The final assessment of damages and liability will be determined by a tribunal, not the UCRATIS team.

Best Regards,
The UCRATIS Team

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Request to Ground Vessel Urania in Escombreras Bay
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lin,

The owner and charterer of the vessel Urania have decided to take immediate action and ground the vessel in Escombreras Bay. This decision is due to concerns regarding the cargo spill potentially linked to illegal poaching activities, and the recent incident of the vessel leaving Malaga port for 8 hours without proper documentation.

We request your agreement to allow us to ground the vessel in Escombreras Bay. This action is in compliance with our charter agreement, which our lawyers have advised is a non-arbitral agreement. Please advise on the timeline for obtaining the necessary authorization for this operation.

Best regards,
Jonathan Hagan

email_chain.body:

*   Groupage (24 MT): 210 EUR

Based on my initial margin calculation, FCL shipping appears to be the more cost-effective option.

Thank you for the cost breakdown, Maria.

I've calculated the margin based on a full container load. Assuming a total value of $120,000, and a 12 container run, the margin from Kavala to Odessa would be:

0.  4 * $120,000 / 12 = $4,000

We should be able to offer a surcharge of 400 EUR for any container size, not only a 20ft one. 

Please double-check your calculations and advise.

Thanks,

Jonas

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry - Kavala to Odessa - 2000 MT Chemical Runout

My apologies, the target margin from the market survey is 36%, not 12%. Please confirm your calculations based on this revised figure.

Regards,

Maria Spivakova

email_chain.subject: Missing Word
email_chain.body:
It was one dot instead of two. So we need to find out which word is missing. dot, how? I think the word ‘email’ is missing.

Check the spelling in the third message. If the spelling is right, then it is not the word. Now, is it okay for an English message to have two different spelling of a word?

So, the message 6 above is correct, because the word ‘word’ and ‘word’ can be different. And the word ‘how’ is the word that is missing. So we got it. :)

email_chain.subject: Symbols and Missing Words
email_chain.body:
Symbols and other symbols in writing are a powerful and important tool. They make our writing look professional. It helps us make an impression on our audience. Symbols can be thought of as the ‘stamp of the author’.

It is even more important to use proper grammar,

email_chain.subject: Emailing
email_chain.body:
, for example, when we are emailing or chatting with people.

Now, what about symbols like colon, comma, and semi-colon? How do we use them correctly? I think it is good to learn about proper punctuation for email or writing because it helps to communicate your ideas in a clear and effective manner. So, let’s start with colon ‘:’!

The colon is a punctuation mark that is used to separate a main idea from a supporting one in writing. If we look at the sentence below,

The food was very tasty: I ate two bowls.

We can see that there is a main idea and a supporting one. In this case, the main idea is the food was tasty. And the supporting one is that the person ate two bowls of food.

We are planning a C2C route (coast to coast). We will be adding approximately 500,000 MT of GHT (likely a type of coal or cargo) on each leg of the journey.

I have requested an arrival notice, which you should receive shortly. Following that, we would appreciate it if you could call me to discuss cargo delivery arrangements at your yard.

I am also interested in establishing a more formal relationship with your organization. Could you please provide me with the contact information for your chartering partner, manager, or someone with a similar profile? I would be grateful if you could facilitate that.

Best regards,

Amrita Gomes

email_chain.subject: Coal Cargo Inquiry - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Neko,

We are looking to ship a 6,600 MT cargo of coal from Richards Bay to Maputo next week. Do you have an open slot for this shipment?

Regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Cargo Inquiry - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Olá Adrian,

For the past 6 years, I have been importing timber into Southern Africa. Trade has been spectacular. Before, Canadians and Australians dominated the market. Now, the quantity of product from the forests of Brazil has started to "explode".

However, we are now experiencing transport difficulties. Rio de Janeiro is almost half the distance between Salvador and Maputo. And the Panama Canal is currently stalled with the rain. Is there an available slot to import from BRAZIL to SOUTH AFRICA?

If there is space, please see the price for a quote.

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Cargo Inquiry - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Muito obrigado for your message from yesterday. I am more than happy to know that you are dealing with wood! I only carry grains and boats with my friends from ZIMBABWE and Rwanda. We have no problems transporting grains as long as the canals in the Atlantic Ocean are open.

We have a small venture in Zimbabwe and a unique opening in Rwanda. I wanted to do the whole route to SOUTH AFRICA, but I distrust the Panama Canal. The situation looks very bad at the canal in 2019/2020.

We were able to cross the Atlantic safely. I have a crew member from ...

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Cargo Inquiry - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Meu amigo!

I’m from Mozambique. In the past I bought bulk grains to Angola from Zambia. But today, I am not selling bulk grains anymore. Today I only sell dry bulk fertilizer, hard fertilizers, soft fertilizers, and rocks. I also bought 4x4 vehicles, Mercedes Benz and Toyota Landcruiser for private import.

I now import grains from the USA, Canada, Australia, South Africa and West Africa. Today we bring over a million MTs of fertilizers. I just delivered 2,000MT of potassium chloride fertilizer. I just delivered 50,000MT of Nitrogen fertilizer.

NUFertilizer is a soft fertilizer. We have ready stocks. 500,000MT in storage. Usually, we ship weekly. But this week we are running low on stocks.

email_chain.subject: Regarding Our Shipping Partnership
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Davis,

We want to express our sincere appreciation for the excellent job you and your team have been doing with our shipping over the past year. We have seen significant improvements in your processes, efficiency, and accuracy, and we are very grateful for your dedication.

As you know, at [Shipper's Name], our priority is to provide safe, efficient, and reliable transportation, and we recognize that you share these values. For this reason, we wanted to inform you that we have begun working with another carrier on a trial basis.

They are offering lower rates at this time. However, you have consistently proven yourselves to be a trustworthy and reliable partner. If you find that your costs are higher than the rates being offered, please don't hesitate to let us know.

Although we are exploring a different provider, we remain committed to our relationship with you and will be happy to assist you in any way we can. Let us know if you have any questions.

Sincerely,
[Shipper's Name] Team

email_chain.subject: [Position] Opportunity at Company B
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Davis,

We hope you are doing well.

Our company is interested in discussing the possibility of you joining us as a [Position]. We were impressed with your resume on file and believe your skills and experience could be a valuable asset to our team.

In the meantime, we have several other similar positions available that might also be of interest. Please see the attached document for details, including comparable benefits and information about our supportive work environment. Feel free to apply for any roles that align with your career goals.

We would be happy to answer any questions you may have and hope to speak with you soon.

Sincerely,
[Your name]
Recruiting Team, Company B

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Quote Request - Polyethylene Sheeting Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Ashley,

I sent you an email yesterday at 2:58 PM asking you to quote on the polyethylene sheeting shipment.

Please get back to me with the pricing so we can lock in our spot and avoid the possibility of a cancelled order and costly delays.

Thanks,
Alison

email_chain.subject: Regarding Polyethylene Sheeting Shipment - Delayed?
email_chain.body:

The container was supposed to ship on Thursday. What happened? Did you receive my email?

Thanks,
Jasmine

email_chain.subject: Re: Regarding Polyethylene Sheeting Shipment - Delayed?
email_chain.body:
Jasmine,

Yes, I did receive the email. I was going to call you this morning. Can you give me a call back when you get a chance?

Thanks,
Barry

email_chain.subject: RE: Regarding Polyethylene Sheeting Shipment - Delayed?
email_chain.body:
Hi Barry,

How are you doing?

I just received your call back. I have spoken to Alin and she advised me that she has spoken to the shipping line. There was a minor documentation issue which has now been resolved and the container is expected to sail tomorrow.

Thanks,
Jasmine

email_chain.subject: Invoice and Refund Request
email_chain.body:

Please refund $2500 for labor and materials to the following account:

Bank Account Name:
Bank Address:
Routing Number:
Account Number:

Thanks,
Allyson

email_chain.subject: Re: Invoice and Refund Request
email_chain.body:
Allyson,

Sorry about that. I have resent the invoices and will refund your money. Thanks for understanding.

Barry

email_chain.subject: Re: Invoice and Refund Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Barry,

Thanks for the refund!

Is this container fully loaded?

Let me know.
Allison

email_chain.subject: Re: Invoice and Refund Request
email_chain.body:

Yes, the container is fully loaded.

Thanks,
Barry

email_chain.subject: Re: Invoice and Refund Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Barry,

Thank you.

Do you have the container number yet?

Allison

email_chain.body:

I'm arranging for the shipment of 3,200 MT of green coffee from Sousse to Glasgow. Could you please advise if you have availability to accommodate this in early October? Also, what is your standard demurrage clause?

Ana Lopez

email_chain.subject: Re: Green Coffee Shipment Inquiry - Sousse to Glasgow
email_chain.body:
Dear Ana,

I can potentially have a vessel available to load at the port in Sousse towards the end of September, aiming for arrival in Glasgow in early October. Our standard demurrage is 28 days, aligned with what our other suppliers require to facilitate early clearance.

Best regards,
Robert Hardy

email_chain.subject: Re: Green Coffee Shipment Inquiry - Sousse to Glasgow
email_chain.body:
Dear Ana,

Thank you for your email. The coffee package you're offering looks promising for the market. However, thank you for the offer. Unfortunately, the container arrival is scheduled for early October, which will be too late for the market to absorb the volume.

Best regards,
Robert Hardy

email_chain.subject: Re: Green Coffee Shipment Inquiry - Sousse to Glasgow
email_chain.body:
